loans.name: Shno's Group

texts.en:
Shno is a 37-year-old Iraqi woman, married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Shno is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has two years' experience with the little sewing and tailoring business and she would like to improve both her work conditions and the services she can offer to her customers. She would like to renew her work area and buy an overlock machine. To be able to do the work and make the purchase, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and purchase an overlock machine.

loans.name: Al-Adala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-adala. It is made up of six women. They have applied for a loan of 230,000 YER. Saeedh is a 40-year-old mother of nine children living in Hodaidh, Yemen. She is the group's leader and is responsible for them. 

Saeedh is helping her family's business, which is selling clothes and perfumes. She has been doing this for three years. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. Saeedh will use her portion of the loan to buy clothes and perfumes for her business. She hopes to open a clothing store so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for her busines.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 30 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia, la que pudo edificar gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo, allí está con a sus tres hijos y su pareja desde hace muchos años y por quienes da lo mejor de sí día a día para brindarles la calidad de vida que se merecen.

Él se dedica a hacer taxi, tiene su auto propio que logró comprar tras muchos años de ahorro y aunque no estaba nuevo cuando lo compró, no dudó en acondicionarlo y empezar a trabajar con él. Algunas veces trabaja con clientes particulares que lo contratan por largas horas, llegando a cubrir su ingreso diario con un solo servicio durante el día. Lleva en este negocio 12 años, los primer seis los hizo en un vehículo alquilado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede ir de un lugar a otro y disfrutar de su recorrido, además le permite tener tiempo disponible para dedicárselo a sus hijos. Espera continuar trabajando, ya que más adelante desea establecer un negocio en su casa.  

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que ponen en él para acceder a este crédito y continuar hasta lograr sus objetivos. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y por otra parte, asegura estar muy tranquilo en su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 500 nuevos soles, comprará algunos repuestos que necesita para la refacción de su vehículo, también pagará al mecánico que le brindará tal servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, is a tenacious and hard-working man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He lives in a house that he owns, one he was only able to build after much hard work.  His hope, he says, is to provide a better life for his partner and three children.

Carlos operates a taxi business.  He managed to buy his taxi after many years of scrimping and saving.  He couldn't afford a new vehicle so he bought a used one and fixed it up.  He sometimes carries passengers who contract with him for several hours work at a time, work that supplements the normal taxi services that he provides most days.  He has operated the business for 12 years, the first six of which he could only afford a rented vehicle.  What he most likes about the work, he says, is the chance to go to and fro and to see his children when he wants.  He hopes to continue this business and start another one in the future.    

This is his first MFP loan.  He says that he is grateful for your help and confidence because the loan will help him meet his goals.  He says, too, that he is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time and that he is happy with his community bank because he considers the majority of its members to be responsible and supportive.
Carlos will use this 500 new soles loan to pay for the labor and spare parts he needs to maintain his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ashna's Group

texts.en:
Ashna is a 40-year-old mother of three children. She is an Iraqi married woman and  with limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has three years' experience with the small business activity, making dresses and small fabric household items. In order to improve her work conditions she would like to renew her work area and she would also like to buy an overlock machine to provide new services to her customers. To be able to pay for the work and make the purchase, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and purchase an overlock machine

loans.name: Hawzhin's Group

texts.en:
Hawzhin is a young Iraqi woman. She is 21 years old and married. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hawzhin is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Having started with sewing at an early age, Hawzhin has eight years' experience already making custom-ordered fabric items and dresses. She has great skills, and to improve the ways she can use her skills she would like to buy a new sewing machine and some nice quality fabrics and raw materials. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International – Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International – Microfinance Iraq offers 'Group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor – thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some nice quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is 29 years old and a married woman who is responsible for a lovely kid. She lives with her family in Baray, a district of Kompong Tom province. Yem grows rice and works as a traditional Khmer singer around the province. She is well-known for her lovely voice. Her specialty is singing at wedding parties. 

Yem has a lot free time if there are no weddings taking place. Consequently, she wants to spend her available time operating a general store from her home. Because of inadequate capital, Yem would like to take out a loan to set up the business. She will add this amount to her existing money to build a store and to purchase merchandise to sell, such as grocery items, sweets, snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and household products. She hopes that her family's living conditions will be much better in the future.

loans.use: to build a store and to purchase merchandise to sell, such as grocery items, sweets, snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and household products.

loans.name: Aliaa

texts.en:
Aliaa is a very hard-working and committed woman. Running her small home kindergarten is one of the greatest things she is doing.

Now she wishes to get another loan so she can rent an independent space to start her official kindergarten and be able to take more kids in and increase her profits.

loans.use: to rent an independent space to start her official kindergarten

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is a 37-year-old married woman and is blessed with a teenage child who is enrolled in a local school. Kim lives in a peaceful village in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She and her spouse agreed to educate their child through college and to help him earn a bachelor's degree. 

Kim is involved in two businesses at the same time: rice farming and hog-raising, while her husband fishes along the Tonle Sap River. Kim has been managing her businesses for over 10 years. As a result, she can use her income to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Kim is requesting credit from kind lenders in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase five piglets. Also, with the remaining funds she will to purchase fishing nets for her husband. This loan will help her current business as well as her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets and fishing nets.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a 38-year-old mother of three.  Her children are 21, 16 and 3.  She is honest and hard-working.

Zulaika's successful clothing store caters to women from far and wide near her shop. She sells both casual and formal wear.  Her dream is that she will be profitable enough to enjoy a happy life with her children and future grandchildren for years to come, but she faces competition and a lack of capital to grow her business. Thankfully, Kiva will provide her with 2,000,000 UGX with your help. Zulaika's loan will be used to buy more garments for her shop to increase the selection she has on offer.  

Zulaika is shown in the photo with her children in her clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy more garments for her shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 28 años, es una mujer joven, alegre y amable. Con su pareja tiene dos hijos, de 6 y 4 años, viven en su casa propia, la que consiguieron gracias a su trabajo de ella y su cónyuge.
Elle tiene una tienda que ha establecido en su vivienda, donde ofrece víveres y otros artículos como agujas, hilos y demás de uso domestico. También vende gaseosas y cervezas. Lleva 3 años realizando este trabajo y lo hace al lado de su pareja, quien se encarga de realizar y transportar toda la mercadería. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite, principalmente, ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas escolares; así mismo la gran acogida de clientela que llega a su tienda le brinda mucha seguridad económica. Le está yendo muy bien y en este período tiene pensado expandir la infraestructura de su local.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que ponen en ella para acceder a este crédito y continuar hasta lograr sus objetivos. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, y por otra parte asegura estar muy tranquila en su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 500 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería conformada en sacos de arroz, azúcar y algunas cajas de cerveza y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Clara, 28, is a friendly young woman.  She and her partner have two children, 6- and 4-years old, respectively.  They live in a house that they own, one they were able to pay for thanks to their hard work.
Clara has a general store that she operates from a space in her house.  She sells general merchandise along with specialty products such as needles and thread.  She has operated the business for 3 years.  She works with her partner who is in charge of buying and transporting the merchandise.  What she most likes about the business, she says, is that it gives her enough spare time to help her children with their homework.  She adds that the business attracts a steady stream of customers, something that ensures a level of economic security.  The business is successful and she wants to expand it in the future.

This is her first MFP loan.  She says that she is grateful for your help and confidence because the loan will help her meet her goals.  She says, too, that she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time and that she is happy with her community bank because she considers the majority of its members to be responsible and supportive.
Clara will use this 500 new soles loan to stock her store with the merchandise--rice, sugar, beer, soft drinks, etc.--that she needs to operate.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut, aged 26, lives happily with her spouse and a small kid in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She mainly focuses on a business she runs from her home, selling groceries and household products. She loves to chat with her customers to build good relations with people in her community. From this business, Khut can pay for food, daily expenditures, and her child's school. Another main source of income comes from her husband operating a firewood trading business. 

In order to elevate her standard of living and yield a better profit, Khut plans to run a corn selling business. She will buy corn from domestic farmers in bulk each harvest season to stock and distribute to local markets. To achieve this goal, Khut would like to borrow KHR 2,000,000 to supplement her capital to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for distributing large amounts of corn.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for distributing large amounts of corn.

loans.name: Na’Ayem

texts.en:
Na’ayem is a conservative person, and for that reason she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Na’ayem is a 41-year-old woman living with her husband and children in Madaba. She has been supporting her husband's small business which is selling coffee on a small coffee cart around the neighborhood and at tourist sites. She hopes to get the loan so she can add variety to the drinks they serve and expand the services to increase the profits and help her husband with the household and all the expenses.

loans.use: to add variety to the drinks they serve

loans.name: Mathayel

texts.en: Mathayel is a 44-year-old mother of eight. She lives with her kids and husband in Karak. She owns and runs a small mini-market to help her husband with the household expenses. She wishes to get a loan so she can expand her market, and get more variety of products so she can serve a larger group of people.

loans.use: to get more variety of products

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en: Hiam is a second-year student at a governmental university, majoring in Statistics. She hopes to get the loan so she can pay for her semester and get to finish her schooling and also help her family with the expenses.

loans.use: pay for her semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more raw materials

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 40-year-old wife with four children who lives with her family in Karak. She runs her small home business producing various dairy products and pickles. She hopes to get a loan so she can buy more raw materials and expand her market share in her area to include more people and not just her friends and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and expand her market share.

loans.name: Angello

texts.en:
Angello is a 45-year-old married man with five children ages 17,10, 8, 6 and 3. Four of his children go to school and the other will start school soon.  

His construction business has been in operation since 1990 and, through hard work, Angello has prospered through the years. He sells mainly to traders who bring his goods to other areas of Uganda. Because of the different types of products he has on hand at any given time, Angello's main challenge in business is price fluctuations and the losses they can sometimes create. In the future, Angello would like to grow his business so he can keep providing for his family. His loan of 2,500,000 UGX will be used to buy more construction materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 30-year-old single man. He has two dependents living in his home who attend school in the area. 

Ben works seven days a week making and selling clothes. Even though he is young, he has been in this business for 12 years and wants to continually expand what he offers and how he runs his business. His clients are from all around his town. The main challenges that he faces are the costs of transporting his materials and clothes as well as customers not paying him for their orders. He is a man of integrity in his business dealings, making him an ideal client for UGAFODE and Kiva. His loan of 500,000 UGX will be used to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 45-year-old married man with six children. He and his family live in Taiz, Yemen. He has owned a house. He has a good reputation and his smile is apparent to everyone. 

He is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances for his house.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 46 years old and married with five children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell at her general store.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and vegetables and raising livestock.

Merlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina tiene 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de sobresalir y progresar. Convive durante muchos años con Marcos, quien trabaja como carpintero, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos de 21, 18, 14, 10 y 8 años.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, para eso tiene un pequeño puesto ambulatorio ubicado  cerca al paradero de vehículos de transporte de pasajeros. Brinda alimentos a los viajeros que ocasionalmente pasan por la zona, su trabajo empieza en las mañanas y culmina pasado el mediodía. Lleva realizando este negocio un poco más de un año y se inició debido a la necesidad económica que atravesaba, y desde el primer instante contó el apoyo de su hija mayor quien la ayuda en sus ratos libres atendiendo a los clientes o acondicionando los utensilios. Desde hace unos meses complementa esta labor con otro negocio que también le está generando buenas ganancias, que es la compra y venta de granos como arroz, maíz y frijoles. Ahora se está proyectando a la ampliación de su negocio y para el futuro tener un restaurante.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, es por eso que agradece a todos los que le están brindando la ayuda que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asegura que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Y se siente muy cómoda trabajando dentro del grupo al que pertenece, ya que ha observado que todos sus miembros son personas unidas y solidarias entre sí. 
El monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra, al por mayor, de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Constantina, 43, is a tenacious, hard-working woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She and her partner, Marcos, a carpenter, have five children, 21-, 18-, 14-, 10- and 8-years old, respectively.  She has a food business that she operates from a small stand near a passenger transport stop and her customers are people that pass through on their way to and from the stop.  She works from morning to early afternoon.  She has operated the business for a little more than a year, a business she started because she needed the money.  Her oldest daughter has helped her with the business from the beginning, waiting on customers and taking care of the kitchen.  Constantina expanded the business several months ago, adding sales of basic grains--rice, maize, beans--to supplement her food stall income.  The extra business has also been a success and now she hopes to open a restaurant.  

This is her second MFP loan.  She says that she is grateful for your help because the loan will help her meet her goals.  She says, too, that she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time and that she is happy with her community bank because she considers its members to be responsible and supportive.
Constantina will use this 800 new soles loan to buy bulk supplies of the products she needs to operate her food business.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of the products she needs for her food business.

loans.name: Garden View Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her late 30s, is single with two children who attend school. She has had a hotel business for five years now. She works from 7.00 am to 3.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chairs and tables and replace plates and saucepans. She has repaid all her loans successfully. She wants this loan to open another hotel in a different area. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a car.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Garden View," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another hotel in a different place.

loans.name: Genema

texts.en:
Genema is 59 years old and married with 7 children.

Genema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Genema has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and vegetable vending.

Genema aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old, married with 5 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a chicken-raising business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Elsie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elsie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Kalondu

texts.en:
Kalondu is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery stall in her home. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables including mangoes, bananas, tomatoes, etc. She has been running the stall for two years and also earns an income from farming.

Kalondu has requested a KES 35,000 loan through Yehu to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall. She has borrowed and repaid two loans from Yehu before this loan. She therefore has a good repayment history and she is sure that she will repay this loan on time.

Kalondu aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant business.

Estelita has been in this business for 18 years. Estelita earns more income from general store and fishing.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more raw ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Gina has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from fish vending and pig fattening.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Marife works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marife is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her fruit and vegetable business.

Marife has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Vicenta has been in this business for 27 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Vincenta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish business. Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 37, is married with 4 children, all attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Alicia requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta tiene 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, con quien tuvo muchos años de convivencia, ahora vive en compañía de sus hijos de 23, 21 y 12 años, en la casa que construyó con ayuda de su ex cónyuge.

Su actividad es la venta de carne de pollo, para eso coloca, todos los días, una mesa en el frontis de casa y ahí exhibe su producto. A diario se abastece de las aves vivas comprando en la granja de su hermano, quien le vende a un precio preferencial. En la zona donde vive es la única que tiene este tipo de negocio, este detalle ha hecho que la demanda por su trabajo se vea en constante crecimiento y que su clientela aumente con el paso del tiempo. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 7 años, invierte gran parte del día dedicándose a esta función, cuenta con la ayuda frecuente de sus hijos que la apoyan desde la compra y preparación de las aves hasta la venta. Viendo los buenos resultados planea abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito. Por otro lado, se siente bien trabajando con los miembros de su banco comunal, pues los considera un grupo unido y responsable.
El monto solicitado, de 2500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos para la venta en su negocio, con el saldo comprará abarrotes de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceites, panes, harina, embutidos gaseosas, golosinas, algunas frutas y verduras) para iniciar su bodega.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 43, is a tenacious, hard-working woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She separated from the father of her children after many years together and now lives with her children, 23-, 21- and 12-years old, respectively, in a house that she bought with her ex-partner.

Jacinta operates a meat sales business.  She has a food stand that she sets up in her front yard where she can meet her customers.  She buys live chickens from her brother's farm, chickens that her brother sells to her at a discounted rate.  The business is the only one of its kind in the neighborhood and has steadily grown as more and more of her neighbors have come to buy her chickens.  She has operated the business for 7 years and spends much of her day tending it.  She relies on her children who often help her with everything from buying and preparing the chickens to selling them.  For the future, she wants to build on the business by opening a grocery.  

This is her 4th MFP loan.  She says that she is grateful for your help and confidence because the loan will help her meet her goals.  She says, too, that she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time and that she is happy with her community bank because she considers its members to be responsible and supportive.
Jacinta will use part of this 2500 new soles loan to buy more chickens for her meat business and the rest to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, eggs, cooking oil, bread, flour, soft drinks, snacks, fruits, vegetables) to start a grocery business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
This is Pedro, he previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Pedro dreams to grow his business soon through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a flower retail business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of flowers to sell.

Amabel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the flower business for six years and also earns an income from farming flowers.

Amabel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza is 21 years old and married. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. Annaliza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Annaliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Bapak Asep owns a small space consisting of a small grocery store and also a mobile phone shop. In his small grocery store he sells basic items such as rice, cooking oil, cleaning items, coffees, teas, breads and snacks. He lives in Bogor Barat, a city about 1-1.5 hour drive from Jakarta. The reason Bapak Asep wanted to become a Loket Ruma agent is so that he can generate more income for himself. The money will be used to actually pay guarantee the electronic data capture machine that will be used to create the payment transaction from the customer. 

Loket Ruma is a new bill payment product that helps Ruma’s agents become payment points. The important thing about becoming a Loket Ruma agent is that Bapak Asep can serve his community. His customers can pay their monthly bills and needs through him, especially for electricity, water and motorcycle installments. A payment point is needed because to access banks and ATMs, the electricity hub, water company or post office is far. It will cost more money and is time consuming for people to go to there.

Bapak Asep really hopes that by becoming a Loket Ruma agent, his business will rapidly grow.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo tiene 42 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Miriam, quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años.
Su principal actividad es la siembra de cacao, tiene una amplia extensión de terreno sembrada con este cultivo el cual cosecha de manera periódica, luego almacena el producto y cuando tiene acumulado una cantidad considerable transporta su mercadería hasta la ciudad capital donde consigue que le paguen buenos precios. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad cerca de 10 años, cuenta con el apoyo de algunos obreros que contrata de manera eventual para que lo apoyen en labores de cosecha y mantenimiento de las plantas. Paralelamente, se dedica a la albañilería, lo hace en sus ratos libres y esto le permite ir logrando mayor adiestramiento e incrementar sus conocimientos, lo que le ha servido para ser requerido cada vez con más frecuencia. Tiene planes de asistir a algún taller de capacitación en construcción para mejorar su labor.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo cual agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder a este crédito. Afirma que se siente a gusto trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues los considera un grupo unido y desea que continúen así.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará abono en sacos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao y contratará personal para realizar dicha labor. El resto del dinero lo usará en la compra de algunas herramientas de albañilería.
texts.en:
Evaristo, 42, is a tenacious, hard-working man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He and his partner, Miriam, a merchant, have two children, 17- and 12-years old, respectively.  
Evaristo grows cacao for a living.  He owns a farm where he grows and harvests his crop.  He stores it and when he has enough to sell, takes it to the capital where he can get the best price for it.  He has operated the business for 10 years.  He relies on temporary day laborers to help him plant and care for the farm.  He supplements his income with construction work, work that he does in his spare time both to earn extra money and to build his skills and knowledge.  The knowledge he's gained has led, he says, to ever more work and he's now planning to join a training workshop so that he can further improve his skills.

This is his second MFP loan and he says that he is grateful for your help because the loan will help him meet his goals.  He adds that he likes working with the members of his community bank because its members are supportive.  He hopes to go on working with them.
Evaristo will use part of this 1000 new soles loan to pay for labor and sacks of organic manure for his farming business and the rest to buy tools for his construction work.

loans.use: to buy both supplies for his farming business and tools for construction work.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Loh is 57 years old and a widow. Presently she resides with her son, a daughter-in-law, and some grandchildren in Reussey Keo district, a suburb of Phnom Penh. Loh is operating a small general store in front of her house, selling various things, including snacks, spices, and grocery items. Loh is very industrious in her business to earn income to help her family. She typically earns an average of 3 USD per day. She has been in this business for more than five years.

Loh has had one previous loan with HKL and now she would like to obtain another loan for 200 USD to build a toilet for home use. She wants to offer her family the ability to live in healthier conditions. She hopes that lenders will help her again in supporting her family. She is very thankful to lenders and will pay her loan back on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a toilet for home use

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 52 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Lani has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock. Lani aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Leizel has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for five years and also earns an income from fishing. Leizel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 59, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. A widow, she is a mother to her children. She manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She makes profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a direct selling business for her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Angela hopes to expand her business and to have a bigger stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Luisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a flower retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the flower retail business for eight years and also earns an income from farming flowers.

Mary Ann aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. Myrna has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from frozen foods.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 33 years old and married with 4 children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a flower retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of flowers to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the flower retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming flowers.

Rosalinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 36 years old and married with 4 children.

Bebelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Bebelyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Bebelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 4 est composé de six personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florence Nikè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florence Nikè est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Appolinaire. Florence Nikè a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florence Nikè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Florence Nikè vend des produits de beauté et des mèches dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Florence Nikè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Florence Nikè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 4, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 4 comprises six persons who reside in the same district. This is the sixth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Florence Nikè, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and married to a man named Appolinaire. She left school at the elementary level. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Florence Nikè lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in the different household expenses.

To help with the different household expenses, Florence Nikè sells beauty products and hair extensions in her neighborhood. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Florence Nikè and the other members of the group GBENONKPO TONAFA 4 are requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and grow their customer base and revenues. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 6 est composé de six personnes qui mènent des activités complémentaires. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Eric est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eric est âgé de 32 ans et est un célibataire. Eric a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Eric vit seul et assure seul ses différents besoins. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Eric vend des friperies de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Eric s’approvisionne dans un marché et dans une boutique du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Eric sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 6, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 6 comprises six persons who operate complementary businesses. The group's representative, Eric, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 32 years old and unmarried. He halted his studies in secondary school. 

Eric lives by himself and ensures that his own different needs are met. To do so, he sells secondhand clothing door to door. This business enables him to support himself without much problem. He gets his supplies from a market and a shop in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Eric and the other members of the group GBENONKPO TONAFA 6 are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to boost their businesses and to grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de tullmas, tejido de chompas, elaboración de repostería, tejido de mantas, venta de ensalada de frutas y cremas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosalía es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace tres años integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de tullmas, ella cuenta que este oficio lo adquirió cuando ayudaba a realizar estas artesanías a su Tía y posteriormente emprendió su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar el negocio (compra de lana de alpaca para tejer las tullmas) mismo que comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Associación Comunal “YUNGUYO” (Yunguyo Communal Bank) will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group is composed of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Rosalía. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various activities such as food selling, selling of tullmas (hair braiding decorations), jumpers weaving, pastry making, blankets weaving, selling fruit salads and creams.

Rosalía is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Rosalía says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, and that she has been invited to enter by one of the promoters of this institution. She currently runs a sewing workshop where she creates tullmas, and she says she has learned this profession while helping her aunt creating this same craft, and that she later on decided to start her own activity.

The loan she in now requesting will be used to diversify her activity by buying alpaca wool in the fairs of the town of El Alto. She will knit the wool into sweaters to then sell it in her stall. This type of activity helps her earning an income to support her family as much as she can, as she is married and has six children.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the saving.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Firengiz

texts.en:
Firengiz is a 55-year-old women who is married with one daughter. For the past 20 years, she has been a vendor who sells different kind of goods, such as candy, cookies, butter, macaroni, and beverages, in her shop. Firengiz considers herself to be a knowledgeable and skilled person. The products she sells are very popular in Azerbaijan and quickly leave her shelves. She makes 200 AZN profit. 

Firengiz is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history. Firengiz hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas and coconuts to resell

loans.name: Marrash

texts.en:
Marrash is in her mid-sixties and married. Her children are grownups and none of them are attending school at the moment. They all live in northwest Albania, where the extreme cold weather can be hard on animals, just like it can be hard on people. Yet, Marrash has found her ways of taking care of her animals.

Marrash has been selling milk and animals to the local market for the past twenty years and has built a steady clientele that she is happy with. Her husband, in the photo, has been helping her out as well. Profit hasn’t been bad either, yet at the moment the cow they have is growing older and doesn’t produce as much milk as before. Marrash is now planning to replace it with another cow for milk.

This is her fourth time requesting a loan, with the previous ones being fully paid off. She is aware that she is applying to KIVA for this loan through VisionFund Albania and cannot hide her appreciation for all potential lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow from a good breed.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a conservative person, she asked her husband who is the owner of the business to take her place in the photo.
Ayda is a supportive and helpful wife living in Mafraq with her husband. She helps her husband with the store they own, as he fixes ovens and other home appliances. They wish to open a second branch hoping to increase their sales and reach more customers.

loans.use: to open a second branch.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a small grocery store which she has been running for two years. The store is located in her own home so that she doesn't have to neglect her family. This is how she helps cover her household expenses. Sidi is a very visionary woman, as she saw that there were no stores where she lives and so started her business. She also wanted to feel useful and for her husband to be proud of her. 

Sidi is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy more products for her store, such as tomatoes, onions, mangoes, etc. Her aim is to strengthen her business, improve her profits, and cover her family's needs. One of these needs is providing her children with an education.

Sidi says that she plans to use the profits that she makes from this investment to save up so that she can start a kiosk business.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store, such as tomatoes, onions, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 42 years old and married with 7 children.

Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Chona has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling hardware merchandise and retailing rice.

Chona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 51 years old, and is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Estelita has a fishing/fish selling business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 60,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for repairing her fishing boat.

Estelita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 8 est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Katia Hilda est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Katia Hilda est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Katia Hilda vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Katia Hilda vend des tissus, des produits de beauté et des mèches de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Katia Hilda s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Katia Hilda sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 8, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 8 comprises eight persons who reside in the same district. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Katia Hilda, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and married to a man named Antoine. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Katia Hilda lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in the different household expenses.

To help with the different household expenses, Katia Hilda sells beauty products and hair extensions door to door. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Katia Hilda, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO TONAFA 8, is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and grow their customer base and revenues.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, beauty products, and hair extensions

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Ibu Siti is how people generally call her. She lives in Cilegon, about 2-2.5 hours drive in normal traffic from Jakarta. She owns a shop that sells some basic items like sugar, coffee, milk, tea, thick soya sauces, spices and some snacks. She is married and has three kids, ages 11, 9 and 7 years old. Her husband works as an employee for a private company. 

By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, Ibu Siti will not only be known as a woman who sells goods, but also a service provider with a payment point. Loket Ruma is an important service product that allows the agent to be a payment point. It means the customer will come to Ibu Siti not only to buy goods but also to pay their monthly bills or buy prepaid items – such as electricity bills, water bills, post paid phone bills and also prepaid airtime minutes. The electronic data capture is a machine that helps Ibu Siti to create payment/buying transactions in her shop. 

A payment point like Ibu Siti's is needed in her neighbourhood because it is really hard to access banks and ATMs, the electricity hub, water company or post office as they are far away. It will cost more money and is time consuming for people to go to there. Therefore, by having this new service product, she hopes it will make it easier for people to pay bills and reach the target of transactions.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en: A 28-year-old young lady, Ms. Chinyavu is married to a businessman and the mother of a 7-year-old son. She works selling fruits and vegetables in a small stall located opposite her house. She has been doing this since last year. At times, she also sells green maize. She is on her second loan from Yehu and the first with Kiva. She is seeking this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. She would like to increase her stock in order to satisfy her numerous customers. Her hope for the future is to have her own shop and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old, married, and has six children.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.  She also earns an income from fish vending. 

Virgina is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more grocery items such as laundry soap, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.  Virginia aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as laundry soap, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio es un hombre de 38 años, honesto, amable y muy trabajador. Tiene 12 años de convivencia junto a Rosa, con quien tiene un hijo de 11 años.
Hace 2 años que tiene una tienda de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su casa, para la atención le ayuda su cónyuge. Esta actividad le ha permitido generar los ingresos que necesita para sobrellevar los gastos básicos que se presentan en su hogar. Por otro parte, tiene tiempo para realizar su otro trabajo que es la siembra de plátano, maíz, yuca, “ají charapita” y otros más, de acuerdo a la temporada. Lo que le gusta de esta función es que ha aprendido de manera personal el comportamiento de las plantas, de acuerdo a las condiciones climáticas y eso le genera una gran satisfacción. Por otra parte le agrada poder generar ganancias en su hogar con la venta de abarrotes. Antes de iniciar estos negocios trabajaba para otras personas y tenía ganancias muy bajas; esto fue uno de los motivos que lo impulsaron a independizarse, ahora le va mucho mejor y siente que está en el camino correcto hacia el progreso.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP y está muy agradecido al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000), comprará semilla certificada de maíz para empezar con la siembra. También invertirá en la compra de arroz y azúcar, en sacos, para seguir vendiendo en su bodega.
texts.en:
Eladio, 38, is an honest, kind and very hardworking man.  He’s been living with Rosa for 12 years and they have an 11-year-old son.  He’s had a grocery and basic staple items store at home for two years that his spouse helps him tend to.  This activity has made it possible for him to generate income needed to cover basic household expenses.  

On the other hand, he has time available to do his other work which is growing bananas, corn, manioc, tropical chilies and others according to the season.  What he likes about this is that he’s learned through experience how the plants behave according to weather conditions and this gives him much satisfaction.  He also likes to be able to generate profits for his home through his grocery sales.  Prior to starting these businesses he worked for others and his profits were small; this was one of the motivating factors that pushed him to become independent and now he does much better and feels he’s on the right path towards progress.

This is MFP loan #17 and he’s very grateful to know that he’ll have financial support and commits once again to make his installment payments punctually like he’s done in previous loans.  He’s also very happy to be part of his communal bank because all its members are very responsible and mutually supportive.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy certified corn seeds to start to plant and will also buy sacks of rice and sugar to continue selling in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and also to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ositos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Ositos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ángela del Socorro quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 5 años.  El negocio lo inicio vendiendo quesillo con las ganancias invirtió en granos básicos  y poco a poco fue surtiendo la venta.
Los otros integrantes son José quien vende bolis y gelatina y Mercedes quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
Los Ositos group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Ángela del Socorro, who has had a grocery store for five years.  She began the business selling "quesillo" cheese, and with her profits she invested in staple items and gradually stocked the store.

The other members are José, who sells "bolis" soft drinks and gelatin, and Mercedes, who has had a grocery store for four years.

loans.use: to buy staples, meat, etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion, 53, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is single and she manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Salvacion operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy candy and toy products from wholesalers, then she repacks them and sells them for a little profit. Her products are assorted candies, toys and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to her business due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more candies and toy products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Salvacion dreams of growing her business soon and she hopes to help her siblings and loved ones through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of candies and toy products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ouy's Group

texts.en:
Ouy is 42 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district, Cambodia. To earn a living, she grows vegetables such as chilies, eggplants, and cabbage, which she has been doing for 21 years. Her husband supplements the family income by working for others for a fee.  

Ouy has been with VisionFund for eight cycles while the other member of her group is in her first cycle. The past loans have helped Ouy relieve her family’s burden and set aside funds to buy extra plots of land. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Ouy is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds to boost her crop yields.  She will also use a portion on labor costs. Her crop yields being destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her livelihood and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and seeds for her crop yields.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora, cordial, amable y empeñosa. Es soltera, pero tiene un hijo pequeño, producto de su relación con su ex cónyuge. Vive en su casa propia al lado de sus padres, hermanos y su hijo.
Su actividad es la venta de comidas típicas de la región y otros de consumo diario. Su faena empieza desde muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación, vende todo el día, desde desayunos, almuerzos y algunos platillos nocturnos. Tiene instalado su puesto de comida en la vereda de su casa y siempre está en continua actividad, lleva en este negocio 7 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su madre y de su hermana. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su familia con los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo porque le permite brindarle a su hijo todo lo que necesita, durante mucho tiempo ha tenido muchas necesidades económicas por la falta de trabajo o negocios que no le brindaban satisfacción, ni tranquilidad, pero ahora se siente más aliviada porque tiene un oficio que le apasiona y la ha ayudado en mucho. Ahora tiene planes de alquilar un local y ampliar su negocio donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar trabajando y pueda concretar sus planes. Se compromete a ser una socia puntual y pagar sus cuotas de manera responsable. Afirma que se siente tranquila y agradecida con su asesor de créditos por toda la orientación y las capacitaciones que le ha brindado para emprender este nuevo camino. 

Con el monto solicitado, de 700 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz, aceite, condimentos, azúcar, especias, verduras y tubérculos. Diariamente invierte un promedio de 150 soles, también comprará algunos utensilios para brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Lidia, 30, is a hardworking, cordial, kind and enterprising woman.  She’s single but has a little boy who is the result of her relationship with her ex-spouse.  She lives in her own house with her parents, siblings and her son.

Her activity is selling traditional regional food and other daily consumption dishes.  Her work day starts very early with the purchase of ingredients needed for food preparation.  She sells all day from breakfast to lunch and some evening dishes.  Her food stand is located on the path alongside her house and she’s always in constant activity.  She’s been in business 7 years and her mother and sister help her.

She likes her business because it produces income she can use to help her family cover household expenses and above all because it allows her to provide her son with everything he needs.  She’s had many economic needs for a long time because of the lack of employment or because of businesses that produced neither much satisfaction nor peace of mind.  But now she feels more at ease because she has an occupation she’s passionate about and that has helped her quite a bit.  She now plans to rent a locale and enlarge her business so that she can tend to customer with more comfort.

This is her first MFP loan.  She thanks all the people who make her loan possible in order to continue working towards making her plans a reality.  She commits to being a punctual member and to make her installment payments responsibly.  She affirms that she feels at ease with and grateful to her loan officer for all the training and advice she’s gotten to start on this new path.

She will use the requested 700 new soles to buy ingredients and supplies like rice, oil, condiments, sugar, spices, vegetables and tubers to prepare her dishes; she spends about 150 soles per day.  She will also buy some utensils in order to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA ”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angélica; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende golosinas,gaseosas,arroz,azucar entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja todos los días en su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable con muchas de ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como golosinas, gaseosas entre otros.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SEÑOR DE TETE CACA". The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Angelica. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery stand business. She has fun working at this business which goes is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She works every day in her business, which brings satisfaction as economic as it is personal. She is a responsible person who wishes to continue working for her family.

She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise such as candies and soft drinks, among other things.

She is happy for the loan and promises to pay the payments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business such as candies and soft drinks, among other things.

loans.name: Nancy Mariuska

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Mariuska; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta ropa interior como trusas y polos, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante por ella misma.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de truzas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "SEÑOR DE TETE CACA". The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Nancy Mariuska. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling underwear like briefs and polos. She has fun in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts forth every day. She is a nice and responsible person, which is the reason that she is successful by herself.

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale men's briefs.

She is happy because of the loan and promises to pay the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale men's briefs.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is 48-year-old businesswoman, married to Mwichaze, who is a businessman. They are blessed with six children who are all in school. Nyamvula owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been selling maize at the market with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from Yehu to invest in her current business. Nyamvula will use the loan to buy sacks of maize for sale.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize for sale.

loans.name: Dick

texts.en:
Dick is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Dick is providing multi-cab services for transporting different kinds of products. He has had this business for 9 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Dick has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Dick hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Ma. Dina

texts.en:
Ma. Dina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma.Dina has been in this business for 16 years. Ma.Dina earns more income from buying and selling nipa.

Ma.Dina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф трудолюбивый мужчина. Он хороший муж и отец 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, но всячески поддерживает его бизнес и с радостью каждое утро провожает его на работу.Так как у него 5 детей он работает на двух работах.Дети тоже помогают отцу. У Шарифа есть столовая, где посещают почти 40-45 человек в день. Также  у него есть автомойка, он хочет улучшить свою автомойку и купить туда аппарат для мойки машин и мыть машины специальным аппаратом.Полученный кредит хочет использовать для этой цели.Он надеется что после покупки этого оборудования у него будет больше клиентов и больше прибыли. Он очень благодарен за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Sharif is a hardworking man.  He is a good husband and father of five children.  His wife is a homemaker, but supports his business in many ways and gladly walks him to work every morning.  Because Sharif has five children, he works at two jobs.  The children also help their father.  Sharif has a cafe that serves about 40-45 people per day.  He also has a car wash.  He wants to improve the car wash, purchase an equipment for washing cars and wash cars with this specialty equipment.  Sharif wants to use this loan to accomplish this goal.  He hopes that after purchasing this equipment, he would have more clients and more profit.  He is very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase car wash equipment

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 31 год, одна воспитывает дочку.  Айнур поживает с родителями, являясь опорой для них  - в качестве источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством.  Начатое 11 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 овцематок, и приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнур обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Ainur is 31 years old and raising a daughter on her own.  Ainur lives with her parents, being a support to them.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in animal husbandry.  The business, started 11 years ago with an initial sum of 1,000 som (KGS), today contains two dairy cows with offspring and ten ewes, and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products.  In order to further develop her business, Ainur requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime es un productor de café emprendedor, pues además de dedicarse a esta actividad también produce caña y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. En lo que se refiere al café desde niño aprendió lo necesario al lado de su padre para poder trabajar en las fincas y cuando se caso con Fidela los 2 juntos trabajaban tanto en sus terrenos como en los de otras personas para poder tener mejores ingresos.
