El café que produce es convencional y quiere convertir toda su producción a café orgánico ya que este no utiliza fertilizantes químicos y necesita de un crédito para llevar esto a cabo. Este proceso le llevará algunos años ya que debe irse realizando por etapas y recibirá capacitación por parte de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para lograrlo. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 8 toneladas y para la siguiente espera que pueda llegar a producir 10 toneladas, de las cuales 3 serán de café orgánico, pues anteriormente sembró plantas las cuales fueron tratadas para este fin. El mayor sueño de Jaime es poder construir su propio beneficio de café para poder procesar el mismo toda su producción, aunque también tiene entre sus planes realizar mejoras en su trapiche de caña.
texts.en:
Jaime is an enterprising coffee grower because, besides working in the coffee business, he also grows sugar cane and has a grocery store in his home. 
As a child, he learned from his father everything he needed to know about coffee in order to work on the plantations, and when he married Fidela, they both worked together on their land as well as on other people's land so that they could get better income. 
The coffee beans he produces are conventional, and he wants to convert all of his coffee production to organic, since it would not require the use of chemical fertilizers. He needs a loan in order to do this. The process will take several years, since it must be done in phases, and he will receive training from Unión Regional de Huatusco in order to do it. 
His last harvest yielded eight tons, and he is hoping to reach ten tons next season, three of which will be organic coffee beans, since he previously sowed plants which had been treated for this purpose. 
Jaime's greatest dream is being able to build his own coffee brokerage so that he can process all of his output himself, although he also has plans to improve his sugar mill.

loans.use: to switch from conventional coffee production to organic.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 38 years old. She is a married woman living in Prey Chor district with her husband and children, who currently still depend on her income. Phan, together with her husband, works hard in order to educate their children and provide basic needs to the family. She is in a farming business and at the same time she devotes herself to a weaving business at home. She is skillful in weaving handicrafts such as bamboo baskets, a kind of flat two-handled basket, and other woven containers. She usually sells her finished products to local middlemen who come into the village to collect them house to house. 

Phan’s husband owns a motorcycle and a trailer used for transporting wood, timbers, floorboards and wallboard from other provinces for sale in his home province. His frequent customers are construction wood suppliers in the local area.

Phan would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in the amount of $1,500 US which will be used by her husband to purchase wood, timbers, floorboards and wallboard for trading. This loan will enable Phan’s husband to go far in his business and she hopes that she will receive a good return through this investment.

loans.use: to purchase wood, timber, floorboards and wallboard to sell.

loans.name: Kaliy

texts.ru: Калый 62 года, воспитала 5 детей.  Калый в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается разведением скота.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня  1 лошадь, 10 овцематок, и приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калый обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Калый планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет постройки сарая.
texts.en: Kaliy is 62 years old and raised five children.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in animal husbandry.  The business, started with an initial sum of 30,000 som (KGS), today contains one horse and ten ewes, and yields about 3,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Kaliy requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Ngoc's Group

texts.en:
Ngoc was born in 1979. She has two children who are all little. Her husband is an electroplating worker at factory. His salary is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Ngoc sells bread and raises chickens for a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND from her business. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to enlarge her business of selling bread and buy more food for chickens.

Thanh is 60 years old. She has a child. She has a grocery shop. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest more in her shop 
Hoa is 62 years old. She has two children. She has a grocery shop. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest more in her shop. 
Hoang is 34 years old. She has a child. She wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy phone cards to sell retail.
Hoai is 39 years old. She has four children. She has a beer bar. She wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to invest more in her bar. 
Ha is 31 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to open an internet access store.

loans.use: to enlarge her business of selling bread and buy more food for chickens.

loans.name: Angelica Elizabeth

texts.es: Angélica comenzo hace 4 años su tienda, se decidió por esta actividad porque queria pasar tiempo con sus hijos y ganar dinero, al principio vendia por la ventana de su casa hasta que su esposo se dio cuenta que tenia buena rentabilidad y le ayudo, actualmente tiene un local en su casa, compro varias perchas y tiene varios productos a la venta. Ella atiende sola desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, esto le ayuda a mantener a sus clientes porque a esa hora la mayoría de las tiendas están cerradas. Su esposo es jornalero en el mercado de Monte bello uno de los más grandes de Guayaquil ya que es el punto de desembarque de toda clase de productos, es él quien le compra arroz y azúcar por quintales, legumbres etc., ya que el costo es más bajo. Angélica desea obtener el crédito ya que está segura de que así podrá comprar más mercadería y mejorar su economía la cual le preocupa ya que tiene 3 niños que asisten a la escuela y su mayor deseo es poderle dar un futuro estable.
texts.en: Angélica started her store 4 years ago, and she chose this line of business to be able to spend more time with her children while earning some money. She started her activity by selling from a window of her house until her husband decided to help her, seeing that the activity was profitable. She now has a locale in her house that she has set up by buying various racks, and she sells different products. She works there alone form 6 am to 10 pm, and this helps her keeping the customers she has because the majority if the other shops are closed at that time of night. Her husband is a day laborer in the “Montebello” market, one of the biggest markets in Guayaquil because it is the unloading point of every kind of products; it is her husband who buys rice and sugar by the quintal, pulses and other products, because prices there are lower. Angélica would like to obtain the loan because she is sure that through this means she will be able to buy more products and to improve her economy, something she is very concerned about as she has 3 young children who go to school and her biggest wish it to grant them a stable future.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como auxiliar administrativa. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, ferro, areia, e outros), para construir uma fossa na sua residência.
No futuro deseja construir uma pastelaria e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a dificuldade financeira e fazer um negocio de grande envergadura.
texts.en:
Married with three children whom all attend school, Aniceta lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.
She works as an administrative assistant. With this loan, she wants to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, iron, sand and similar) to build a septic tank at her residence.
In the future, she wants to build a bakery and improve her family’s living conditions, which is why she is committed to repay this loan in order to request further loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is the difficulty to build a business of any significant size.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, iron, sand and similar) to build a septic tank at her residence.

loans.name: Adelaida Maria

texts.es:
Adelaida es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 11 años de edad por quien trabaja fuertemente todos los días en su negocio para brindarle una buena calidad de vida y buscar la manera de que pueda tener una buena educación. Desde hace 8 años montó una pizzería con muy poco capital, pero gracias al esfuerzo que ponía a su trabajo y a la buena calidad de sus productos su negocio salió adelante y ahora tiene un local donde puede generar 3 empleos para personas que son muy necesitadas. Las condiciones económicas en su hogar eran muy difíciles y constantemente tenían que padecer grandes adversidades, pero ahora pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida y su hijo tiene una buena educación. Sin embargo, como todavía tiene necesidades económicas, Adelaida busca un préstamo para comprar una rayadora de queso industrial para su negocio y así agilizar el proceso de preparación de pizzas. 

De esta manera podrá responder a la demanda de sus clientes quienes cada vez aumentan más. Además, podrá tener mejores ventas y los ingresos para su hogar mejorarán considerablemente permitiendo tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Adelaida is the head of household and single mother of an 11 year-old child for whom she works hard everyday to give a better quality of life and good education.  Eight years ago she launched a pizzeria with very little capital but thanks to her strong efforts and high quality products her business has been successful and, now, she even has room for three employees which are very needed.     

The economic condition in her home was very difficult and they constantly had to overcome adversity but now they are able to live well and her son has a good education.  Nonetheless, she has financial needs.  Adelaida is seeking a loan to purchase an industrial cheese grater for her business in order to quicken the pizza making process. 

This way she will be able to respond to customer demands who always want more.  In addition, she will be able to strengthen sales and the lifestyle and well-being of her family will considerably improve.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial cheese grater for her pizza business thereby quickening the pizza preparation process.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es soltera y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la universidad, viven en una casa en anticrético, la misma ubicada en la zona Challapampa de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como profesora  de ciencias naturales en el magisterio por más de ocho horas al día ya que ayuda en los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito para ayudar a su hija a pagar su tesis en la carrera de geología ya que su hija aún no trabaja.
El sueño de Deysi, es que sus hijos sean profesionales y obtengan buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Deysi is single and has two children who are studying. They live in anticrético housing [a term that refers to when a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of montly rent] located in the Challapampa zone of the city of La Paz.

She currently works as a natural sciences teacher at the board of education for more than eight hours a day because it helps to pay for food costs and basic services for her family. She is requesting a loan to help her daughter pay for her thesis in her major of geology because her daughter is not yet working.

Deysi's dream is that her children will be professionals and make good incomes for a better quality of life. 

This is the first loan she has requested from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for thesis costs for her daughter who is in university.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 48 años, está casado con Betty, con quien tiene tres hijos. Actualmente ellos viven solos (sus hijos estudian fuera de la ciudad) en la casa que ambos construyeron, ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca, Tarma. 
Su actividad principal es la agricultura, sus cultivos constan de papas, avena y olluco (tubérculo oriundo). Cuenta con dos hectáreas de terrenos de su propiedad, pero a veces arrienda otras parcelas, especialmente cuando se acerca la temporada de siembra mayor (setiembre, octubre y noviembre). Por su parte, Betty atiende una pequeña tienda que implementó en su vivienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes y víveres. Cuando las actividades del campo no requieren más cuidados, Moisés realiza servicios de transporte de carga desde su zona hasta la ciudad y viceversa, para ello adquirió un auto de segunda mano. Sus planes a futuro son claros, quieren adquirir una casa en la ciudad de Lima para vivir junto a sus hijos.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza - Huaricolca” y este es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Está muy contento porque gracias a las charlas educativas aprende nuevas cosas y avizora mejores condiciones de vida.
Moisés invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 15 bolsas de fertilizantes (120 soles cada una) para sus cultivos de papa que tiene sembrada desde junio.
texts.en:
Moisés, 48, is married to Betty and they have three children.  They currently live alone (their children attend school away) in the house they both built located in the rural part of Huaricolca, Tarma.

His main activity is agriculture; he grows potatoes, oats and olluco (a native tuber).  He owns two hectares of farmland but he also sometimes leases other parcels especially when the big planting season is approaching (September, October and November).  On her part, Betty has a small grocery store at home where she sells basic staple items like groceries and foodstuffs.

When work in the fields requires less attention, Moisés provides transportation services between his area and the city and vice versa and to do so he bought a used car.  His future plans are clear: they want to acquire a house in Lima in order to live with together with their children.

He belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza-Huaricolca” (New Hope-Huaricolca) communal bank and this is his MFP loan #7.  He is very happy because thanks to the educational chats he learns new things and can foresee better living conditions.

Moisés will use the money from this loan to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer (120 soles each) for his potato crop that’s been planted since June.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña que tiene el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleado en una empresa de madera por más de doce horas al día y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación de la casa de sus papas ya que desea darle más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
El sueño de Richard, es mejorar sus ingresos y tener una profesión para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Richard is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' home which is just one room with a dirt floor. The house is located in the Las Lomas area in the city of La Paz. 

He is currently making an income working as an employee at a wood company more than 12 hours a day. With the little money that he makes he has to cover food expenses and pay for basic services for his family. 

He needs this loan to expand his parents' home because he wants to give his family more comfort and security. Richard's dream is to increase his income and have a profession in order to improve his quality of life. This is the second loan he has requested from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to expand his parents' house so that they can live better.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a new member of PMPC.  She is 44 years of age, married, and blessed with one school-age child. She is a resident of Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  

She operates a restaurant business to help her husband in generating income for the family.  She availed a loan from PMPC to acquire sets of kitchen utensils and drinks for sale to the customers. 

She is hoping, with God's help, that she can provide her child with a better education.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora, decidida y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive hace muchos años con Francisco, quien trabaja como obrero, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos de 19, 18, 9, 7 y 4 años.

Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida como “salchipapa” (salchicha y papas fritas), hamburguesas y otros. Para cumplir con su trabajo instala todos los días un “carrito sanguchero” en la puerta de su casa donde fríe las papas, el pollo y otros insumos que caracterizan este platillo. Además acondiciona una par de mesas y sillas donde atiende a sus ocasionales clientes. Su trabajo se inicia desde muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes necesarios, por las tardes va preparando todo en su casa y pone en marcha su trabajo de venta a partir de las 5 de la tarde. Por fortuna su vivienda está ubicada en una esquina muy concurrida, en la calle principal del centro poblado en el que vive. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 2 años y recibe la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. El único problema que encuentra es que tiene que instalar y desinstalar, todos los días, su puesto de ventas, es por eso que viendo las ganancias que le genera su trabajo y contando con el apoyo de su pareja, tiene planes de alquilar un local donde tendría todo fijo y listo para brindar la mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP y agradece a las personas que hacen posible su acceso al crédito. Se compromete a pagar de manera puntual todas sus cuotas, como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores. Asegura que está contenta dentro de su banco comunal, pues pudo observar que es un grupo unido y espera que sigan de la misma manera.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 soles, comprará un par de mesas y sillas cuyo precio aproximado es de 300 soles; otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, como papa, lechuga, embutidos, carne de pollo, entre otros. Su inversión diaria puede variar de 100 a 150 soles.
texts.en:
Lidia, 36, is a hardworking, determined woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has lived with Francisco who works as a day laborer for many years and they have five children who are 19, 18, 9, 7 and 4 years of age.

Her activity is selling fast-food like “salchipapa” (fried sausage with fried potatoes), hamburgers and others.  To do her work she sets up her food cart every day at her doorstep where she fries potatoes, chicken and other ingredients characteristic of this dish.  She also sets up a pair of tables and chairs where she tends to her walk-in customers.

Her work starts very early shopping for necessary ingredients and in the afternoon she prepares everything at home and the selling starts at 5pm.  
Fortunately, her house is located on a very busy corner on her town’s main street.  She’s been in business two years and her older children help her.  
The only problem is having to set up and take down the stand every day which is why noting that her work is generating profits and with support from her spouse she’s planning on renting a locale where she can have everything set up permanently and ready to provide better customer service.

This is her fourth MFP loan and she thanks the people who make it possible for her to access credit.  She commits to making all her installment payments punctually like she did with previous loans.  She states that she’s happy in her communal bank because she’s observed that it’s a united group and she hopes they will continue this way.

She will use the requested 1500 soles to buy a pair of tables and chairs that cost about 300 soles.  She will use the rest of the money to buy ingredients like potatoes, lettuce, cured meats and chicken, among others for her food preparation.  Her daily costs vary between 100 and 150 soles.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and food preparation ingredients.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es soltera y tiene un hijo el cual esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como profesora de primaria por más de seis horas al día, siendo ella la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo para la elaboración de material de enseñanza.
El sueño de Sonia es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su situación familiar. 
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sonia is single and has a school-age son.  She lives in her parents’ house occupying a room with brick walls and a dirt floor; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.

She earns income working as an elementary school teacher more than six hours daily since she’s the only one who covers food, education and basic utility costs for her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy a computer that will be of much use to her in preparing teaching materials.  Sonia’s dream is to improve her income to become independent to improve her family situation.

This is her first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 35 years old and has 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines has been in this business for 5 years.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, etc.

Marissa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.   In the future Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman in her early 50's who lives with her two children and husband in the community of Samburu in the coastal region of Kenya. She has a total of four children, two are adults and independent while the two that she lives with are still in school. She earns her living selling cereals at the market. Her customers like her due to her high quality cereals and good services.

Mwaka is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES which she needs to buy sacks of maize for sale. With the money she earns she hopes to increase her working capital and continue improving her standard of living. As well, she wishes to fulfill her dream of opening a bigger cereal store.

loans.use: buy maize to resell

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Paterna works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Paterna is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Paterna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for her family.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business.  Ruth has been in this business for 11 years and also earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en:
Ariuntuya is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her daughter in Chingeltei district in Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband runs a taxi service business. Her daughter goes to secondary school.  

Ariuntuya started her organic vegetable growing business in 2009. Now she is growing organic vegetables on her 0.3 hectare yard and she plans to grow more organic vegetables in a greenhouse in the future.  

Ariuntuya had received a loan before and she had efficiently spent it for her business and her life. She has a good credit history. Now she is requesting  a 5,000,000 MNT loan to enlarge her vegetable field and to build a greenhouse. She is a responsible and punctual woman.

loans.use: to expand her vegetable field and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen food in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns more income from selling electronic re-loading (for mobile phones).
 
Sheila is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy frozen food to sell in her business of buying and selling frozen food.  Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy froozen food to sell

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 24 years old and married with one child.  Ma. Christina works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ma. Christina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Ma. Christina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family.  Mary Grace is married and has a business buying and selling nipa (a woven palm mat used to build or repair a house) in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy nipa to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ner

texts.en:
Ma. Ner is 46 years old and married with 2 children.   Ma. Ner works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines  and has  requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.  

Ma. Ner has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming and retailing rice.  She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.  Ma. Ner has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.   She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 17 years and also earns more income from fish vending.  Tomasita is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Tomasita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Urulkan

texts.ru: Урулкан 57 лет, воспитала 2 детей.  Урулкан в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается разведением скота.  Начатое в 1995 году со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня 1 дойную корову, 5 овцематок. Доходы от хозяйства помогли Урулкан открыть  маленький ларек с продовольственными товарами, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10 ,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Урулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 47,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Урулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет постройки сарая, а также проведение ремонта дома.
texts.en: Urulkan is 57 years old and raised two children.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in animal husbandry. The business, started in 1995 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), today contains one dairy cow and ten ewes.  The earnings from the business helped Urulkan to open a small food store, and her monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Urulkan requested a loan in the amount of 47,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by building a barn and also wants to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a married woman. She has a child who is 1 year old. She describes herself to be an ambitious and honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as flour, sugar, salt, sweets, sodas, water, cooking fat, bread etc. Winfred has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an environment conducive to business, and her primary customers are local residents. Winfred describes her biggest business challenges to be the high cost of household items, business premises rent and the electricity bill. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items for reselling. Her business goal is to expand her business retail store.

loans.use: to buy more household retail items to sell

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from four to 13. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a retail stall and grocery store where she sells plastic items, such as water mugs, plates, cups, etc. In addition, she sells potatoes, kale, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a viable business environment, and her primary customers are local residents.  Jennifer is also a farmer. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for business improvement. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items to resell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have built permanent business premises for her grocery store business with the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items for her business.

loans.name: Nercida

texts.es:
Nercida tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive, desde hace algunos años, con el hombre que la acompañó desde su adolescencia y con quien ya tiene dos hijas llamadas Mirella y Keysi. Juntos viven en una humilde casa que construyó junto a su cónyuge como resultado de su esfuerzo laboral. 

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas. Todos los lunes realiza su pedido a las tiendas distribuidoras con las que trabaja y coloca las botellas en una congeladora que tiene en su casa. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 5 años y le va muy bien, ya que recibe buenas ganancias por las ventas que realiza. Trabaja con la ayuda de su cónyuge y de su hermano. Recuerda que cuando se inició en este trabajo tenía muchos temores, ya que no sabía cómo controlar a sus clientes que bebían más de lo permitido, pero con el paso del tiempo aprendió a hacerle frente a esa situación y empezó a promover el consumo responsable y eso le ha servido en gran manera. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo y consolidándose en su labor, ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes, planea tener más adelante una distribuidora de bebidas al por mayor.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece la confianza que ponen en ella para acceder a este crédito y continuar hasta lograr sus objetivos. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y por otra parte asegura estar muy tranquila en su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de gaseosa y cerveza. Su inversión semanal varía entre 500 a 600 soles; también comprará vasos y algunas golosinas para ofrecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nercida, 30, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has lived together for many years with the man who has been her companion since her adolescence and with whom she has two daughters named Mirella and Keysi.  They all live together in a humble house she built with her spouse as a result of their efforts at work.

She sells beer and soft-drinks.  She places her order every Monday with suppliers she works with and places the bottles in a refrigerator she has at home.  She’s been in this business for about five years and does very well since she earns good profits from her sales.  She works with help from her spouse and a brother.  She recalls that when she started this business she was very fearful because she did not know how to control her customers who drank more than what’s permitted but with time she learned how to face this situation and started to encourage responsible drinking and this has been very useful for her.  She gradually learned how to consolidate her work and now she’s a great seller and has many customers.  She plans later on to become a wholesale beverage supplier.

This is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the trust placed in her in order to access this loan and be able to continue towards her goals.  She commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She’s very at ease in her communal bank because she knows most of its members and considers them to be responsible people.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy larger amounts of cases of soft-drinks and beer.  Her weekly investment varies from 500 to 600 soles; she will also buy drinking glasses and some snacks to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Úrsulo

texts.es: Desde muy chico a Úrsulo siempre le gustó trabajar en el campo y fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a cultivar el café, con el pasar de los años fue adquiriendo mucha experiencia y actualmente recibe asesoría por parte de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para poder aprovechar al máximo su terreno y los recursos con los que cuenta. El café que Úrsulo produce es convencional y quiere realizar la conversión de toda su siembra a café orgánico ya que este no utiliza fertilizantes químicos y además tiene mejor valor en el mercado. Durante la última cosecha él tuvo una producción de 6 toneladas y para seguir manteniendo ese nivel necesita comprar planta de café para renovar las que ya están viejas y por eso está solicitando un crédito. Además de dedicarse al café los fines de semana Úrsulo vende carne de cerdo para poder tener un ingreso extra, sobre todo en las épocas que el café apenas está dando frutos. Uno de los grandes sueños que Úrsulo y su esposa Obdulia tienen es el de poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos una educación universitaria y saben que trabajando como hasta ahora lo han hecho esto será posible.
texts.en:
Ever since he was very little Úrsulo liked to work in the field.  It was his parents who taught him how to grow coffee.  As the years passed he was acquiring a lot of experience.  He currently receives training from the Unión Regional de Huatusco to be able to take maximum advantage of the land and resources that he has.

The coffee that Úrsulo produces is conventional, and he wants to convert all of his plants to organic coffee.  He wants to do this because organic coffee does not use chemical fertilizers, and it has a greater market value.  During the last harvest he had a production of six tons.

In order to continue producing at this level he needs to buy coffee plants to renew the old ones.  That is why he is requesting a loan.  In addition to growing coffee, on the week-ends Úrsulo sells pork in order to have an extra income.  He mostly does this during the times when the coffee is barely giving fruit.

Úrsulo and his wife, Obdulia, have as one of their biggest dreams giving their three children a university education.  They know that working as they have been up until now will make this be possible.

loans.use: to convert his conventional coffee production to organic coffee.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: Clotilde est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois vont encore à l'école. Elle vend de l'huile rouge depuis quelques années et se ravitaille dans l'un des villages du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de combler les attentes de ses clients, Clotilde a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Ce financement l'aidera à agrandir son activité et à participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle envisage assurer la bonne éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Clotilde is married and the mother of four children, of whom three are still in school. She has been selling red oil for a few years and stocks up from one of the villages in Benin. With the goal of increasing her ability to stock up on inventory and to fulfill the expectations of her customers, Clotilde requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will help her to expand her business and to help with her children's education. She envisions making sure her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy 2 drums of palm oil

loans.name: Nivardo

texts.es:
Nivardo tiene 61 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, vive junto a su cónyuge y fiel compañera desde hace muchos años, ya que todos sus hijos son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Construyeron su casa en el terreno que le fue heredado por sus padres hace muchos años.

Su trabajo principal es la venta de productos variados, de acuerdo a la temporada; en algunas ocasiones vende ropa; en otras, artículos de cocina, accesorios de dormitorio, artículos del hogar, electrodomésticos o productos alimenticios. Vende de manera ambulatoria, por las calles de la ciudad, ofreciendo de casa en casa o a clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso del tiempo. Lleva en este negocio más de 20 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede alternar de un artículo a otro y no caer en la rutina, reconoce que hay determinada mercadería que tiene mayor aceptación que otras y aún así no se concentra en vender una sola cosa y constantemente cambia su mercadería. Las ganancias que este trabajo le generan le han permitido sobrellevar los gastos básicos que se presentan en su hogar y se siente muy útil y feliz.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto está muy agradecido con las personas que hacen posible este financiamiento. Además se siente muy bien trabajando con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos, comprará artículos de limpieza como detergente, lejía, accesorios de baño, esponjas y otros para vender en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Nivardo, 61, is a hardworking, determined man.  He has lived with his loyal companion, his spouse, for many years since all their children are now adults and have families of their own.  They built their house on a piece of land inherited from parents many years ago.

His main work is selling varied products according to the season.  Sometimes he sells clothes and other kitchen supplies, bedroom accessories, items for the home, small electric appliances or food items.  He sells from place to place along the city streets going house to house or to see regular customers he’s managed to win over though the years.  He’s been in this business more than 20 years and sometimes his spouse helps him.

What he likes about his work is being able to alternate one type of product for another and not fall into a routine.  He’s aware that certain merchandise is better received than others so he doesn’t concentrate on selling just one type of thing and is constantly varying his merchandise.  Profits from this work have allowed him to cover basic household expenses and he feels very useful and happy.

This is his first MFP loan so he’s very grateful to people who make this loan possible.  He also feels very good working in his communal bank because he knows most of the members and he considers them to be good people.

He will use the requested 800 new soles to buy cleaning supplies like detergent, lye, bath accessories, sponges and others to sell this season.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla commonly known as 'J' in the neiborhood is 28 years old and lives with his wife and their baby. He works by making and selling shoes and has years of experience in this activity. He already has an established group of customers who prefer the quality of his products, the prices, and above all, the excellent service. He is taking out another loan so as to invest it in this business.

Abdalla is a very friendly and hard-working man, always looking for new opportunities to help him succeed further. A while ago, Abdalla decided to increase production and needs to invest in materials. Because of this, he is seeking a loan from Yehu that will allow him to buy leather and beads. Abdalla is responsible and has a good ability to repay since he was able to successfully repay his first loan. So he is sure that he will be able to pay off the loan and also give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather and beads.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат 37 лет, воспитывает 3 детей.  Нурзат в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается разведением скота.  Начатое в 2011 году со стартовой суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня 2 дойные коровы, 10 овцематок, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 3 ,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурзат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет постройки сарая.
texts.en: Nurzat is 37 years old and raising three children.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in breeding livestock.  The business, started in 2001 with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS), today contains two dairy cows, ten ewes and one horse, and the monthly profit from sales of milk and dairy products amounts to about 3,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nurzat requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Constance Wononde

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Constance Wonond est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont déjà scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins à 03 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des sacs de maïs, de l'haricot et du riz depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Constance Wononde a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle. Le présent crédit lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation. Elle envisage réhabiliter la chambre de ses parents qui est en ruine.
texts.en:
Constance Wonond, aged 44, is married and the mother of four children, of whom three are already in school. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 3. She has a shop where she has been selling sacks of corn, beans, or rice for several years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Constance Wonond requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with the aim of bolstering her business and satisfying the requirements of her customers. The current loan will enable her to maximize her involvement and to help with education costs. She envisions renovating her parents' bedroom, which is in ruins.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, and 4 sacks of rice

loans.name: Utr Group

texts.es:
El grupo UTR lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina quien se dedica a la venta de picos, cosméticos, artesanías…etc. El negocio lo inicio con una pulpería con las ganancias invirtió en otros productos.
El crédito lo invertirá en ropa típica, juego de artesanía en madera (picheles, vasos, copas…etc.)
Las otras integrantes son Mercedes quien vende pan desde hace 20 años y ropa negocio que acaba de comenzar; y Raquel quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The URT group is comprised of four hard-working and enterprising people.  Rosa Argentina is one of them.  She sells typical clothing, cosmetics, and handicrafts, etc.  She started the business as a grocery store, and with the income she invested in other products.

She will use the loan to buy typical clothing and sets of wooden handicrafts (pitchers, glasses, and cups, etc.).

Mercedes, another member, has been selling bread for 20 years.  She just started selling clothes.  Raquel, the other member, sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy wooden handicrafts and typical clothing.

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flamingo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana Rosa quien tiene un taller de artesanía de bambú donde realiza desde lámparas, muebles…etc. Ella ha mejorado las condiciones de su taller gracias a los créditos.
Las otras integrantes son Elias quien tiene una refresquería desde hace 25 años y Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de canastas y la venta de verduras desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The “Flamingo” group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Ana Rosa who has a bamboo crafts workshop where she manufactures lamps, furniture, etc.  She’s improved her workshop’s condition thanks to the loans.  

The other members are Elia who’s had a snack bar for 25 years and Rosa who has been weaving baskets and selling vegetables for the last 6 years.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Charily

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Charily works hard to support her family by buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines, operating a general store and farming sugarcane. Charily is requesting a loan of PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Charily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of expanding her business and sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Robai

texts.en:
Robai is 36 years old, married and has three children. For the past two years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business because she has been trained in business management.

Now requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes for resale, Robai hopes to expand her business in five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes  to sell.

loans.name: Gs Cedeño Iii Group

texts.es:
La señora Gladis tiene 35 años , y vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien la apoya en su actividad lo que es venta de abarrotería en general, trabajo que realiza desde hace 5 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil acceso, ya que esta en el centro de su aldea y también por la calle principal y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Gladis el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, pan, aceite, jabón, manteca, lácteos, azúcar y otros. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que suba el volumen de ventas, ya que comprara una variedad de productos y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Gladis es seguir día a día creciendo en su actividad, de igual manera generarse mejores ingresos para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, como también tener una mejor calidad de vida.
José se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general.
Ritza tiene una venta de mariscos y también vende tortillas.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Gladis, 35, lives in south Honduras.  Her two children and her husband live with her.  He helps her with her activity which is selling groceries in general.  She’s been in business five years in her community.  Her store is located in an easily accessed spot since it’s in the center of her village and also along the main street which makes it highly visited.

Gladis needs the loan to buy corn, beans, meats, cured meats, bread, oil, soap, lard, dairy products, sugar and others.  She hopes that the impact of this loan will be increased sales since she will buy a variety of products thus being able to meet each of her customer’s needs.

Gladis’ future plan is to continue to grow every day as well as to generate increased income to give her children a good education as well as to have a better quality of life.

José sells groceries and Ritza sells seafood and tortillas.

Choluteca, Honduras-July, 2012.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Don Silverio sigue comercializando ropa nueva y verduras, productos que vende en la región del atlántico, ya que ah captado, su clientela así como en su casa de habitación, su esposa es comerciante de venta de tortillas  apoyando a la familia, sus hijos están todos casados, y aportan para sus padres.
Silverio ha venido aumentando sus ventas, con financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo de gran satisfacción para él, el poder lograr el objetivo en sus ventas ya que tiene que cumplir con sus compromisos de pago, gastos básicos del hogar, alimentación. 
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, así como un cuarenta por ciento en verduras. Logrando mantener sus ventas altas.
texts.en:
Silverio continues selling new clothes and vegetables, items he sells in the Atlántico region since he’s secured customers there as well as at home.  His wife is a merchant; she sells tortillas to help support the family.  Their children are all married and help out their parents.

Silverio has been increasing his sales with Afodenic loans which is a great satisfaction for him because he needs to reach his sales goals in order to cover basic household and food costs.

He will use this new loan to buy clothes for women, men and children; he will use 40% of it to buy vegetables in order to maintain a high level of sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Bapak Alex lives in Cibubur, a suburban area of Jakarta. He is married and has three children, ages 3.5, 1.5 and the youngest is 1 month old. His business is interesting because he owns and manages an internet café and, of course, sells prepaid airtime minutes. This loan from Kiva will pay the deposit money for an electronic data capture (EDC) machine. 

By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, Bapak Alex will be able to broaden his customer base. He'll attract, not only the ones who use the internet café and buy prepaid minutes, but also those who need to pay their monthly bills such as post-paid mobile phone bills and others. The EDC machine will help him to create payment transactions once a customer comes in and gives the money to him. 

This new Ruma product line provides outreach to smaller neighborhoods to access the banking system. They don’t need to waste their time and money going to the bank. And, from Bapak Alex’s side, he adds more value to his current business.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, a 43-year-old married mother of seven, works hard to provide for her family. For the past three years she has been operating a charcoal and coconut retail business in the Philippines. Having borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF, Alicia is requesting a PHP 13000 loan to buy more charcoal and coconut to sell.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and coconut to sell.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 3 est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Danlomè Anne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Danlomè Anne est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Kuassi. Danlomè Anne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Danlomè Anne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Danlomè Anne vend des boules de gâteau (faites à base du riz) accompagnés de la friture à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Danlomè Anne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Danlomè Anne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 3, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 3 comprises five persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Danlomè Anne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 52 years old and married to a man named Kuassi. 

Danlomè Anne did not attend school. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Danlomè Anne lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in the different household expenses.

To help with the different household expenses, Danlomè Anne sells 'boules de gâteau' (made from rice) served with fried items, out of her home. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Danlomè Anne, along with the other members of the group  GBENONKPO TONAFA 3, is requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise the level of their business and to grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and some condiments

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria y su esposo José se dedican al campo desde hace más de 30 años y tiene mucha experiencia principalmente en el cultivo de café, ya que en la zona donde viven ofrece las condiciones ideales para su producción. Victoria se encarga de las labores del hogar y además ayuda a su esposo a trabajar en las fincas, principalmente durante la época de cosecha que es cuando hay más trabajo. Ellos tienen un hijo ya casado y una hija que aún vive con ellos y también  ayuda en las labores del campo. El café que producen es convencional pero ya están realizando las tareas necesarias para ir convirtiendo poco a poco su producción a café orgánico y esperan que la siguiente cosecha una parte de su producción sea orgánica. Esté proceso lo están llevando a cabo gracias al apoyo de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” organización en la cual Victoria es socia desde hace ya varios años. Para la siguiente cosecha ella necesita sembrar nueva planta de café y fertilizar sus fincas por eso está solicitando un crédito, el cual dentro de unos meses le estará rindiendo frutos. Algunas partes de la finca de Victoria están deterioradas por el paso del tiempo y tienen planeado resembrar para que puedan aprovechar al máximo su terreno. Entre los planes personales que Victoria y su esposo tienen está el de componer su casa y mandar a su hija a estudiar una carrera universitaria para que tenga mejores oportunidades de empleo en el futuro.
texts.en: Victoria and her husband José have been working in the field for more than 30 years and have a lot of experience, principally in growing coffee, since the area where they live has ideal conditions for its production. Victoria takes care of the domestic work and, in addition, helps her husband to work on the farms, principally during the harvest, which is when there is more work. They have a son who is already married and a daughter that still lives with them and also helps them with the work in the field. The coffee that they produce is conventional, but they are already undertaking the tasks necessary to convert little by little to the production of organic coffee, and they hope that by the next harvest part of their production will be organic. They are undertaking this process thanks to the support of the “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, an organization in which Victoria has been a member for several years already. For the next harvest, she will need to sow new coffee plants and fertilizer her fields. This is why she is requesting a loan. In a few months, they will start bearing fruit.  Some parts of Victoria’s farm have deteriorated due to the passage of time, and they have planned to re-sow them in order to maximally take advantage of their land. Victoria and her husband’s personal plans are to repair their house and to send their daughter to university to study so that she will have better employment opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fermín

texts.es: Cuando Fermín se casó con Gabriela su padre le heredó una parcela para que comenzara a trabajar por su propia cuenta y se fuera construyendo poco a poco un patrimonio. Durante la época de cosecha Fermín contrata trabajadores para que lo ayuden a realizar el corte de café y en ocasiones también su esposa lo ayuda, aunque la mayoría del tiempo ella está en casa atendiendo a sus hijos que aun son pequeños pues tienen 9 y 7 años. La producción de Fermín es parte de café convencional y parte de café orgánico y está trabajando junto con el apoyo del personal de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que dentro de unos años sea en su totalidad de café orgánico ya que esta mejor pagado en el mercado y no daña a la naturaleza debido a que no utiliza productos químicos durante el proceso de crecimiento de la planta. Para la siguiente cosecha necesita comprar fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza en su finca y por eso solicita un crédito, pues de otra forma no podrá realizar las actividades necesarias. Debido a la experiencia que tiene en el campo a Fermín le gustaría dentro de un año sembrar aguacate en otro terreno que tiene cerca de su casa para así diversificar sus actividades y obtener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
When Fermín married Gabriela his father passed down to him a parcel of land so that he could start to work for himself and gradually amass an estate.  During harvesting, Fermín hires day workers to help him harvest coffee and sometimes his wife helps too although she spends most of her time caring for their children who are still little; they are 9 and 7 years old.

Fermín’s production is part conventional coffee and part organic and he’s working with support from personnel at “Unión Regional de Huatusco” (coffee cooperative) so that in a few years his entire coffee production will be organic which has a better market price and does not damage the environment because it does not use chemical fertilizers during its growth process.  

He needs to buy fertilizer and do the weeding to prepare for the next planting season and this is why he’s requesting a loan because he’d be unable to do these necessary activities otherwise.

Because of his experience in this line of work, Fermín would like to plant avocadoes in a year on another parcel of land he has near his house in order to diversify his activities and earn better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to do weeding tasks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and widowed with six children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock of products to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 75 años y a pesar de su edad aún sigue trabajando en su finca de café, pues está acostumbrado a eso desde que era un niño. Él nos conto como de pequeño su padre lo llevaba a ayudarlo en la época de cosecha que es cuando había más trabajo y como le fue enseñando poco a poco todo lo necesario para que se pudiera convertir también en un productor de café. Actualmente está produciendo un promedio de 8 toneladas anuales las cuales entrega a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” organización de la cual es socio desde hace muchos años. A él le gustaría dentro de un tiempo poder comprar más terrenos pues desea dejarles a sus hijos y nietos un patrimonio en el cual puedan trabajar. Para la cosecha siguiente está solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en fertilizante, planta de café y realización de labores de limpieza de su finca. Teodoro ya ha trabajado anteriormente con otros créditos y nos cuenta que ha tenido buenos resultados ya que ha sabido invertir el dinero que obtiene. Entre los planes personales de Teodoro están en terminar de construir su casa para poder darle la comodidad que se merece a su esposa Bertha.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 75, despite his age continues working on his coffee plantation because he’s used to it since he’s worked since he was a boy.  He related that his father would take him along when he was little to help him during harvest season which is when there is the most work to do and he taught him little by little everything necessary so that he too could become a coffee grower.  He’s currently producing an average of 8 tons per year which he delivers to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative], an organization he’s been a member of for many years.  He would like in time to buy more land to leave to his children and grandchildren assets that they can work.

He’s asking for a loan to the upcoming planting season that he’ll use to buy fertilizer, coffee plants and to do the weeding in his farm.  Teodoro has worked with loans previously and he relates that he’s had good results since he’s known how to invest the money he gets.  Among his personal plans is to finish building his house in order to give his wife, Bertha, the comfort she deserves.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants, fertilizer and to weed his farm.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 34 years old and married.  She supplies stationery to earn a living.  Ann has been engaged in this business for two years and has employed one person.  She has improved the business because she has been trained by Faulu Kenya on business management skills.

Ann hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested for 100, 000 KES to add stocks of stationery.

loans.use: buy stationery to sell

loans.name: Batorgil

texts.en:
Bat-orgil is 45 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger in Bulgan province. His wife is a nurse in the medical center of Bulgan, his daughter is a college student, and his son is a secondary school student.  

Bat-orgil started his water delivery service by horse business in 2003. There are only 2 people who run a water delivery service business in Bulgan province, and he is one of them.  His business is sustainable and he has many regular customers, including households, offices, construction sites, etc.  

Bat-orgil is a humble and hardworking man.  He says "I like to be busy." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy fodder and repair his stables for the horses.

loans.use: buy feed and repair the stables for his horses

loans.name: Abba Kate

texts.en:
Abba Kate is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 2 children. 

Abba Kate has a business making and selling snacks like cake and bread. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making snacks like flour, sugar and cheese.

Abba Kate is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en: Ayda is a 34 year old woman. She lives with her husband and 1 child in Salt. She is a loving mother and a supportive wife, helping her husband with the household by running her own business and selling houseware and various other products. She hopes to get a loan so she can buy new various home products to sell to more people.

loans.use: buy home products to sell

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a person of integrity who has shown much interest in venturing in business. Kadzo has already taken two loans from Yehu. She was able to fully repay her first loan and she is about to finish repaying her second loan. She is a responsible person who has good credit reference. Her aim is to have several businesses so as to improve the living standard of her family.

Kadzo is taking out another loan so as to invest it in her current business. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more shoes to sell, thereby increasing her income.  She is really grateful to both Kiva and Yehu for the financial support given.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 26 years old and single.  He has been selling shoes to earn a living.  He has been in the business for four years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money, manage his business and he is able to access loans easily.  His desire is to open a wholesale business in the future.

Jackson has requested for 40,000 KES to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and has 2 children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gemma is 33 years old.

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.  She has requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 32 years old and married with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Genevieve is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 59 years old, married and has 15 children, 1 is in school.  

Consolacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 46 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Consolacion requested a PHP 33000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en: Majidah is a 47-year-old widow and a mother of 3. She lives alone with her 3 children in Balqa and has her own small business that she runs from home. She sells cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. Majidah hopes to get this loan to increase her inventory so she can start her own shop where she can display and sell her products and be able to provide a good life for her children.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana lo conforma tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Lorena quien tiene una venta de repostería y delantales desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en harina, azúcar, leche, mantequilla, polvo para hornear…etc. para realizar torta de leche, repostería, manjar, trenzas y telas, hilos, aplicaciones  para hacer delantales.
Las otras integrantes son Ana Belki quien vende cosas de horno y Marbely quien vende ropa íntima.
texts.en:
Santa Ana Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Martha Lorena, who has had a business selling pastry and aprons for four years.  She's going to invest the loan in flour, sugar, milk, butter, baking powder, etc., to make cake, pastry, and delicacies; and fabric, thread, and appliques to make aprons.

The other members are Ana Belki, who sells "cosas de horno" [a Nicaraguan pastry], and Marbely, who sells lingerie.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastry and supplies to make aprons.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino comenzó desde pequeño a trabajar con su padre en la finca que tiene su familia. Cuando se caso con Constantina su padre le regaló un terreno para que pudiera independizarse con su nueva familia. Al principio su esposa lo ayudaba en el trabajo del campo pero después al nacer su primer hijo ella se dedicó de lleno a las labores del hogar. Actualmente Rufino contrata personal para que trabaje en su finca y él se encarga de supervisar personalmente todas las labores. Él produce un promedio de 8 toneladas anuales  y para la siguiente cosecha está solicitando un crédito para comprar planta de café y abono para su parcela. En 3 años espera que su finca esté produciendo el 100% de su capacidad pues hay algunas zonas que necesitan resembrarse. Además de dedicarse a la producción de café, Rufino es empleado del ayuntamiento en su localidad y también cuenta con un vivero de flores, negocio del cual se encarga principalmente su esposa. Entre las metas personales que Rufino tiene está la de hacerle mejoras a su casa para vivir de manera más cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
When he was little Rufino started working with his father on the family farm.  When he married Constantina his father gave him land as a gift so that he would be able to become independent with his new family.

In the beginning his wife helped him with the field work.  However, after their first child was born she devoted herself full time to the household chores.  Rufino now hires people to work on the farm.  He personally supervises all of the work.  

He produces an average of eight tons a year.  He is requesting a loan for the next harvest to buy coffee plants and fertilizer for his plot of land.  In three years he hopes that his farm is producing at 100% of its capacity as there are some areas that need to be sowed again.

In addition to his coffee production, Rufino is employed by his town.  He also has a flower nursery, a business that is mainly handled by his wife.

Among Rufino’s personal goals is to make improvements to his house so that his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer for his plot of land.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 53 years old and widowed with seven children.

Lani works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell.

Lani has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lani aspires to save money for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 38 years old, a resident of Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married to her spouse, a construction worker and the father of four children. Cheng helps her spouse earn income by cultivating rice crops on inherited farmland.

Cheng would like to take out this loan in order to improve her current status. She will use a portion of the loan to purchase farm supplies for her rice crops such as fertilizers and insecticides. With the remaining funds, she will purchase a motorcycle for her husband to commute to his workplaces. In the future, Cheng plans to expand her farming business and increase her production, while her husband wants to be a construction project owner, building his own team providing construction services around the province.

loans.use: to purchase farm input for her rice crops such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo, sigue trabajando en compra y venta de chatara, también en temporada de las cosechas aprovecha la existencia en aguacates, elotes, ayote, tomate y otras verduras que están a precios bajos, logrando estas otras entradas, para poder equilibrar sus gastos ya que su familia es de siete hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y los otros estudian, su esposa ayuda con las ventas.
Hoy en día tiene su propia camioneta, que le ayuda hacer mejor su trabajo, con esta nueva inversión comprara chatarra que es en donde le queda más ganancias. Productos a comprar diez quintales de chatarra en aluminio, cobre, bronce y una parte invertirá en la cosecha de elote, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla. Gracias a estos financiamientos sigue creciendo en sus ventas y siendo de grandes beneficios al administrar bien su negocio.
texts.en:
Reynaldo continues to work in the purchasing and resale of scrap metal. Also, during harvest season he takes advantage of the availability of avocados, corn on the cob, squash, tomatoes and other vegetables that are at a low price, obtaining this extra income to help cover the family expenses. He has seven children, two of which work and the others study; his wife helps with sales.    

Now he has his own truck , which has helped him to improve his work. With this new loan he will buy scrap metals that will give him the most profits. He will buy 1000 pounds of scrap metal in aluminum, copper, bronze and some of the loan he will invest in the harvest of corn on the cob, tomatoes, peppers and onion. Thanks to these loans he continues to increase his sales and has benefited by managing his business well.

loans.use: to by scrap metal in aluminum, bronze and copper and also to buy vegetables.C

loans.name: Carlos Samuel

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos tiene 37 años de edad convive con su  madre, y es padre soltero tiene 2 hijos, Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería, desde hace más de 10 años.
Don Carlos esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: sandalias de mujer, sandalias de varón, cosméticos y otros para la buena atención de sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, en algunas comunidades cercanas a Danli, el es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio a sido la principal fuente ingresos, El se ha ganado la clientela por su buena manera de atenderlos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Carlos le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y así poder salir adelante.
Don Carlos uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Julio 2012
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old and lives with his mom; he is a single father of 2. His main income generating activity is selling merchandise, which he has done for the past 10 years. 

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy products like: sandals for women, sandals for men, cosmetics and other things which will allow him to provide good service to his customers. He makes his sales working as a street vendor, in a few communities close to Danli. He is a very hard working person, as his main form of income comes from his sales business. He has gained customers as a result of the good service he provides. With the support that the loan Carlos has requested will provide he will better his business, which will increase his profits to cover the household costs and give a better life to his family and help them get ahead. One of Carlos' dreams is to have a clothing store in the city center.

loans.use: to buy sandals for men and women, cosmetics and other things for his business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jire Group

texts.es:
El Grupo esta conformado por cinco mujeres, que ademas de ser amigas, profesan la misma fé, esto ha sido un factor importante para lograr la cohesión del grupo.
Estan ubicadas en la frontera Sur de Costa Rica-Panama, zona que presenta caracteristicas muy particulares: subempleo para la población masculina adulta, pocas oportunidades de empleo remunerado para mujeres mayores de 35 años, por cuanto el comercio generado por los grandes almacenes, demanda mujeres jovenes; lo que hace que estas mujeres se vean en la necesidad de autoemplearse.
Sin embargo este auge comercial abre oportunidades de negocios para ellas, ya que a travez de la venta de productos de catálogo, ofrecen la oportunidad a sus clientas de obtener articulos a crédito, algo que no es posible en los grandes almacenes, que unicamente venden de contado.
Este préstamo se invertira en la compra de mercadería de catálogo, ropa interior, perfumeria, cosm{eticos y dos compañeras incursionarán el la venta de productos de la marca Tupper Ware, articulos que demandan sus clientes actuales y potenciales.
El fín último de todo este esfuerzo de realizar el comercio minorista es el ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a ellas y por ende a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is composed of five women: on top of being friends, they believe in the same faith, and this has been an important element to reach the cohesion of the group.
