They live on the Southern Costa-Rican-Panama frontier, an area with peculiar characteristics such as underemployment of the adult male population and a few chances to find a paid job for women over 35 years of age, as the business generated by the big shopping centers requires young women. For this reason, older women are obliged to become their own employers.
However this economic situation creates jobs opportunities for them, as by selling products from catalogue they offer their customers the chance to buy products on credit, something that is not possible in the big shopping centers, where products are sold for cash only.
This loan will be invested in the purchase of catalogue merchandise, underwear, perfumes, cosmetics, and two members will venture into selling Tupper Ware brand products, as these are items requested by their current customers and that could be requested by potential customers as well.
The final aim of their effort is to engage in retail in order to provide a better standard of living to themselves and to their families.

loans.use: To buy catalogue merchandise, underwear, perfumes, cosmetics and Tupper Ware products.

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Nubia tiene 51 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hija y su esposo, quien también es comerciante y la apoya en su actividad, trabajo que realiza desde hace 20 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil acceso para cada uno de su clientes ya que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace que se muy visitado por muchas personas.
Doña Nubia el crédito lo necesita para compra de: rosquillas, quesadillas, dulces, espumillas, churros, confites, chicles y otros productos para la venta. El impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas se incrementen en gran manera, ya que comprara una variedad de productos y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Nubia es hacer crecer su negocio día a día, y hacer de su negocio uno de los mejores en su región, como también generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras  – Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Nubia is 51 years old and lives in the southern region of Honduras. She lives with her daughter and her husband, who is also a salesman and supports her in her business. She has had her business in the community where she lives for the past 20 years. Her business is located in an easily accessible area for her customers, in the center of the city. This is why she has many customers. 

Nubia needs the loan to buy: "rosquillas" [a traditional bread] "quesadillas" [a traditional pastry], sweets, "espumillas" [a dessert made with egg whites and sugar], "churros" [fried sweet bread with cinnamon and sugar], candy, gum and other things for her business. The hoped for result from the loan is that her sales increase significantly; by purchasing a variety of products she will be able to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers. 

The future plans that Nubia has are to grow her business day to day and make her business one the the best in the region. Also, to increase her profits to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rosquillas (a traditional bread) quesadillas (a traditional pastry), sweets, espumillas (a dessert made with egg whites and sugar), churros (fried sweet bread with cinnamon and sugar), candy, gum and other things for her business.

loans.name: Amanda Aracely

texts.es:
La joven Amanda, Su actividad principal es la venta de sandalias y ropa de mujer, desde hace 2 años, tiene dos hijos y es madre soltera, a través de su negocio a salido adelante ya que ha sido su única fuente de ingresos, ella es una persona muy luchadora y gracias a eso a logrado darles lo necesario  a sus hijos.
Amanda esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto como ser hamacas, sandalias, ropa y joyería para la buena atención de sus clientes, con el apoyo que reciba Amanda del préstamo le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y mejorar su condición de vida para ella y sus hijos
Amanda sueña con tener un local propio para poder vender su producto, ya que lo ha estado haciendo de una manera ambulante.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Julio 2012
texts.en:
Young Amanda's main job for the last two years has been selling sandals and women's clothing.  She has two children and is a single mother.  Through her business she has gotten ahead, because it has been her only source of income.  She is a fighter and thanks to this she has managed to give her children the necessities.

Amanda is requesting the loan to buy products such as hammocks, sandals, clothing, and jewelry to give her customers good service.  With the support Amanda receives from the loan she will contribute to having a better business and to improving living conditions for herself and her children.

Amanda dreams of having her own store to be able to sell her products, because she has been doing it as a street vendor.

Danlí, El Paraíso, Honduras--July 2012

loans.use: to buy hammocks, sandals, clothing, and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and beans for the restaurant.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 41 years old and married with two children. Lanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Lanie has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 17 years and also earns an income as a food vendor. Lanie hopes to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 56 years old and married with two children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell.

Marilou has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 15 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading (selling prepaid cell phone credits) and raising livestock.

Marilou aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en: Albertha is 33 years old and lives in Logan Town with her husband and four children, ages 6 to 17, who are in school. She and her husband have been running a video club. She says that with her business they are able to send their children to school and to buy food for the home. She says that they started this business by selling fast food in their community. Albertha is requesting a loan to buy a generator, discs(CD& DVD), and television for her business. Her plans are to open another video club in the next community and, in the future, to see her children finish high school and attend college.

loans.use: to buy a generator, discs (CD& DVD), and television for her business

loans.name: Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El grupo el samaritano lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Virginia quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales  actividad que ha realizado desde muy joven negocio en el que invertirá el crédito. Ella está casada y tiene solo su hija menor de 13 años a su cargo.
Los otros integrantes son Ángela quien vende verduras desde hace 2 años y Osmar se dedica al acarreo desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The “El Samaritano” (The Samaritan) group is composed of three hardworking people. One of them is Virginia who sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], an activity she’s been doing since very young and the business she’ll invest the loan in.  She’s married and only has one, 13-year-old daughter in her care.

The other group members are Ángela who has sold vegetables for the last two years and Osmar who has worked in hauling for the last two years.

loans.use: to buy pork, corn, firewood, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Lorenza works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lorenza is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing boat. Lorenza has been sustaining her business activities with her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 1 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie Victoire est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Marcel. Marie Victoire a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Marie Victoire vend depuis huit ans, des fagots de bois, des jus de bissaps et du sucre dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Marie Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 1, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gbenonkpo Tonafa 1 group is made up of four people who live in the same quarter. It is the sixth time that the group has sought financial support from  ALIDé,in order to boost their business. The group leader, whose name is Marie Victoire, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and is married to a man called Marcel, with whom she has three children who all attend school. She left school at primary level. Marie Victoire lives with her husband and his children. The couple work together to see to the family's needs.  In order to cater to the needs of the household, Marie Victoire has sold bundles of firewood, "bissap" juice (an hibiscus-based drink), and sugar in her quarter for the past eight years. This business enables her to meet her family's needs without too many problems. Marie Victoire sources her goods from a market in Benin. 

In order to meet her customers' demands and to boost her revenue, Marie Victoire and the other Gbenonkpo Tonafa 1 group members are seeking a sixth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to boost their business levels and to grow their customer base and revenue. All previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood, "bissap" juice and sugar

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, a 50-year-old married mother of three, provides motorcycle transport services to local community members to earn a living. She has been engaged to her business for more than three years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

Milagros is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase wheel, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheel, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia tiene su pulpería que es donde aporta a los gastos familiares, y al apoyo económico para su esposo, el trabaja en una empresa privada de constructor. Sus tres hijos estudian, el mayor trabaja y estudia el fin de semana, también aporta  a los gastos.
Sus préstamos, han sido para mejorar su casa y poder tener las condiciones de vivienda. Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento hará un pequeño muro en la parte de atrás de su propiedad, con el fin de reguardar su propiedad, mejor seguridad para su familia. materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvia has a small grocery store, which is where she contributes to the household expenses, and to helping her husband financially. He works for a private construction company. Their three children are in school. The eldest works, and goes to school on the weekend; he also contributes to expenses.

Her loans have been to improve her house and to be able to have adequate housing conditions. Now, with this new loan, she will build a small wall at the back part of her lot, with the aim of safeguarding her property and providing better security for her family. The materials to be purchased are: stone, sand, cement, steel and gravel for beginning construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a wall in the back part of her property.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, 36. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Michelle is married to Hermogenes, her business partner, and is a mother to five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Michelle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP (Philippine Peso) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Michelle hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 64 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 40 years and also earns income from a motorcycle transport service. Lucena hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 33-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

William operates a retail shop in which he has spent 4 years. He received capital from selling agricultural produce and cattle and started his current business. He is faced with problems of high taxes, price fluctuations, and inflation, which lead to high prices of commodities. He has personal goals of building a permanent home and educating his children. He also has business goals of expanding his business to new market areas and moving it to a more permanent location.

William wants this loan to purchase sugar, rice, salt, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, salt, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for two years. The business began from her personal savings. In this shop, Mariamu sells flour sugar, salt etc. Besides this, she also owns a vegetables stall.

She learnt about Milango through an employee with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she face are price fluctuations and inflation. 

Mariamu is applying for a loan of 21,950 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her child. Her plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of retail products e.g sugar, salt flour etc.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 28-year-old single woman living with her parents. To help her parents with expenses, she runs a small business from her home selling basic products and food to her friends and neighbors. She requests a youth loan so she can increase her product variety and sell more to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her product variety.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 20 year old student living with her family. She is a university student going for her B.A. degree. She hopes to get the loan so she can pay for her semester fees and help her parents with the expenses as she dreams to continue her studies and go for a Master’s degree and so on.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing 50000 PHP (Philippine Peso) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 26 years old and married with one child. For more than 5 years, he has been selling clothes to earn a living. In addition, he operates a barber shop.

Ezekiel previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. Through the seminars he attended, he has become financially knowledgeable because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 30-year-old married woman with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Grace operates a bar, where she has spent 6 years. She got start-up capital from her husband. She has a challenge of inadequate capital to purchase stock and equipment. She has a personal goal of educating her children and a business goal of expanding business into new market areas.

In order to attract more customers and also increase on her income sources, Grace intends to buy a pool table with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a pool table.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 62 años, es un hombre con un espíritu muy jovial y muy trabajador, tiene seis hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Actualmente vive solo en una humilde casa que ha podido edificar con el resultado de su esfuerzo.
Su negocio es la venta de frutas. Su labor empieza con la compra, al por mayor, de frutas regionales, principalmente naranjas y sandía; luego las pela y las coloca en envases, al natural o en jugos. Lo hace ambulatoriamente y también se coloca en un establecimiento fijo. Viene realizando este negocio desde hace 15 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien. La experiencia que ha logrado con el paso del tiempo le ha permitido consolidar una amplia clientela y eso se ve reflejado en que a diario termina todo lo que tiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder realizar algunas otras actividades en su casa y dedicar, eventualmente, su tiempo libre a realizar trabajos de carpintería o albañilería. Lo que no le gusta es que a veces tiene que irse muy temprano al mercado para poder realizar la compra de sus productos. Espera continuar  trabajando para seguir ahorrando lo necesario para tener una vejez tranquila en un negocio en el que pueda trabajar sin salir de su casa. 

Este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como ha venido haciéndolo en todos sus créditos anteriores. Está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará naranjas, mandarinas, sandias y uvas por cajones para continuar vendiendo. Su inversión diaria varía entre 300 a 500 soles, dependiendo de la temporada y de la calidad de las frutas.
texts.en:
Francisco is 62 years old and is a hardworking man with a very jovial spirit.  He has six adult children and currently lives alone in a humble home that he was able to build though his efforts.

His business is selling fruit.  His work begins with him buying regional fruits in quantity, mainly oranges and watermelons.  He then peals the fruit and packages it up as fruit or juice.  He does this on foot and also sets up in a shop.  He has been doing this for 15 years and things have always gone well for him.  He has been able to consolidate his wide customer base and this shows because he sells out every day.  What he likes most about his work is that he is able to do other things in his home and use his spare time to do other jobs such as carpentry or masonry.  What he doesn’t like is that at times he must go to the market early in the morning to be able to buy his products.  He expects to continue working so that he can continue saving up so that he can have a peaceful old age in a business where he can work from home.

This will be his 18th loan through MFP and he appreciates those who make possible for him to continue with his objectives.  On the other hand he is very committed to making his payments on time, as he has been doing in the past.  He is very glad to belong to his communal bank because the other members are good, friendly, and united.

He will use the money from this loan (1,000 PEN) to buy oranges, mandarin oranges, watermelons, and grapes by the crate so that he can continue selling them.  His daily investment is between 300 PEN and 500 PEN, depending on the season and the quality of the fruit.

loans.use: buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking farmer, blessed with three children who are in school. He plants vegetables for sale to earn a living. In addition, he also does livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for ten years.

Charles had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en: Salameh is a 47-year-old retiree who supports three children. After his retirement, he started his own mini market in Karak to sell basic products and materials to the neighborhood. He now wishes to get a loan so he can expand his shop and increase his product variety to get a larger market share in his area.

loans.use: to increase his product variety to get a larger market share.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a very active and creative woman who lives in Zarqa. She has been arranging flowers for more than six and a half years. She has been getting lots of compliments on her work, so she has been saving ever since with the hope that she can start her own flower shop sometime soon. She has applied for this loan to buy more raw materials to increase her productivity.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to increase her productivity

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 62-year-old married man with 9 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a maize farmer and has been a farmer for more than 20 years. He started with some inherited land. He grows crops to sell and has accumulated enough money to buy more land for maize growing. He is faced with the problems of seasonal weather changes, theft, price fluctuations, and inflation. Alfred has personal goals of building a permanent home and educating his children. He also has a business goal of diversifying his business to include other cash crops. Alfred wants a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: To buy maize for planting

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo se dedica a producir café desde hace más de 30 años. El es de los pocos productores que no contrata personal para trabajar en sus fincas ya que tiene una familia muy extensa de 10 hijos, de los cuales 6 son solteros y viven con él y lo ayudan en todas las labores que se requieren en las fincas. Ellos mismos producen las plantas que siembran a base de injertos pues cuentan con un vivero. En la comunidad en la que viven no cuentan con energía eléctrica así que tuve que poner con sus propios medios un transformador para poder gozar de este servicio. A pesar de las limitaciones geográficas del lugar en que vive durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 30 toneladas de café, las cuales entregó en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fuera procesada y exportada. Él nos platicó que este crecimiento lo ha tenido gracias al trabajo y el buen uso de los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente. Para esta cosecha el solicita un crédito porque tiene que comprar fertilizantes para sus plantas. Entre los planes que tiene a futuro están comprar dentro de unos meses otra camioneta la cual ocupará exclusivamente para el trabajo y más adelante le gustaría poder adquirir más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo has been growing coffee for more than 30 years.  He is one of those rare coffee growers who does not hire outside help to work in his fields, since he has a very large family of 10 children, 6 of whom are single and live with him and help him with all the work that is necessary on the farm.  They themselves produce the seedlings that they plant, as they have their own nursery.

In the community in which they live there is no electricity.  Therefore they had to install a generator on their own initiative so they would be able to have power.

In spite of the geographic limitations of their area, during their last season they harvested 30 tons of coffee, which they delivered to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” so it could be processed and exported.  He mentioned that this growth is due to their hard work and the wise use of the loans that he obtained previously.  For the current season he is seeking a loan because he needs to buy fertilizer for his plants.  Among his plans for the future is to buy a truck in a few months, which he will use exclusively for work.  Further down the road he would like to acquire more land for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Gema Mylu

texts.es:
Gema, sigue trabajando como recepcionista en un hospital de la capital, su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, dos de sus pequeños hijos cursan la primaria y el menor tiene tres años, el cual cuida su mama.
Para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar comenzo a vender cosméticos en variedad, lo que empezó con financiamiento, y que hasta ahora ha crecido en inventario y captado clientela, sus compañera de trabajo le compran mucho.
Aun viven en la casa de sus padres en un cuarto aparte, pues  no cuentan con el capital para lograr independizarse del todo, pues con los salarios de ambos cubren los gastos del hogar, educación, ropa y alimentación de sus hijos a si como los compromisos de pago. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: vanidad, perfumenes para ambos sexo, pintura de labios, cremas de pelo, de cuerpo, tintes, entre otros productos encargados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gema continues working as a receptionist in a hospital in the capital. Her husband works in construction as a brick layer. Two of her young children attend primary school and the youngest, who is three years old, is cared for by her mother.

In order to help with household expenses, Gema began selling a variety of cosmetics. She started with a loan and, as of now, both her inventory and customer base have grown. Her co-workers buy many products from her.

She still lives in her parent’s house in a separate room, since she and her husband do not have the capital to live independently because their combined salaries just cover household expenses, as well as the cost of educating, clothing and feeding their children and making her loan payments. With this new loan, she will purchase a variety of perfumes for both sexes, lipstick, hair cream, body cream, and other products that her customers have ordered

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and a variety of perfumes.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, age 26, is a garment worker. She and her husband Chamreun, age 29, have been married since 2005 and have two children, both of whom are in school. Sreymom also has one brother and her elderly mother living with her. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Sreymom and her husband are both garment workers, and when rice farming season comes, they also hire fellow villagers to help them grow rice. 

Sreymom is asking for her first loan in the amount of $700 in order to purchase one cow to raise. She will get extra income from selling the cow for beef as well as from selling any calves that the cow may produce. 

She will also use a part of the loan to pay for rice planting.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise and to pay for rice planting

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an ambitious 22-year-old man who sells potatoes to earn a living. He operates his business in a busy environment with reliable customers. He has previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to save money, because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy potatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, age 50, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya in a local community of Samburu. She is married with five children. 

Tabitha has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy stocks of sugar, flour, snacks, and beverages for her store. She has been a member of Yehu since 2010. 

In the future, Tabitha hopes to improve her business to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, flour, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 45, is a farmer who specializes in the growing of bananas. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years. He and his wife have two children and live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

His primary challenge is seasonal weather changes, which affect his yields and can lead to low output. He has a personal goal of building a permanent home. His business goal is to venture into growing other types of crops, such as coffee beans. 

Paul is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old, and he is married with three children who are in school. He does poultry farming to earn a living. Besides, he also keeps rabbits. He has engaged in this business since 2006. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to engage in business planning because he has been trained on business management. He dreams of enlarging his poultry farm and owning real estate in the future.

Peter has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy 10 bags of layer mash and 3000 chicks.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of layer mash and 3000 chicks.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 62 años, es una mujer emprendedora, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven y siempre ha dado lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante. Se separó de su cónyuge hace muchos años, pero tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo el último, Juan de 24 años, vive junto a ella.

Ella se dedica a la siembra de palma aceitera. Tiene ocho hectáreas de terreno y ha dedicado toda esa extensión a dicho cultivo. Su principal función es la de administrar este negocio solventando y dando todo lo necesario a los obreros que trabajan para ella. Su principal comprador es una empresa de transformación del producto ubicada en el mismo distrito en el que vive. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 20 años y desde se inició en este rubro ha podido darles a sus hijos todo lo requerían en su etapa universitaria y su mayor orgullo es verlos ya profesionales. Lourdes es considerada como una de las mejores agricultoras en su sector laboral, pues le está yendo muy bien, tiene muy buenas cosechas que se reflejan en los buenos ingresos que percibe por ellas. Desea ampliar su negocio comprando un nuevo terreno para seguir trabajando bajo el mismo sistema.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) contratará dos obreros para que realicen las labores de plateo y poda en su área sembrada.
texts.en: Lourdes is 62 years old and is a hardworking woman. She started to work at a very young age and has always given her best effort in order to get ahead. She separated from her husband many years ago, but she has four children. Only the youngest son, Juan, who is 24, still lives with her. She has a business growing palm trees. She has eight hectares of land and has dedicated all of it to this activity. Her principal function is to administer this business, settling all the accounts and giving her workers everything they need. Her biggest customer is a business in her area that processes her products. She has been in this business for roughly 20 years, and since she started she has been able to give her children everything they need for their university studies, and her greatest pride is in seeing that they are now professionals. Lourdes is considered to be one of the best farmers in this segment of the market. Things are going very well, and she obtains very good harvests, a fact which is reflected in the good income that she earns. She wishes to expand her business and buy new land and continue working in the same way. This is her 13th loan with MFP, and for this she thanks those who have made it possible to obtain these loans so she can continue toward her goals. She promises to make her repayments in a punctual manner, as she has for her previous loans. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, since the group has a lot of solidarity, and all of the members are good and friendly people. With the loan she is seeking, 1000 nuevos soles, she will hire two workers to help plant and prune her trees.

loans.use: to hire two workers to help plant and prune her trees.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol, shown in the photo, is a silk weaver, while her husband is a mason. They have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Nimol sells her finished silk fabric to a middleman in the village where she lives. She requests a loan in the amount of 500 US dollars (USD) to assist in her silk weaving business by buying silk materials including raw silk.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby tiene 45 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y amante del trabajo. Tiene una relación de convivencia junto a Nelson, con quien tiene tres hijos. Ellos viven en la casa que construyeron en base a muchas horas de trabajo y continuo sacrificio.
Su trabajo en la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera. Tiene un terreno de amplia extensión en donde ha establecido sus parcelas con este cultivo. Tiene a su cargo a dos personas que se encargan de realizar todas las labores agrícolas. Ella administra los recursos necesarios, desde la siembra hasta la cosecha, y una vez que cuenta con el producto final realiza la venta directa a una empresa de extracción de aceite de su misma localidad.  Lleva en este negocio cerca de 10 años y desde que se inició en este trabajo ha obtenido buenos resultados. Se siente muy cómoda con lo que hace, le está yendo muy bien, ya que su producto es esperado por la calidad que muestra y eso le genera buenos ingresos. Tiene muchos planes a futuro orientados a la mejora y expansión de su sembrío, por eso desea mejorar la tierra mediante abono, ya que pretende sembrar otro tipo de productos que también tienen mucha demanda en el mercado.  

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de otro tipo de cultivos como maíz y estacas de caña de azúcar para sembrar en su terreno y generar así otro ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Gaby is 45 years old. She is a woman eager to succeed, who loves to work. She lives in a common law relationship with Nelson, with whom she has three children. They live in the home they built after many hours of work and continued sacrifice.

Her work is cultivating and harvesting the oil palm. She has a wide expanse of land where she has planted her plots with this plant. She has two employees who do all the agricultural labor. She administers the necessary resources from planting until harvest and, once she has the final product, she sells directly to an oil extracting business in the same locality. She has been engaged in this business for close to 10 years and since she started it, she has made good profits.

Gaby is very comfortable with what she does and her business is doing very well because her product is in demand due to its quality and that generates good earnings. She has many future plans oriented to the improvement and expansion of her fields, thus she wants to improve the land with fertilizer because she expects to plant a different kind of crop that is also in great demand in the market.

This is her first loan with MFP, consequently she is grateful to those who make her loan possible so she can continue with her objectives. She is very committed to responsibly making her payments on time. She is happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are good, friendly and supportive of one another.

The amount requested (S/. 500) will be used to purchase seeds of other kinds of crops, such as maize and sugar cane cuttings, to plant on her land and thereby generate another source of income.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and sugar cane cuttings to plant on her land.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en: Shireen is a 31-year-old single woman who lives in Zarqa with her parents. She runs her own mini market from her home, selling basic products to help her parents with expenses. She hopes to get a loan to increase the variety of products so she can expand her business and move her market to an independent space, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her variety of products.

loans.name: Sreylun

texts.en:
Sreylun, age 21, is a homemaker who stays at home and cares for her two young children, a son and a daughter. Her husband, Narith, age 26, is a driver for a company. Narith does not have his own transportation, so his relatives currently take him to work via motorcycle. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Pen. 

Sreylun is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use to drive to work

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, age 36, runs her own business from her home, selling and trading products. She lives in Salt, Jordan, with her husband and their five children. 

Abeer is requesting a loan so as to add more variety to what she sells. This will allow her to increase her income and help her husband to support the family. She would also like to employ her friends and neighbors at to help her with her work.

loans.use: to add variety to the products she sells

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío es una mujer de 39 años, es emprendedora, trabajadora y muy amable. Actualmente está separada de quien fue su cónyuge durante muchos años y con quien tuvo dos hijos, de 15 y 9 años de edad. 
Ha implementado una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, la cual se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, lo que hace que siempre tenga una clientela fluida. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 5 años y desde que se inició ha tenido el pleno apoyo y la ayuda de su hijo mayor. Además de trabajar en su bodega, también se dedica a la siembra de palma desde hace 10 años, ahí colabora de manera eventual, ya que tiene un par de obreros que realizan las principales funciones agrícolas que requiere dicho cultivo. Lo que le gusta de la venta de abarrotes es que le permite generar ingresos desde la comodidad de su hogar, además que puede trabajar sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos. Para el futuro le gustaría construir una amplia tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y está muy agradecida de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. También le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.1500) comprará productos para su bodega, bebidas, lácteos, arroz, azúcar y otros más, para ofrecer mayor variedad. Normalmente puede invertir en sus compras de 300 a 500 soles aproximadamente cada dos días o semanalmente.
texts.en:
Rocío, age 39, is an enterprising, hard-working, and very kind woman.  She is currently separated from the man who was her husband for many years and with whom she had two children, ages 15 and 9.

She has set up a small store in her house, which is in a very busy area of the city.  This means that she always has a steady stream of customers.  She has been doing this work for five years.  Ever since she started she has had full support and help from her oldest child.  

In addition to working in her grocery store, she also has been growing palms for ten years.   She works there from time to time because she has a couple of workers who do the main agricultural work required for this crop.

What she likes about selling groceries is that it allows her to generate income from the comfort of her home.  She is also able to work without neglecting her children.  In the future she would like to build a bigger store and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to know that she has financial support.  This way she is more certain that she will advance with her work.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments punctually as she has done with her previous loans.

It pleases her to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive of each other.

She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy products for her bodega.  She will buy drinks, dairy products, rice, sugar, and other products in order to offer a greater variety.  She is usually able to invest approximately 300 to 500 soles in purchases every two days or weekly.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, rice, sugar, and other products in order to offer a greater variety at her grocery store.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Don Carlos sigue dando sus servicios de cadete de taxi, el cual trabaja por turnos, su esposa labora en un almacén, sus tres hijos estudian. Las mejoras a  su casa es la meta, ha venido a corto plazo, construyendo las condiciones de su vivienda con financiamiento en Afodenic.
Con este nuevo financiamiento cambiara el techo de la cocina que es de nicalit por láminas de zinc. Con el crédito anterior mejoro el techo de la sala ha venido por parte estas mejoras ya que los materiales están ah altos costos.
Comprara: doce laminas de zinc, seis perlines, soldadura, golosos, y estar en mejores condiciones de este invierno.
texts.en:
Carlos continues working as a taxi driver; he works by shifts.  His wife works in a store.  His three children are attending school.  His goal is home improvement and he has been building his house in short phases with Afodenic loans.

He will use this latest loan to replace the kitchen roof; he will change the Nicalit [fiber cement] for metal sheeting.  He used the previous loan to improve the living room roof.  He’s been doing the repairs in stages because building materials are very expensive.  He will buy 12 metal sheets, six purlines, welding and screws in order to have better conditions for this winter.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to replace the kitchen roof.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a hardworking business lady, blessed with three children who are in school. She plants flowers in a busy environment and sells them to earn a living. She has been in the business since the year 2000 and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. This has enabled her to look after her family's needs. She dreams of buying several cows and supplying seedlings internationally in the future. She needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizers, seedlings and flower containers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and containers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, age 36, is a carpenter. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns a good income. He lives with his wife Julia and their four children.

This is his first loan from  KADET Ltd. He was introduced to the organization by one of its field officers. He intends to use the loan funds to purchase timber for use in his carpentry work.

In the future, he plans buy a truck that he can use to deliver the furniture he makes.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy tiene 35 años, es un hombre muy sociable, alegre y trabajador. Es soltero, pero tiene una hija de 8 años a quien atiende y visita de manera periódica.

Su trabajo es el transporte de pasajeros, trabaja dentro de la ciudad y sus alrededores, pasa sus días conduciendo su taxi, no importa si es de día o de noche, labora con mucho ánimo, siempre lleva una sonrisa para regalar a sus ocasionales pasajeros y por esas cualidades siempre es solicitado para cumplir esta función. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 4 años, su carro es propio y pudo comprárselo a un amigo que ya lo iba a desechar. Conoce muy bien las calles de la ciudad y siempre brinda un servicio rápido, al principio le fue complicado, ya que le era difícil tener que manejar tantas horas y no se acostumbraba a la rutina, pero cuando empezó a ver lo rentable que es este trabajo tuvo que acoplarse al ritmo laboral y afortunadamente logró adaptarse. Para el fututo desea comprar otro taxi y alquilarlo para mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir este crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera responsable y puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya, que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y muy cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) contratará el servicio de un buen mecánico para que refaccione su carro y lo deje en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Roy is thirty-five years old and a very sociable, happy, and hard-working man. He is single but has one daughter who's eight years whom he cares for and visits periodically.

His work is transporting passengers. He works inside the city and its outskirts. He spends his days driving his taxi and it doesn't matter whether it's daytime or nighttime- he works with energy and always carries a smile to give to his occasional passengers. Due to having these qualities he is always requested to fulfill this function. He's been doing this work for four years and owns his own car. He was able to buy it from a friend who was going to throw it away. He knows the city's streets very well and always provides fast service. At the beginning things were complicated for him since it was difficult to have to drive for so many hours and he was not getting used to the routine. But, when he began to see this job as profitable, he had to adapt to the working rhythm and fortunately managed to do so. In the future he would like to buy another taxi and rent it out in order to improve his earnings.

This is his first loan with MFP. Therefore he is grateful for the opportunity and trust that they are putting in him to receive this loan. On the other hand, he has committed to fulfilling his payments responsibly and punctually. Moreover, it pleases him to be part of the communal bank to which he belongs as he has seen that its members are supportive and very punctual people.

With the requested sum (S/. 1000) he will hire the service of a good mechanic to refurbish his car and leave it in optimal condition.

loans.use: to hire the service of a mechanic to refurbish his car.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio tiene 53 años, es un hombre amable y muy trabajador. Con su pareja tiene cuatro hijos, y ahora viven con ellos y sus dos nietos, que son su principal motivo de trabajo y esfuerzo diario.
Él se dedica a la siembra de palma aceitera y otros productos regionales. Tiene su chacra propia donde ha venido trabajando desde hace 20 años y le ha brindado la estabilidad necesaria para educar y brindar a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una mejor condición de vida. Todos sus productos son muy solicitados, el fruto de la palma lo vende a una empresa industrial ubicada cerca a su chacra, mientras que sus productos regionales los vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Cuando se inició en este trabajo tenía como dificultad el desconocimiento pleno de las técnicas agrícolas, pero con el tiempo pudo ganar experiencia y así mejorar su producción. Le está yendo muy bien, ya que vende todo lo que cosecha y le permite generar buenos ingresos a su hogar. Ahora se prepara para iniciar un nuevo proyecto, pues implementará en su casa una tienda de abarrotes, donde su pareja será la encargada de la atención.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará algunas maderas, clavos y fierros que necesita para construir el local de su tienda. Otra parte del dinero lo destinará en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Silverio, 53, is a kind, very hardworking man.  He and his spouse have four children and now two grandchildren live with them; they are his main reason to work and strive daily.

He grows oil producing palm trees and other regional products.  He owns a field where he’s been working for 20 years that has provided the necessary stability to be able to educate his children and to give them the opportunity of having better living conditions.  

All of his products are in high demand.  He sells the fruit from the palm trees to an industrial firm located near his field while the regional products are sold in the city’s wholesale market.  

When he started this work his difficulty was incomplete knowledge of agricultural techniques but with time he gained experience and improved production.  He’s doing very well since he sells his entire harvest thus generating good household income.  He’s now getting ready to start a new project: he intends to open a grocery store at home that his spouse will run.

This is his first MFP loan so he’s grateful to all those who make his loan possible so that he can continue towards his objectives.  On the other hand, he’s quite committed to make his installment payments very responsibly and he’s happy to be part of his communal bank because all the members are good, kind and mutually supportive.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy lumber, nails and metal needed to build his store’s locale.  The other part of the money will be used to buy basic staple items.

loans.use: to build his store's location and to buy stock merchandise for it.

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en:
Yassine is a 21-year-old single man who has worked as a plumber for 9 years. In 2005, he started working on his own. He was only 14 when he started his own business to improve his family and his living.

Just like most Palestinians, Yassine didn't take the chance to finish his education, because his family's financial situation forced him and almost all of his family members to seek additional income. As a 12-year-old child, he started working and missed almost all of his teenage joy and experiences. He misses being a child, but this made him more challenged, to improve his living and to make sure he will have a better shining future.

Yassine applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released plumbing tools. These will help him to do most of his work with good quality and in a short period of time. The good thing about his business is that he is not limited inside the camp; he can go and provide his service anywhere in Lebanon.

loans.use: to buy newly released plumbing tools.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, age 45, is a garment worker. Her husband Narin, age 45, works as a security guard. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two sons. Both sons are grown and employed.  

Sokly wishes to live on her own, so she is currently staying with her parents. She has therefore decided to ask for a loan in the amount of $1,000, which she will use to build her own house to live in.

loans.use: to build her own house to live in

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor tiene 54 años, es un hombre bueno y muy honesto. Con su pareja tiene tres hijos de 23, 21 y 20 años.
Su trabajo consiste en la siembra de palma aceitera. Realiza las cosechas de forma periódica y para ello recibe el apoyo de dos personas que se encargan del traslado y la selección de los frutos. La venta la realiza directamente a una empresa que se encarga de la transformación del producto. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 10 años, toda la labor de mantenimiento de su parcela lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos y su pareja, mientras que para el transporte y cosecha requiere la ayuda de una o dos personas, dependiendo de la cantidad de racimos y de la urgencia con que le solicitan algún pedido. Le está yendo muy bien, ya que al principio solo trabajaba en unas pocas hectáreas de su terreno, pero ya está ampliando su área de siembra con lo que busca consolidar su producto y vender en mayor cantidad.

Este es su préstamo número 17 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará herramientas para el proceso de cosecha y también refaccionará su vehículo de carga con algunos repuestos que requiere para su mejor funcionamiento.
texts.en: Néstor, 54, is a good and honest man. With his common-law wife he has three children aged 20, 21 and 23. His work consists of growing palm trees. He harvests periodically, and for this he receives support from two people who are in charge of selecting and transporting the fruits. He sells the fruits directly to a company that processes them. He has been in this business for around 10 years. He does all the work of maintaining his land parcel with the help of his children and common-law wife. The harvest and transport require the help of one or two additional people, depending on the quantity harvested and the urgency with which his customer needs the order to be filled. Things are going very well; at first he only worked a few hectares on his land, but now he has expanded his growing area with the goal of consolidating his product and selling in larger quantities. This is his 17th loan with MFP. For this he thanks those who have made the loan possible so he can continue toward his goals. He promises to make his repayments in a punctual manner, as he has for his previous loans. He is also very happy to belong to his communal bank, since the group has a lot of solidarity, and all of the members are good and friendly people. With the loan he is seeking, 1000 nuevos soles, he will buy tools for the harvesting process, and also repair his cargo vehicle, purchasing some parts he needs in order to improve its functioning.

loans.use: to buy tools for the harvesting process, and also to repair his cargo vehicle.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy sincera, honesta y muy trabajadora. Está divorciada desde hace muchos años, tiene tres hijos ya mayores y cada uno de ellos tiene su propia familia. Ahora vive en su casa propia, la cual consiguió tras muchos años de constante trabajo.

Se dedica al cultivo de la palma aceitera. Su principal función es de organizar y supervisar el adecuado funcionamiento y buen estado de las plantas que tiene en su terreno, para ello contrata dos o tres personas que realizan las labores que ella se encarga de guiar gracias a los años de experiencia en este sector. Los productos cosechados los vende a una empresa que existe cerca a la comunidad en la que vive y por el cual recibe un buen pago. Lleva en este rubro cerca de 15 años y aún sabe que puede dar más de sí misma para seguir trabajando. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que está en contacto frecuente con la naturaleza y es un ambiente en el cual se siente muy bien, ama lo que hace, y le va bien. Su sueño es lograr construir su propia empresa transformadora para realizar el ciclo completo del producto al que se dedica. 

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y además está satisfecha con los integrantes que pertenecen a su banco comunal, ya que considera que todos sus miembros son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000), renovará algunas herramientas agrícolas, como machete, azadón y otros, además contratará a una par de obreros que le ayuden en su actividad.
texts.en:
Teresa, 56, is a very sincere, honest and very hardworking woman.  She’s been divorced for many years and has three adult children each with a family of their own.  She now lives in her own house that she got after many years of constant work.

She grows oil producing palm trees.  Her main function is organizing and supervising the care of the plants she has on her field and to do so she hires two or three people to do the work and she takes care of guiding them thanks to the years of experience she has in this line of work.  What she harvests she sells to a firm that’s near the community she lives in and for which she gets good pay.  

She’s been in this line of work for about 15 years and knows that she can still give more of herself to continue working.  What she likes about the work is the constant and frequent contact with nature which is an environment she feels very good in; she loves what she does and she does very well in it.  Her dream is to succeed in building her own processing firm in order to carry out the full production cycle of the product she’s dedicated to.

This is MFP loan #7 and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support since she feels more confident of advancing in her work this way.  Similarly, she commits once more to make her installment payments punctually like she did in previous loans.  She is satisfied with the members of her communal bank because she considers them to be very responsible and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to replace some farm tools like machetes, hoes and others and also to hire a couple of day laborers to help her with her work.

loans.use: to replace some farm tools and to hire day laborers to work her fields.

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Ibu Dwi lives in Bogor Utara and owns two food stalls – one is located in the school cafeteria while the other is a common food street stall. She is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. The money from this loan will be used to pay for an electronic data capture (EDC) machine that is modern and newer. She loves it. With this machine, she hopes she can do bill payment transactions easily. 

With an EDC machine, Ibu Dwi will be a payment point where people can buy food and also pay their monthly or other bills. The bills that have the highest demand are electricity bills, motorcycle installments, water bills and some credit card bills. She is expecting that with this EDC machine she can increase the number of payers, and in the end she can open more stalls with more Loket Ruma products. The main reason why she wants to expand her business is that she has the opportunity to be the center for payments in her neighborhood. This service is needed because sometimes it takes more time and money to be queuing in the bank or other payment points in the main street.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio tiene 54 años, es viudo, tiene tres hijos y ahora comparte sus días en su casa propia con el menor de ellos que tiene 25 años. 
Se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera. Durante el día realiza la limpieza, mantenimiento y fumigación de las malas hierbas que pueden influir en el buen desarrollo de su cultivo. Lleva 15 años en este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a la calidad del producto ofrece a la venta. Por lo general trabaja solo, sin embargo en temporadas de siembra y cosecha tiene que contratar los servicios de algunos trabajadores para que le ayuden a completar la cantidad requerida por sus compradores. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene el tiempo disponible para no descuidar las actividades de su casa, le va bien y vende sus productos a una empresa transformadora que se dedica a la elaboración de aceite. Como toda persona emprendedora Toribio quiere tener otro negocio, que es una piscigranja (crianza de peces) que le ayude a multiplicar sus ingresos, espera realizar este sueño a mediano plazo, ya que para eso necesita de una fuerte inversión económica.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir este crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, pues ha notado que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará nuevos plantones e insumos para incrementar su área de siembra.
texts.en:
Toribio, 54, is a widower; he has three children and he currently shares his own house with the youngest one of them who is 25-years-old.

He works growing oil producing palm trees.  During the day he clears, cares for and fumigates so that noxious weeds won’t interfere with proper growth.  He’s been working in this business for 15 years and does very well thanks to the quality of the product he offers for sale.  In general he works alone.  However, during planting and harvesting he has to contract help from workers to help him complete the amount required from buyers. 

What he likes about his work is that he always has time available to not neglect his activities at home.  He does well and sells his products to a processing plant that produces the palm oil.  Like all entrepreneurs, Toribio wants to have another business which is a fish farm that will help him increase his income.  He hopes to reach this dream in the not too distant future but to do so he needs to make a large economic investment.

This is his first MFP loan and he’s grateful for the opportunity and for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.  On the other hand, he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He enjoys being part of his communal bank because he’s noticed that the members are responsible, supportive people.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy new sprouts and supplies to increase the size of his planted area.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 years old, and she is married with one child.

She sells charcoal in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has been operating this business for the past 3 years. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Mary has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She has also learned how to manage her business. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 51 years old, and her husband, Sarim, is 54 years old. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have three children. One is a garment worker, another one is in university, and the third is in high school. 

Savy sells grocery items at home, while her husband is a driver. Savy is in the process of renovating the house where she lives. She lacks some money to finish it, so she asks for a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollars (USD).

Savy will also use rest money of the loan to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To finish her house renovations and buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Mugi

texts.en:
Mugi, which is what his community calls him, is a young man who lives in Bekasi.  He and his family own a small stall and an airtime prepaid minutes business. In his stall, he sells coffee, teas, snacks, candies, and cold drinks.  He is not yet married and really wants to expand his shops.  He wants to become a Loket Ruma agent and needs an Electronic Data Capture (EDC) machine to help him to create the payment transaction. This loan will be used to pay the guarantee money for this machine.
 
As a Loket Ruma Agent, Mugi will become a payment point, where customers can come to his stall and pay their monthly bills or buy an electricity voucher. He expects that most of his customers will come to him to pay their electricity bill, buy an electricity voucher and pay motorcycle installments. By becoming the payment point, Mugi helps the neighbor to access the banking system, since going to the nearest banks & ATMs are time consuming and have higher costs. In the end, having the Loket Ruma product is adding more business to his current stall.  And hopefully, this will generate more income for him and the family.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Evelyn has been in this business for 11 years now, and earns additional income from frozen foods and ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Carmelina has been in this business for four years. Carmelina earns more income from firewood sales.

Carmelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad's first loan helped him to increase the amount of food products he offers in his mini-market. He is now applying for a second loan in order to add variety in in his product inventory. He wants to add new products other than food items to his store, such as cleaning products.

loans.use: to add new items to his mini-market

loans.name: Kelvy Enrrique

texts.es:
El joven kelvy tiene 27 años, el vive en la zona sur de honduras, junto con el vive su esposa quien lo respalda en su actividad como también en su compromisos, trabajo que realiza desde hace 8 años. Su Peluquería esta en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es muy buena, ya que esta en el centro de la ciudad, por la calle principal.
Kelvy el crédito lo necesita, para la compra de: cremas faciales, gelatinas, maquinas de cortar pelo, silla de cortar pelo y espumas faciales. El impacto esperado con el crédito, es que su clientela crezca día a día, ya que acondicionara muy bien su negocio, para darles un buen servicio a sus clientes como también satisfacer sus necesidades.
los planes a futuro de Kelvy es hacer crecer su negocio expandiéndose en varios puntos de la ciudad donde vive, y así generarse buenos ingresos, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Kelvy, 27, lives in south Honduras with his wife who backs him up in his work and with his commitments.  He’s been working for 8 years.  His barber shop is located in a strategic spot where passersby are many because it’s downtown on the main street.

Kelvy needs the loan to buy face cream, gels, hair clippers, a barber chair and face foam.  He hopes that the impact of the loan will be more customers every day since his shop will be well-equipped to provide good customer service and to meet their needs.

Kelvy’s future plan is to make the business grow expanding to other parts of the city where he lives thus generating good income to have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras-July, 2012

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmín tiene 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación. Vive en compañía de su pareja y padre de su hijo de 6 años.
Su actividad económica es la venta de repuestos y lubricantes para vehículos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, se levanta para hacer las funciones que demanda su hogar, cuando ha culminado esa labor se dirige su local de trabajo ubicado en una parte céntrica y estratégica de la ciudad. Durante los 6 años que lleva realizando este trabajo aprendió que al cliente siempre hay que tratarlo de manera cordial y complacerlo con su pedido, es por eso que cuando no cuenta con algún repuesto que su cliente busca se dirige inmediatamente al establecimiento del costado para conseguir lo que le solicitan, ya que no quiere perder a los clientes que le costó mucho poder obtener. En su local solo trabaja con ayuda de su cónyuge, quien se encarga de la parte mecánica de los vehículos, mientras que ella vende y ofrece los repuestos. Su meta es tener un local propio, ya que el que ahora tiene es alquilado, espera conseguir esta meta en corto plazo.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará aceites, lubricantes y algunos repuestos para continuar sus ventas en el taller.
texts.en:
Yasmín, 30, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives with her spouse, the father of their six-year-old son.

Her economic activity is selling automobile spare parts and lubricants.  She rises very early every day to do her household chores and when she finishes them she heads out to her store located in a strategic, central spot in the city.  She’s been doing this work for six years and has learned that customers must always be treated courteously and their needs must be met which is why when she does not have some spare part a customer needs on hand she immediately goes to the establishment next door to get it because she does not want to lose any of the customers she worked so hard to secure.

Her only help in her shop is her spouse who takes care of the mechanical part of the vehicles while she sells and offers the spare parts.  Her goal is to have a locale of her own since the current one is leased; she hopes to accomplish this in the short run.

This is her third MFP loan.  She thanks those who make the loan possible for her to continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she’s most committed to once again make her payments punctually like she did with previous loans.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are good, kind and supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy oil, lubricants and some spare parts to continue with sales in her shop.

loans.use: to buy oil, lubricant and spare parts.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
Jennilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns an income by buying and selling meat and frozen products. She has been in this business for nine years. Jennilyn earns additional income from selling candy.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase a stock of meat and frozen products to offer for sale.

Jennilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of meat and frozen products to offer for sale

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 76 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming corn, sugarcane and coconut in the Philippines. Bebiana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Bebiana has been farming corn, sugarcane and coconut for 45 years and earns additional income from rice retailing and her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 30 years old. He is a hardworking businessman who operates a barber shop for a living. He has been in the business for three years. He had previously acquired a loan, which helped him to grow his business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become knowledgeable on how to manage his business since he has been trained in business management. He dreams of becoming financially stable and developing his business in the future. He needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a shaving machine and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and expand the business.

loans.name: Sandra Nohelia

texts.es:
Doña Sandra hoy en día trabaja en servicios domésticos, pues junto a su esposo se esfuerzan para un futuro mejor de sus dos hijos estudiantes de la primaria, aunque viven en condiciones humildes es de su propiedad que han venido mejorando y que esperan lograr un techo en condiciones buena.
Su servicio higiénico es letrina, el cual comprara inodoro y entubara las aguas negras logrando tener mejor condiciones de higiene, privacidad y seguridad. Comprara: inodoro, cemento, bloques, arena, hierro, tubos, pega, teflón u otros para esta mejora. Que gracias Afodenic se está haciendo posible al otorgar este financiamiento en cuotas a plazos.Logrando equilibrar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sandra works as a domestic employee because together with her husband they strive to provide their two elementary school age children a better future.  Although they live in humble conditions it’s theirs and they’ve been making improvements to their property hoping to attain a home that’s in good living conditions.

They currently have a latrine so she will buy a toilet and sewage pipes to attain better hygiene, privacy and safety.  She will buy a toilet, cement, concrete blocks, sand, pipes, rebar, glue, Teflon and others to do this improvement.  Thanks to Afodenic financial support payable in installments is being made possible which allows her to stabilize her expenses.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Terla Vadeza

texts.es: Terla tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, es una mujer amable y muy dedicada a su trabajo, el único inconveniente que enfrenta es la salud de su hijo que tuvo problemas al nacer y lo tiene que tener en constante tratamiento. Terla se dedica a  la venta de abarrotería y papelería, también vende zapatos, botas y sandalias. Ella inicio comprando unos cerdos con un dinero que le regalaron y luego con la ganancia empezó a comprar sandalias y zapatos de diferentes estilos, el negocio lo comenzó desde hace 10 años y todavía se dedica al mismo rubro, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am  a 5:00 pm, la única desventaja es el tiempo que invierte en el negocio ya que casi no puede dedicarle tiempo a su hijo. El préstamo que Terla solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como ser: botas de suela, botas de hule, sandalias, zapatos para hombres y mujer. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá surtir el negocio  y esto le ayudara a incrementar más sus ventas y obtener más ganancias.
