La meta de Terla es tener mejor acondicionado su negocio y agrandar el local. Es el primer crédito que solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Terla, 32, is a single mother; she has a son.  She’s a kind woman who is very dedicated to her work.  The only inconvenience she faces is her son’s health.  He had problems at birth and must be under constant treatment.  

Terla sells groceries and stationery supplies and also sells shoes, boots and sandals.  She started out buying some pigs with money someone gave her and then used profits to buy sandals and shoes of various styles.  She started the business ten years ago and still is in the same line of work.  She works from 5am until 5pm.  The only disadvantage is the time she puts into work she can’t spend with her son.  

The loan Terla is requesting is to buy merchandise like leather boots, rubber boots, sandals and shoes for men and women.  With help from this loan she will be able to stock her business which will help her increase sales and profits.  Terla’s goal is to have a better-stocked business and to enlarge the locale.  This is her first loan request to FAMA and she expects to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy boots, sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot, age 45, sells meat and vegetables from her home. She buys her wares from Koki market, approximately 9 kilometers from her house. Her husband, Luy, age 44, is a tuk-tuk (auto-rickshaw) taxi driver. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sot and Luy have two sons and two daughters. One son is employed full-time, both daughters are studying hairdressing, and one son is still very young. 

Sot is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,500, which she will use to build a hair salon for her daughters. She will also buy a new tuk-tuk for her husband to replace the old and damaged one he currently uses.

loans.use: to build a hair salon for her daughters and to buy a new tuk-tuk (auto-rickshaw) for her husband.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 26, operates a grocery store. He has operated this business for the past year. He is unmarried and supports his parents.

This is David's first loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to the organization by a credit officer. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase a stock of vegetables and cereals to sell at his grocery store.

He hopes to expand his venture, and he intends eventually to have a more permanent place from which to operate his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables and cereals to sell at his grocery store

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Don francisco sigue trabajando para el bienestar familiar, hoy en día labora en control y calidad en un laboratorio de la capital, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja en servicios domestico,  ambos se esfuerzan para una vivienda en mejores condiciones, así como la educación  a sus tres hijos, ya que el mayor trabaja.
Con este nuevo préstamo continuara el levantamiento de paredes, repello, dando un mejor acabado a su vivienda, seguridad al poder cerrar completamente su casa. Materiales a comprar: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas de madera y comenzar la obra, sastifecho ya que esta mejora se está haciendo en corto plazo, por medio de Afodenic, mediante el crédito otorgado,  con plazos accesible.
texts.en:
Francisco continues working for his family's well-being. At present he works in quality control at a laboratory in the capital, and has the support of his wife who works as a domestic. Both do their best to improve their housing conditions, as well as the education of their three children, as the eldest works.

With this new loan, he will continue the raising of the walls and the plastering, giving a better finish to their home as well as security, though being able to completely close off their house.

Materials to be purchased include: cement blocks, sand, cement, steel and lumber. Then he can begin construction satisfied, as this improvement is being done in the short term through Afodenic; by means of the loan he has been granted, and with affordable installments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials so that he can continue improving his house by raising walls and plastering.

loans.name: Richard Donato

texts.es: En esta oportunidad conocerán a Richard es hombre trabajador y emprendedor que con su trabajo a mejorado su calidad de vida. El es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con su madre, quien ha sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Hace más de 15 años se dedica a la cobranza en un bus, tuvo que trabajar mucho para cumplir sus objetivos, fruto de ello es que se compro 02 autos donde actualmente lo alquila, generando un ingreso extra para su hogar. Esto le permite seguir apoyando a su madre. Su siguiente meta es comprarse un carro para seguir alquilarlo. Su último crédito le servirá para iniciar un negocio, la cual piensa alquilar un stand donde pueda ofrecer prendas de vestir. Richard agradece a los prestamistas Kiva y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en:
On this occasion you will get to know Richard, a hardworking, enterprising man who has improved his quality of life by means of his work.  He’s single and has no children.  He currently lives with his mother who has been the motivating factor for his getting ahead.

He’s worked as a bus fare collector for more than 15 years.  He had to work much in order to reach his goals one of which was to buy two cars he currently leases out to generate extra household income.  He’s able to continue supporting his mother this way.  His next goal is to buy another car to continue leasing it.

His current loan will be used to start a business.  He plans to lease a stand to sell clothes in.  Richard thanks Kiva lenders and commits to continue working well.

loans.use: to lease a stand.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, age 62 and widowed, is rice farmer. She has three grown children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are married. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

As a farmer, she faces many physical challenges in her business. Because of her age, she hires fellow villagers to plant and grow her rice.

Ann is applying for her first loan in the amount of $200 to pay rice planting fees.

loans.use: to pay rice planting fees

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en: Fatimah, a 48-year-old woman living in Mafraq with her husband and six children, is a very independent woman working from her home to support her husband and get her children through school and university.  Fatimah hopes to receive a loan so she can buy a sewing machine to make more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sana’a, age 46, runs a small business from her home, selling clothes, cosmetics, and perfumes to her friends and neighbors. She lives with her husband and four children in Wihdat, Jordan. She operates her business so that she can help her husband with the family expenses.

She has requested a loan in order to increase her business capital and buy a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and buy a larger variety of products

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela.	
Trabalha como agente de serviço. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, aros, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro espera terminar a sua casa e progredir profissionalmente aumentando o nível de escolarização, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de escolas com o nível superior no distrito onde trabalha.
texts.en:
She's single and has two children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her mother who lives with her.
She works as a service agent. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (iron, cement, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she hopes to finish building her home and to advance professionally by upgrading her education level. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is the lack of college-level schools in the district where she works.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, cement, window frames. etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Gezabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Gezabeth de 33 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos ella trabaja en una fabrica de la localidad desde hace 3 años pero no solo eso ella trabaja vendiendo vales de calzado, además de vender ropa de segunda mano. Es un ejemplo para sus hijos porque a pesar de ser madre soltera ha sabido salir adelante por cuenta propia, ella sabe que tiene que luchar por sus hijos quienes son su motivación. Gezabeth en esta ocasión pide de nuestra ayuda para comprar ropa para seguir vendiendo e incrementar sus ganancias para no tener carencias económicas en su casa.
texts.en:
Gezabeth is 33 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. She has been working in a local factory for three years, but not only that: she works selling shoes for vouchers, and also sells second-hand clothing. 

She is an example for her children, because despite being a single mother, she has learned to get ahead on her own. She knows she has to struggle for the sake of her children, who are her motivation. 

On this occasion, Gezabeth is asking for our help to buy clothing; so that she can continue selling and increase her earnings, so as not to have financial shortfalls in her household.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es:
Le presentamos a la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Juventud Unida” conformado por 06 personas responsables dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales, siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Esta vez conocerán sobre el socio Andy.
Andy tiene 18 años de edad, conviviente con 01 hijo. Hace 02 años que trabaja brindando servicio de instalaciones de redes inalámbricas por su localidad. Con los conocimientos que adquirió con sus estudios, le dio la oportunidad para buscar trabajo, Se siente feliz, pues a su corta edad ha podido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su familia. Más adelante desea independizarse y formar su propio negocio de redes de instalaciones inalámbricas. El crédito que solicito lo utiliza para los gastos de su hogar, pues piensa comprar algunos electrodoméstico (licuadora)la cual le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Andy junto al Grupo “Juventud Unida” agradece a los prestamistas Kiva ya que hacen posible su progreso. Andy es el que esta sentado en la parte de adelante viste chompa negra y pantalón blanco.
texts.en:
This is the new “Juventud Unida” (United Youth) communal bank whose members are six responsible people dedicated to various commercial activities; most of them are neighbors from the area.  On this occasion you will learn about Andy.

Andy is 18-years-old and has a spouse and a son.  He’s been working for two years installing wireless networks in his location.  With the knowledge he acquired through his studies he was able to secure employment.  He feels happy because at his young age he’s been able to improve his home and support his family.  Later on he’d like to become independent and establish his own wireless network installation firm.

He will use the requested loan for personal household expenses because he plans to buy home appliances (a blender) that will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life.

Andy and the Juventud Unida group thank Kiva lenders because they make their progress possible.  Andy is sitting in front wearing a black jacket and white pants.

loans.use: to buy a blender.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 35 años, es un hombre muy trabajador. Su esposa es Lidia, con quien tiene dos hijos: Lori y Nordi. Esta familia tiene su casa propia, que Jorge y otros familiares construyeron.
Su principal actividad es la agricultura, lleva como 8 años en estas labores y menciona que le va bien. Con su esfuerzo logró comprar terrenos donde produce papas, habas y arvejas, trabajando a lado de su esposa; “mientras estoy en el campo, mi esposa trae el almuerzo y después trabaja conmigo”, menciona. Además posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Sus hijos, al llegar de sus centros de estudios, se encargan de atenderla mientras realizan sus tareas de la escuela. Sus metas son claras; mejorar su producción y ampliar sus terrenos y así obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzado” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. Agradece la confianza por todos estos años de trabajo y menciona que le agrada participar en las reuniones de su grupo, porque sus socios son alegres y solidarios.
Jorge iniciará la campaña de siembra más grande del año, por eso invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 sacos de semillas de papa y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old, and he's a hard working man. His wife is Lidia, and they have two children: Lori and Nordi. This family has their own home that Jorge and other families built. 

He works in agriculture which he's been doing for 8 years and that he says is going well. Through his efforts, he's been about to buys fields where he grows potatoes, beans, and peas, working alongside his wife. "While I am in the field, my wife brings lunch and then works with me," he says. Additionally he has a small grocery and convenience store in his house. His kids, after coming home from school, are in charge of the store while they do their homework at the same time. His goals are clear: improve production, expand his fields, and get a better income for his family. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Punray avanzado," and this is his 10th loan with MFP. He is thankful for the trust he's received over these years of work, and he has that he likes participating in the group meetings because the members are joyful and team-minded. 

Jorge will start a larger harvest this year, and he will invest the money into the purchase of 10 sacks of potato seed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of potato seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora. Con su pareja tiene un hijo de 24 años llamado Freddy. Juntos viven en su casa propia, compartiendo las ganas y el deseo de superación.

Ella se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera. En la zona en la que vive se encuentra la principal empresa transformadora del fruto de esta planta y es su principal comprador. Tiene una chacra propia en donde realiza esta actividad desde hace 7 años aproximadamente. Trabaja con la ayuda de 2 ó 3 obreros, ya que su hijo estudia y trabaja junto a su cónyuge en otras actividades; sin embargo, en algunas ocasiones de extremada urgencia ellos le brindan el apoyo necesario en las labores de cosecha para que pueda cumplir a tiempo con el pedido que le solicitan. Complementa esta labor con la bodega que ha establecido hace 2 años en su casa, ahí atiende tranquilamente a los clientes que llegan en busca de algún producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede generar sus ingresos sin realizar labores complicadas, además puede brindarle la atención necesaria a su familia y cumplir con las funciones del hogar. Le está yendo muy bien, ya que sus productos son vendidos a un buen precio y obtiene buena rentabilidad por ello. Para más adelante espera ampliar su extensión de siembra y aumentar el número de plantas para la producción. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) contratará a dos personas para que realicen las labores de limpieza, poda, plateo e interlíneas en su parcela. El jornal que paga por hectárea trabajada a cada persona es de 120 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Noemi, 55, is a very happy and enterprising woman.  She and her spouse have a 24-year-old son, Freddy.  Together they live in their own house, sharing the will and desire for improvement.

She works planting and harvesting palm oil.  In the area where she lives is the main company that transforms the fruit of this plant and it is her main buyer.  She has her own farm where she has done this work for approximately seven years.  She works with the help of two or three laborers because her son is a student and he works with her spouse on other jobs.  Nevertheless, in times of great need they give her the help she needs in the harvest so she can meet her deadline for her orders.

She complements this job with the grocery store in her house that she set up two years ago.  There she takes care of the customers who come to her house in search of some product.  What she likes most about the job is that she can generate her own income without doing complicated work.  Also, she can give her family the necessary attention and complete her work in the home.

It is going very well for her because she sells her products at a good price and she gets good profits from it.  In the future she hopes to expand her planting area and increase the number of plants for production.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence they place in her to receive this loan.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments punctually.  It pleases her to be part of the communal bank she belongs to because she has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount (1000 soles [PEN]) she will hire two people to do the weeding, pruning, digging, and irrigation on her plot of land.  She will pay each person a wage of 120 PEN per hectare worked.

loans.use: to hire two laborers to work on her land.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 55 años, está casado con Juana, con quien tiene dos hijos: Frateli y Abdias. Ellos viven en la casa que Gregorio construyó con mucho esfuerzo.
Hace más de 30 años que él se dedica a la agricultura, aprovechando los buenos suelos que tiene su localidad. En todos estos años aprendió a sembrar papa, arveja y maíz, y según comenta, lo hace con destreza. “El trabajo es cansado, desde la mañana tengo que hacer la limpieza y cuidar cultivos de los insectos”, dice. Ahora cuenta con 10 parcelas de terrenos que adquirió poco a poco gracias a su trabajo. Además trabaja con albañil en algunas construcciones, así apoya con ingresos extras a su familia. Gregorio está emocionado, sabe que las siembras de este mes serán buenas y grandes por la temporada de lluvia que se acerca. Tiene planeado sembrar arvejas y papas.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando” y este es su crédito número 10 con MFP. Además se siente a gusto trabajando con su grupo y por el apoyo para su progreso.
Gregorio sembrará arvejas, por ello invertirá los 800 soles en la compra de una bolsa de semillas.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 55 years old, and he's married to Juana with whom he has two children: Frateli and Abdias. They live in a house the Gregorio built with a lot of hard work. For more than 30 years he's worked in agricultre thanks to the good soil he has where he lives. In these years he's learned to grow potatoes, peas, and corn, as he says, with skill. "The work is tiring. In the morning I have to do the cleaning and protect the crops against insects," he says. Now he has 10 plots of land that he acquired bit by bit thanks to his hard work. Additionally he works as a mason in some construction projects, which brings in extra money for his family. Gregorio is excited; he knows that the harvest in this month will be good and big because of the rainy season that they've had. He plans to plans peas and potatoes. 

He belongs to the communal back "Punray avanzado," and this is his 10th loan with MFP. Furthermore he likes working with the group and for the support of his progress. Gregorio will plant peas and to the that he will invest the 800 soles into the purchase of a bag of seeds.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea tiene 51 años, tiene nueve hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con cinco de ellos.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 22 años. Sus hijos, que ya tienen edad para apoyarla, lo hacen sin dudarlo. Cultiva arvejas y papas en sus dos hectáreas de terreno, los que consiguió gracias a varios años de trabajo. Para la venta de cada cosecha ya tiene clientes fijos en la ciudad. Pero como la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos sola era demasiada, también se dedicó a la elaboración de quesos. Sus días son agitados y de mucho trabajo, pero ya está acostumbrada a este ritmo. Ahora inicia la temporada de siembra y ella no piensa quedarse atrás.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP, donde agrade esta oportunidad y promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Los 3000 soles que ahora necesita son para comprar semillas de papa y arveja, y diez bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 51 years old and has 9 children, and now she lives alone with 5 of them. 

She has worked in agriculture since she was 22 years old. Her children, since they were old enough to help her, have done that without hesitation. She grows peas and potatoes in her two hectares of land which she got after several years of work. In order to sell each harvest she has loyal customers in the city. But because the responsibility of supporting her children alone is too much, she also sells cheese products. Her days are busy with work, but she's used to that pace. Now she's starting the planting season, and she's not thinking of anything else. 

She belongs to the bank "Punray avanzado," and this is her 10th loan with MFP who she thanks for this opportunity and promises to be punctual in the repayment of her loan like she was with previous loans. The 300 soles that she needs now are to buy potato and pea seeds as well as 10 bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds as well as 10 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih, a 42-year-old married father of two children, has worked as a carpenter specializing in furniture-making for the past 16 years. Rabih was a weekly employee until he decided to start his own business. He bought his machines gradually, because he didn't have enough money to buy them all at once.

Rabih is a hard worker who puts so much effort into improving his business to improve his family's living conditions and move from the Palestinian area they are living in. He is working hard to educate his children to see them become significant people in the future, and he hopes that the Palestinian's situation will get better in Lebanon so they will be capable of choosing their own working sector like other persons.

Rabih is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy new tools that will enable him to bring a high quality to requested projects in a short period of time. This will lead to increased net profits that will allow him to elevate his family's social and financial standing. Rabih hopes to expand his working zone and hire employees to cover a wider area, thereby enhancing his furniture-making reputation.

Rabih hopes to buy a house of his own and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his business.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, age 32 (pictured at Maxima’s service office) is a garment worker. She and her husband Polo, age 37, have been married since 2001. Polo also works as a garment worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh with their two children, a son and a daughter. Both children are in school. 

Sophea is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to build a concrete brick room.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room

loans.name: Juu Kwa Juu Group

texts.en:
Elisaria is in his early 20s and single.  He has had a beauty salon for three years now.  He is really hard working. He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elisaria’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   He used the previous loan to buy a brick-making machine and to pay household expenses.  He has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to rent a plot and buy cement.  Elisaria’s dream is one day to be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Juu Kwa Juu," with ten members.  The group members will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rent a plot and buy cement.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.es:
Juvencio tiene 63 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Convive hace 40 años con su pareja y fruto de esa unión tiene seis hijos que ya son mayores. Ahora vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente y es con ella quien pasa sus días.

Él se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de palma aceitera. Muy temprano sale a su chacra donde revisa cómo va el crecimiento de sus plantas y trata de mantener limpia de malezas toda su área sembrada. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 20 años y le permitió tener solvencia económica, además de brindarle la oportunidad de apoyar en muchas cosas a sus hijos. Trabaja solo, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, lo cual le permite ahorrar dinero que eventualmente podría utilizarlo en contratar personal de campo. Tiene un vehículo el cual usa para transportar toda su cosecha hasta el lugar donde la vende. Complementa este negocio trabajando como obrero en construcciones y edificaciones de viviendas. Por otra parte también trabajar como operador de madera cuando se presenta tal oportunidad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo principal es que le brinda el tiempo necesario para poder realizar sus otras actividades. Le está yendo bien porque al igual que los demás agricultores de su sector y que trabajan con este cultivo, vende sus productos a buen precio a una empresa aceitera que está ubicada a unos kilómetros de su chacra. Espera poder mantenerse al ritmo que esta hasta ahora y seguir hacia adelante.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibirlo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000) comprará los repuestos y las piezas necesarias para refaccionar su vehículo de carga, ya que requiere un arreglo urgente para que pueda funcionar adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Juvencio is 63 years old. He is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has lived in a common law relationship with his partner for the past 40 years and they have six children who are all now adults. Now he lives with his wife in his own house and it is with her that he passes his days.

He dedicates himself to cultivating and harvesting the oil palm. He leaves for his fields very early, where he inspects his plants’ growth and tries to keep his cultivated area well weeded. He has been engaged in this work for the past 20 years and it has allowed him to be economically viable as well as providing him the opportunity to support his children for many of their expenses.  He works alone, however occasionally his sons help him which enables him to save money that he could eventually use to contract a labor force. He owns a van that he uses to transport his entire crop to the place where he sells it. 

Juvencio complements this business by working as a laborer constructing residential buildings. In addition, he also works as a wood operator when the opportunity presents itself. What he likes about his main line of work is that it provides him the necessary time to engage in other activities. His farming is going well because, similar to other agriculturalists in the sector who work with the oil palm, he sells his products at a good price to a palm oil business that is located a few kilometers from his farm. He hopes to be able to maintain the same work rhythm that he has had up to now and to continue moving forward.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is grateful for the opportunity and confidence shown in him. He is committed to making his payments on time and as well he likes being part of the communal bank he belongs to because he has seen that its members are responsible and supportive people. With the sum requested (S/. 1,000), he will purchase spare parts and the necessary replacements to refurbish his van, because he urgently needs to make repairs so that it will run properly.

loans.use: to purchase the spare parts and necessary replacements to repair his van.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 37-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She started in the beauty business 19 years ago. In 2005, Dalal opened her own salon and is very happy that she took this step forward, because it helped a lot in improving her family's income to cover most of her children's needs, especially educational. 

Dalal's salon is located in the Palestinian camp where she lives, since she's Palestinian. Most of her customers are her area's citizens, relatives and friends. It's hard for her to get employed or to start a business outside the camp because it's very expensive, but she hopes that one day that she will be able to take the step of opening a beauty salon outside. Dalal, just like everyone living in Lebanon, suffers from lack of electricity. Since her business depends on it, she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a power generator. Dalal hopes to make her dream of opening her own salon outside the camp come true in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a power generator for her salon

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 32 years old and married, with three children. She sells clothes to make a living. She does farming to generate extra income, and the family also depends on her husband's salary. 

She has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. She needs a loan of 70,000 KES to buy clothes for resale. 

She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to grow her business. She has also learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38-year-old married man with four children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in produce business for ten years.  He started with one million UGX and now has four million UGX as working capital. His problems are price fluctuation and inflation. Moses intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

His personal goal is educating hs children. His business goal is expanding his business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Bun Chhan

texts.en:
Bun Chhan (pictured here), age 33, is a garment worker. Her husband, Phan, age 35, is a driver. They have two children – one attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bun Chhan is asking for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting and to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting and to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Chonje

texts.en: Chonje is married and the mother of six children, four of whom attend school. The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 1. For years she has specialized in the sale of local brew from a small stall in her compound. She has experience with loans, this being her third loan with Yehu, and is requesting this loan so as to renovate her store. This will make her customers more comfortable; hence, increase her clientele and fulfill the demands of her customers. With her savings, Chonje wants to contribute to the education of her children and to grow her business. However, she says that she would like to change her business and open a kiosk in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her store.

loans.name: Tuinuane Group

texts.en:
Napili, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child, who goes to school.  She has had a clothing business for two years now.  She works from 8 a.m to 5 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This  will be her first loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more clothes to resell.   Her dream is to one day be able to own a house and to sell her clothes at better prices.
	
Napili will share this loan with her loan group, “Tuinuane,“ which has 19 members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin, age 26, operates a gift shop. He has run his business for two years. He and his wife have two children and live in Kasese, Uganda. His primary hardships are the seasonal nature of the business, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations, and inflation. 

His personal goals are securing the education of his children and building a permanent house for the family. His business goals are diversifying his business and expanding into new markets. 

Godwin is requesting a loan in order to buy gifts to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy gifts to offer for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa, Constantina, desde hace más de 30 años. Tienen cinco hijos, pero ahora solo viven con dos de ellos.
Desde los 25 años se dedica a la agricultura con la producción de arvejas, maíz, papas y habas. Para ello cuenta con terrenos propios. “Mis cosechas son de calidad porque me preocupo en sacar las papas en variedades que la gente más compra”, menciona. Cada vez que cosecha ofrece sus productos en el mercado mayorista, donde tiene clientes que ya lo conocen y saben de sus productos. Como su trabajo es arduo por las extensiones de tierras, contrata personal a quienes les paga puntual cada día. Esta vez invertirá en la siembra de arvejas.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Punray Avanzando” y este es su noveno crédito con MFP. Promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales y le agrada el trabajo en su grupo porque los socios son responsables.
Con el dinero de este préstamo Francisco comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Francisco is 60 years old and lives with his wife of more than thirty years, Constantina.  They have five children, but now they only live with two of them.  For the past 25 years, he has worked in agriculture, [specifically] the production of peas, corn, potatoes and beans.  To [facilitate] this, he relies on his own land.  "My crops are [of high] quality because I take care to produce the potato varieties that people purchase the most," he mentions.  Each time that he harvests, he offers his products in the wholesale market, where he has customers that already know him and know of his products.  Since his work is arduous due to the expansiveness of the land, he hires workers that are paid promptly each day.  This time, he will invest in the planting of peas.

He is a member of the community bank, "Punray Avanzando," and this is his ninth loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma).  He promises to be punctual in making his monthly payments and is happy to work in his group because the [other] members are responsible [people].  With the money from this loan, Francisco will buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in the tailoring and farming businesses for ten years.   Lillian wants money to buy land for growing crops.  She has hardships of seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving her business to a more permanent location

loans.use: to buy land for growing crops.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, vive sola junto a sus cuatro hijos: una hija de 19 años, un Varón de 17 años, que trabaja como vendedor de mostrador en un supermercado y dos varones más de 15 y 11 años respectivamente; quienes, le ayudan a desarrollar sus actividades comerciales para generar los ingresos necesarios para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
En el año 2004, decidió separarse de su compañero de vida, debido a que padecía de problemas de alcoholismo, siendo un mal ejemplo para sus hijos y no le permitía trabajar en ventas.

Ella argumenta que desde pequeña a realizado actividades comerciales, desde que vivía con sus padres vendía de casa en casa frutas de temporada, siempre fue su satisfacción terminar con todo lo que llevaba para vender. Hoy posee una pequeña tienda que inició desde finales de noviembre del año 2007, posee un coche o remolque adecuado para la venta de hot-dog y hamburguesas, actividad que la realiza todos los días de 5:30 p.m. a 9:00 p.m. frente a su vivienda y posee una bicicleta adecuada para la venta de tacos, esta la utiliza para ir a vender a un centro escolar que se encuentra ubicado a un kilómetro de su vivienda de lunes a viernes de 9.00 a.m. 10:00 a.m.
Todos los productos que comercializa en la tienda, incluyendo los que utiliza para la elaboración de la comida rápida, los compra todos los días, en centros comerciales de la ciudad situados a 5 kilómetros de su casa y se traslada por medio del transporte urbano.
Maria solicita el préstamo para construir una galera y para en cementar el piso, para iniciar el negocio de venta de tortillas y cancelar un compromiso financiero con otra institución. 
Con la inversión, adecuará su local de venta para iniciar con un nuevo de negocio (venta de tortillas) y mejorará la instalación al techar el lugar donde atiende sus clientes de hot-dog y hamburguesas. A demás de  cancelar un compromiso financiero y le permitirá mejorar ordenar la situación financiera.
 Entre sus metas están el ampliar su negocio, enseñar a sus hijos sobre la administración del mismo y crear la capacidad económica suficiente para invertir en la compra una vivienda amplia para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 35, lives with her 4 children: a 19 year-old daughter, a 17-year old son who works behind a counter in a supermarket, and two other sons who are 15 and 11 years old, respectively.  Her children help her to develop her commercial activities so that she can generate the income she needs to improve their living conditions.  Maria decided to separate from her life partner in 2004 due to his alcoholism, as it was a bad example for her children and because he wouldn't allow her to work in sales.  She argued that from the time that she was very small she has been carrying out work in retail trade; when she was living with her parents she used to sell seasonal fruits from their house.  She was always very satisfied when she could sell all the products she had brought to sell. 

Now Maria has a small store that she started up at the end of November in 2007.  She has a cart, or trailer, that she has set up to sell hot-dogs and hamburgers, and she does this work every day from 5:30pm until 9pm in front of her house.  She also has a bicycle set up to sell tacos, and she uses this to sell at a school that is located a kilometer from her house from Mondays through Fridays from 9 to 10am.  She buys all of the products that she sells in her store, including those that she uses to make fast food, from shopping centers in the city located 5 kilometers from her house.  She transports these products using public transportation.  

Maria is requesting a loan to build a shed and to put cement on the floor so that she can start a business selling tortillas and pay off a loan that she has from another institution.  With this investment, she will set up her sales post to start a new business (selling tortillas) and will make an improvement to the roof in the place where she sells to her hot-dog and hamburger customers.  In addition, she will pay off another loan, which will allow her to improve her financial situation.   Among her goals are: expanding her business, teaching her children how to run the business, and creating sufficient capital to invest in the purchase of a big house for her family.

loans.use: to build a shed and put in a cement floor to start a business selling tortillas, and to pay of a loan that she has with another institution

loans.name: Furgencia Eulalia

texts.es:
Doña Furgencia es una señora de 40 años de edad. vive a un kilometro de la colonia los Laureles, es madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad quienes estudian la primaria en la escuela divino redentor, a pesar que no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijos ella siempre trata que no les falte nada principalmente el pan de cada dia, trabaja para el MINED como docente desde hace 9 años, actualmente esta estudiando su primer año de licenciatura en educacion en la universidad URACCAN, es una  profesora humilde, responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y su comunidad.

Está solicitando su 7mo credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y hecharle el embaldozado por lo que con el credito anterior no le alcanzo el dinero para realizar estas mejoras y ella requiere de mas prestamos para ir poco a poco hasta verla terminada su vivienda. Su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda para asi tener mejor comodidad y vivir en un ambiente agradable y seguir estudiando para llegar a ser una excelente profesional asi mismo tener estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Furgencia is 40 years old. She lives a kilometer from the Los Laureles neighbourhood. She is a single mother of two small children who are attending Divino Redentor Primary School. Although she does not have the help of their father, she always tries to make sure her children are not in need of anything, especially their daily bread. 

She has been working as a teacher for MINED for over 9 years, and is currently studying her first year of an education degree in URACCAN University.
She is a humble, responsible, honest and hard-working teacher who is very-much liked by her colleagues and community.

She is asking for her seventh loan to improve her home, for plastering and tiling, as her last loan was insufficient to allow her to finish these improvements and she requires a further loan to keep slowly moving forward until she finishes her home. 

Her dream is to keep improving her home to have more comfort and live in a pleasant environment and to continue studying so that she can become an excellent teacher and have job security and health.

loans.use: to finish building her house

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Sonia labora como conserje  del Hospital Jacinto Hernàndez en Nueva Guinea desde hace 25 años,  es una señora bien querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y cuenta con la ayuda econòmica de su esposo quien trabaja para la municipalidad de Nueva Guinea como tractorista ambos son asalariados, no tiene hijos que mantener todos son  mayores de edad, segun referencias comerciales y personales es muy responsable y honesta.                                                                             
Solicita su crèdito para Construcciòn de una habitaciòn en su casa y asi poder gozar de mejores condiciones.  Su mayor sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, gozar de salud y trabajo.
texts.en:
Sonia has worked as a janitor in the Jacinto Hernàndez Hospital in Nueva Guinea for the past 25 years and she is loved by all her companions there.  Her husband, who works for the town of Nueva Guinea as a tractor driver helps with the family expenses.  They both are on salary, don’t have any young children in their home now to support, and according to commercial and personal references, Sonia is very honest and responsible.
She is requesting a loan to do some construction in her house so they can enjoy better living conditions.  Her biggest dream is to improve the infrastructure of her home and to enjoy good health and her work.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Tuvshinbaatar

texts.en:
Tuvshinbaatar is 39 years old, and he works in the power plant in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working since 1994 nonstop and has become one of the skillful specialists at the electric power plant. 

He lives with his wife and son in the city. His family owns an old apartment with two rooms.  They have been living there since 1994; before that, he used to live with his parents. 

Since 1998 he has not made any repairs or renovations to his home, and now it is old and rundown.  In winter it becomes too cold to live in because of the heat loss through the door and window of the living room.  In response, sometimes he uses a coal stove to heat his home. His son Tuvshinbayar, who is 14, always has a flu and cold every winter. 

So he decided to repair his apartment.  At first he will enclose the balcony by the installing shelter. He hopes it will reduce the heat loss through the window of the living room and the need to use the toxic coal fuel.   He can use his new balcony with the shelter in various ways, such as storing things.  Then he is planning to replace the new doors to the rooms to retain heat well. 

Now Tuvshinbaatar needs about 4 million MNT to implement his plan for his family’s environmental welfare. The loan he is taking will used to buy  building materials to make the shelter on his balcony and replace the old doors at home.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to repair and weather-proof his home.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 22 years old and married, with a two-year-old daughter.

Timothy has a motorcycle  transport business that he has been operating for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a new motorbike

He hopes to buy a lorry, which will help facilitate transportation of products.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 50 años, está casada con Gerardo, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papas, habas y arvejas. “Esta vez pienso sembrar papa “Yungay”, porque es una de las más solicitadas”, menciona. Este mes inicia las siembras por ello requiere de apoyo para seguir con su crecimiento. Además vende carne de res, oveja, cerdo, etc.  Y como en su zona no hay mucho tránsito de vehículos tiene que adquirir su mercadería de la ciudad para negociarla en dos días. Pero este mes está dándole prioridad a sus cultivos de papa.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. Promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, y además menciona que le agrada su grupo porque todos ellos comparten los mismos intereses.
Victoria invertirá este dinero en la compra de 15 sacos de semilla de papa, y lo restante será para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old.  She is married to Gerardo, with whom she has six children but now they live with only three of the children.  She makes a living in agriculture, with the planting of potatoes, broad beans and peas.  “This time I plan to plant the “Yungay” potato, because it is one of the most requested,” she mentions.  This month she begins the planting and for that she needs the support in order to continue with her growth.  She also sells beef, lamb, pork, etc.  And as in her area there isn’t much vehicle traffic she has to acquire her merchandise from the city in order to do business with it in two days.  But this month she is giving priority to the cultivation of potatoes.

She belongs to the communal bank “Punray avanzando” and this is her tenth loan with MFP.  She promises to be punctual in the payment of the installments.  She also mentions that she likes her group because they all share the same interests.  Victoria will invest this money in the purchase of 15 sacks of potato seeds and the rest will be to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of potato seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: St Eva United Group

texts.en:
Ketty is a 45-year-old married woman, with six children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling fish for ten years.  She started with 80,000 shillings, and now she has 200,000 shillings as working capital.  Her hardships are taxes, finding customers, price fluctuations, and inflation. 

Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into new markets.

Ketty wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.  She is a member of the St Eva United group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Francisca Graciela

texts.es:
Doña Graciela de 57 años  de edad, labora como supervisora de enfermeria desde hace 38 años en hospital de Nueva Guinea,  tiene 2 hijos los dos mayores de edad viven en su propia casa, de ella depende economicamente solamente 1 nietecito de 5 añitos de edad al que cuida como su propio hijo. 

Graciela esta solicitando su 2do credito a Kiva pero el 3er en Afodenic para comprar piedras canteras y cemento para realizar un cuarto en su vivienda y asi presentar mejor comodidad a su familia. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y ver que a su pequeño nietecito todo un profesional.
texts.en:
Graciela is 57 years old and has been working as a nursing supervisor for 38 years in a hospital in Nueva Guinea. She has 2 adult children. She lives in her own house. Only one 5-year-old grandchild is financially dependent on her, who she cares for as if he were her own child. 

Graciela is asking for her second Kiva loan, her third from Afodenic to buy quarry stones and cement to build a room in her house and in this way to provide her family with more comfort. Her dream is for her family to remain united and for her little grandson to have a profession.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: October

texts.en:
October, who is 23 years old, makes the traditional Mongolian nomadic shoes at her home. She lives with her husband and her son in the old house in the ger district (a ger is a Mongolian traditional yurt) in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Sshe has been making the shoes for four years, and she has many permanent customers.  Her average output is 4 to 5 shoes in a month.  She sells them to her customers for about MNT 150,000; her cost is MNT 60,000.  Her husband is a teacher and earns not so much. 

She really wanted to repair her house because it is a cold and uncomfortable place.  In winter her home becomes very cold; frost forms on the walls. Her house has not had any big renovation for many years; before, her parents had lived there. 

She is planning to insulate the walls with foam and cement within this summer.  She said that her work place and home will be comfortable, and she and her family will be inspired by it.  She also thinks it is very important to her family’s health in the future. The loan she is taking will be used to buy the building materials.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 27-year-old married man, with two children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in the produce business for three years.  He started with one million shillings, and he now has three million shillings as revolving capital. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock and inflation.

His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car.   His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding business into new markets, and hiring employees to help expand the business.

Timothy wants a loan to buy coffee and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah, 33 years old and married, has been operating a retail shop for over five years to earn a living. She also depends on her husband's salary. Her previous loan from Faulu Kenya helped her to grow her business, and she has become knowledgeable in financial management through seminars.

Delilah is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy maize flour, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.name: Ayshi

texts.en:
Ayshi is a 47-year-old Lebanese single woman. She's living with her one parent and two working siblings. They all cooperate together to seek a better life. This is the reason why Ayshi started to work very early, hoping she could bring added income to the family. She has been working in cosmetic sales since 2000. She has customers from all over the neighboring areas.
 
Today, she has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to buy beauty products such as lipsticks, powders, eye shadows and many other items. This will be her third loan, and it will help her boost her earnings and, therefore, improve her family’s way of living. One of Ayshi’s biggest dreams is to better develop her business and gain the biggest number of clients that she can.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as lipsticks, powders, eye shadows and many other items

loans.name: Santana

texts.es: Don Santana tiene la edad de 44, tiene tres hijos uno de 22, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente,los mayores trabajan y continuan sus estudiso profesionales, don Santana labora como obrero especializado para el INTA desde hace 15 años, es un hombre trabajador en sus dias libre trabaja cultivando raices y tuberculos de los cuales obtiene otros ingresos familiares, segun referencias comerciales, personales es un hombre responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, su esposa es una mujer humilde la cual se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y de cuidar sus hijos.                                                                                            Solicita su crèdito para invertirlo en pequeños arreglos de su vivienda como cambiarle zinc a la cocina ya que con el credito anterior no pudo lograr cambiar todo el techo. Su sueño es que su familia siga en los caminos de Dios, gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral para que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Santana is 44 and has three children ages 22, 18 and 15 respectively. The two older children work and also continue their trade studies.  Mr. Santana has been working in construction for the past 15 years specifically for INTA [Nicaraguan Institute of Agricultural Technology].  On his free days, he also works growing roots and tuberos [such as yams] to add to the family income.  His professional references consider him to be responsible person, honest and very hardworking.  His wife is a humble woman who is in charge of the household chores and takes care of their children.
He is requesting a loan to invest in his small home odd jobs such as changing corrugated zinc over the kitchen, since with the last loan he could not afford to update the whole roof.  His dream is for his family to follow the way of the Lord, enjoy good health, stable work and not to go without the basic needs at home.

loans.use: to complete odd jobs on his home such as changing corrugated zinc roofing.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a business-lady who runs a salon. She has employed one person in the business. She has managed to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. She has also been trained on business management skills.
Mirriam hopes to expand her business in five years. She needs 100,000 KES to buy a hairdryer and hair treatment.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and hair treatment

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
This is Toufic, a Lebanese single man. He’s 25 years old. From childhood until now, Toufic has lived with his parents, as well as his three siblings, one of whom is working. His father is the one responsible for covering their costs and expenses. However, Toufic doesn’t hesitate to give help whenever needed. This is why he decided to start his own business. He opened his own laptop and mobile phone shop in 2009. He also sells recharge cards as well to gain extra earnings.
Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, laptops and many other items. This Kiva loan will certainly increase his sales, and thus his profits. This is how Toufic works every day to build a good future, hoping to get married and have children as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for his business such as cellphones, recharge cards, laptops and many other items.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32, and lives with her life companion in a rental house. She sells various kinds of dishes, snacks, and beverages. She has been working in this business for two years, and is experienced in sales.

One of her greatest advantages in dealing with competition is her friendliness with the people who visit her stand. She already has a large clientele, as people prefer her because of the quality of the foods she sells and the good prices, but especially for the unmatched service.

Mariam is a woman very dedicated to her work; she is always ready to do her utmost to succeed. She is aware that she will achieve success only through motivation and perseverance. Mariam is very motivated, and says that in this sales season her earnings will increase.

She wants to invest in more dishes, but needs working capital. That is why she is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy wheat flour, sugar, and other necessary ingredients.
Mariam has good payment references and an impeccable moral character. She says she will be able to repay the loan, and at the same time provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 2 est composé de six personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Monique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Monique est âgée de 56 ans et est mariée à un certain Michel. Monique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Monique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Monique vend depuis une vingtaine d’années, du pétrole et de la farine de blé à une place publique du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Monique sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 2, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 2 comprises six persons who reside in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Monique, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 56 years old and married to a man named Michel. 

Monique did not attend school. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. Monique lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in the different household expenses.

To help with the different household expenses, Monique has been selling kerosene and wheat flour for about twenty years at a public location in Benin. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Monique, along with the other members of the group  GBENONKPO TONAFA 2, is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise the level of their business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and some wheat flour

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 9 est composé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Amandine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Amandine est âgée de 26 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Amandine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Amandine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés dont aucun ne reste à charge. Amandine vit seule. Ses divers besoins sont assurés par son mari. Pour contribuer à ses différents besoins, Amandine vend des produits de beauté et des mèches dans un quartier du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Amandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Amandine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 9, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 9 comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Amandine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 26 years old and no longer lives with her husband. 

Amandine left school at the secondary level. She is the mother of two children, both in school. Neither are in her care. Amandine lives by herself. Her diverse needs are met by her husband. 

To help meet her need, Amandine sells beauty products and hair extensions in a district in Benin. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Amandine, along with the other members of the group  GBENONKPO TONAFA 9, is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise the level of their business and to grow their customer base and their revenues. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Houn-Kponou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUN-KPONOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mitondji Léontine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mitondji Léontine est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Paul. Mitondji Léontine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, ont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Mitondji Léontine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Mitondji Léontine vend depuis dix neuf ans des produits de mercerie à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Mitondji Léontine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mitondji Léontine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUN-KPONOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group HOUN-KPONOU comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Mitondji Léontine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 48 years old and married to a retailer named Paul.

Mitondji Léontine did not attend school. The couple have four children. Some are in school, and one of them remains in their care. Mitondji Léontine lives together with her husband and child. The couple share in the different household expenses. 

To help with the different family needs, Mitondji Léontine has been selling sewing supplies for nineteen years out of her home. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.
 
Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Mitondji Léontine, along with the other members of the group HOUN-KPONOU, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 24 years old and single.  To earn a living, he runs a bakery.  He has been in the business for six years.  He also does farming to earn extra income.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and gain knowledge of financial management.

He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients, such as sugar, cooking fat, and wheat flour.  He hopes grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients, such as sugar, cooking fat, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is 30 years old and single. He is Lebanese.  He’s happy with his family, his parents and two siblings, one of whom is working.

A few years ago, Hanna decided to help his father in managing the household expenses. So he opened a hairdressing salon in his town. He already has many years of experience in this domain, which makes his job professional and easier.

Today, he needs a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hairdressing tools. In that way, he will be able to improve his work by trying new and trendy hair styles.  

In the near future, Hanna will be able to make the needed amount of money and maybe start a new business.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Tonafa 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 5 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Germaine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Germaine est âgée de 58 ans et est une veuve. Germaine est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont aucun ne reste à sa charge. Germaine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses divers besoins. Pour assurer  ses différents besoins, Germaine vend du maïs et de la farine de manioc dans un quartier du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Germaine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Germaine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO TONAFA 5, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO TONAFA 5 comprises four persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Germaine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 58 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children, all educated. None of the children remain hers to support. Germaine lives alone with her children and supports herself.

To support herself, Germaine sells corn and cassava flour in a district in Benin. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.
 
Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Germaine, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO TONAFA 5, is requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise their level of business and grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 25 years old and married, with a two-month-old baby.  

He sells vehicle spare parts to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  He also works as a driver to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.

Pius needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Joevelinda

texts.en: Joevelinda is a new micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is 44 years of age, married with 7 children, most are school-age.  She has been selling ready-to-wear clothes for 3 years having a monthly income of Php 3,500.  She helps her husband to generate income to support the educational needs of their children.  She applied for a loan at PMPC to purchase ready-to-wear stock for sale.  She is hoping that the living condition of the family will be improved in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothes for sale

loans.name: Houn-Kpatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUN-KPATIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houé Victorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houé Victorine est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Houé Victorine a peu fréquenté l’école. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Houé Victorine vend depuis douze ans des tissus et des savons liquides à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Houé Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houé Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUN-KPATIN, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The  HOUN-KPATIN is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the second time that this group has requested financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to grow their business.  The leader of this group, named Houé Victorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Houé Victorine is 58 years old and married to a man named Gilbert.  She did not attend much school.   In order to help meet the different needs of her family,  Houé Victorine has been selling fabric and liquid soaps from her home through the distribution system for 12 years.  This work allows her to meet her needs without too much difficulty.  She gets her supplies at a market in Bénin and in Togo.  In the interest of meeting the demands her customers and to increase turnover and her income, Houé Victorine is requesting, along with the other members of the HOUN-KPATIN group, a second loan through ALIDé.  The previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and liquid soap.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: «GBENONKPO» est un groupe composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Véronique est mariée à un certain Gérard. Véronique vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Véronique  a peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Véronique mène comme activité la vente de charbons de bois et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Véronique sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « GBENONKPO » un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
«GBENONKPO» is a group composed of two persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Véronique (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to a man named Gerard. Véronique lives together with her children and husband and jointly ensures with her husband that the household expenses are covered.

To cope with her different expenses, Véronique has a business selling charcoal and foodstuff out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

To respond further to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and to make more profit, Véronique, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and foodstuff

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
Ayed who appears in the picture, is a 24-year-old single young man. For the past three years, he has had his own business, which is raising bees and selling their products. It has been a profitable project and he has many loyal customers. This is his only source of income to him and he needs more support to cover his costs.
Ayed is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more new bee cells to raise. This will increase sales and improve Ayed's income.

loans.use: to buy new bee cells to raise

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda is an 18-year-old student of Azerbaijan Teacher`s University. She is studying Russian language and literature and will be a teacher when she graduates. She will be studying until 2015 to gain the necessary knowledge to teach children in schools. Sevda needs to pay her tuition fee at the beginning of each year. For this purpose, she applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to pay education fee.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is 54 years old and lives in the town of Samburu in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For over 10 years, Umazi has been working hard in farming where she raises different crops. She sells her farm produce at the market. Umazi sells fresh products which is why her clientele has increased.

To help expand her farming activity, Umazi has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy planting materials, fertilizer and an ox-plough, and will help Umazi to generate greater profits from the farm by producing and selling more products. Umazi hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a borehole to facilitate irrigation during dry season.

loans.use: to buy planting materials, fertilizer and an ox-plough

loans.name: Annalee

texts.en: Annalee is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. His husband is working in Manila. To help her husband support the financial needs of the family, Annalee operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in their residence with an average monthly income of PHP 2,500. She has requested a loan from PMPC to acquire more grocery stock to sell. She wants to send her children in school until they have a degree for the sake of their future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for her store.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is a 19-year-old man who always dreamed of an education in one of the best universities in Azerbaijan. Now he is in the first years of education at Azerbaijan State University and he is very proud of himself. However, on the preliminary examination he did not reach several scores and now he is paying for his education every year. 

He studies at the school of Economy and Governance and is going to be an economist in one of the local state governmental foundations. To help reach his goals, he applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay the tuition fee for FY 2012-2013.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is married with five children and lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has operated a retail shop business for five years.He faces a challenge of price fluctuations which reduces his profit margin. His family goal is to educate his children while he plans to expand his business to new markets.Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is 46 years old, married, with 5 children living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a spare parts shop and she has been running the business for 13 years now. She got her initial capital from farming. Price fluctuation is her major challenge. Her goals are to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. Zaituni needs the loan facility to buy bicycle parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
For more than 4 years, Artsrun has been engaged in a food and household goods trading business in a rented place. Artsrun intends to develop his business so starting this summer he set up a small cafe next to his business place. He has placed 2 tables with chairs and enclosed them with straw. Now Artsrun is managing his food shop and cafe alone but he intends to enlarge it and to hire a good cook for his cafe. To expand his business, Artsrun is asking for a 300.000 AMD loan which he will use to buy and to place 2 or 3 more tables in his cafe and to buy sugar, coffee, candy and household goods for his shop. 
Artsrun lives in Kapan city. He is 35 years old. Artsrun is married and has 3 small sons. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. Artsrun’s occupations allow him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy and to place 2 or 3 more tables in his cafe and to buy sugar, coffee, candy and household goods for his shop

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and only one sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering their costs and expenses. Youssef is an independent hard worker. He sometimes visits his customers at their places or else he serves them from home if needed. He works in repairing computers and has been involved in this domain for almost seven years until he decided to work on his own.   

Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop for his business in addition to some related supplies. This Kiva loan will definitely ripen his business and permit him to carry on his work in a proper way. Youssef wishes to open a shop where he sells a wide variety of laptops and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for his business in addition to some related supplies.

loans.name: Deyling Soliette

texts.es:
