La joven Deyling de 25 años de edad es soltera, trabaja en la Escuela Miguel Larreynaga en colonia el Serrano desde hace 8 años, según referencias  personales es una joven responsable y muy trabajadora, recibe la ayuda economica del padre de su hijo  para los gastos familiares ya que son bien trabajadores y han luchado por gozar de mejoeres condiciones de vida.  

Solicita su crèdito para invertirlo en repello de su vivienda y acondicionar y asi poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda y gozar de estabilidad laboral para que no les falte lo basico en el hogar a su linda familia.
texts.en:
Deyling, a young woman of 25, is single and has worked for 8 years in the Escuela Miguel Larreynaga (Miguel Larreynaga School) in the El Serrano community. According to personal references, she is a responsible and very hardworking young lady. She receives economic support from the father of her child for the family’s expenses, since they are so hardworking and they have fought to have better living conditions. 

She is requesting her loan to use for plastering the walls in her house and to upgrade it, so little by little she can improve her home and achieve working stability, and her lovely family will not lack for any basics in their home.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es: Nemecio tiene 32 años, viven en Ivirgarzama y actualmente trabaja en una empresa de mantenimiento de caminos vial AMVI, en Valle Sacta, desde niño ayuda  a sus padres en  la agricultura, vive solo y no tiene hijos, estudio Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Mayor de San Simón, siempre  se mantuvo al margen de la agricultura, porque pensaba volver a trabajar en la parcela de su madre, hace dos años que sufrió un accidente de transito, se fracturo parte de su hueso lumbar, ahora esta recuperándose, pero se siente bien para trabajar en el campo, aprovecha los fines de semanas porque los otros días trabaja en la empresa, actualmente tiene 1 ha., de piña para exportación, para que tenga mayor rendimiento necesita hacer mantenimiento con abono químico, es por tal razón tiene el motivo de solicitar un crédito, esto le ayudara a mejorar el rendimiento de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Nemecio is 32 years old. He lives in Ivirgarzama and currently works at a road maintenance company, AMVI in Valle Sacta. He has helped his parents farm since he was a child. He lives alone and has no children. He studied business administration at Mayor de San Simón University. 

He always stayed apart from farming, because he intended to return to work on his mother's parcel of land. Two years ago, he suffered a traffic accident and fractured part of his lumbar bone. Now he is recovering, but feels well enough enough to work in the fields. He takes advantage of the weekends, because the other days he works at the company. 

Currently he has one hectare of pineapple for export. In order to have greater yield, he needs to maintain it with chemical fertilizer. It is for this reason that  he is applying for a loan. It will help him improve his crop yield.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 44 años actualmente está separado de su esposo, tiene  6 hijos de los cuales 2 aun dependen de sus ingresos y están estudiando, las dos hijas mayores  trabajan ya que no lograron terminar ni el bachillerato, la señora María y sus hijos viven en la comunidad de Kara Kara en la ciudad de Cochabamba en su propia casa,  la principal actividad de la señora María es la venta de comida, todos por las mañanas  los días vende en un puesto  que está ubicado en la calle en la misma zona donde vive y por las tardes en un kiosco para los trabajadores de una empresa de limpieza. Con la ayuda de sus hijos la señora María trabaja mucho todos los días para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que no cuentan con el apoyo económico de su  marido.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de mesas y sillas para el kiosco, con lo cual mejorara y ampliara  las condiciones de venta y los clientes podrán servirse su plato de comida más cómodamente.
Entre sus sueños y metas esta que sus 4 hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida y en futuro tener un restaurant propio ya que la señora maría lo que mejor hace es cocinar.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and is currently separated from her husband. She has 6 children, 2 of whom are in school and still dependent on her income. The two oldest daughters work, since they were not able to finish their bachelor’s degrees. María and her children live in their own house in the community of Kara Kara in the city of Cochabamba. 

Maria’s work is selling food; every morning she sells from a spot located on the street in the same area where she lives, and in the afternoons from a food stand for the hardworking employees of a cleaning service. With the help of her children, María works a lot every day in order to get her children ahead, since they cannot count on the economic support of her husband. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase tables and chairs for the stand, with which she will improve and expand her selling conditions, and her customers will be able to eat their plates of food more comfortably. Among her dreams and goals are that her 4 sons will be able to study for a professional career, so that in this way they can have a better standard of living; and in the future, to have her own restaurant, because what María does best is cook!

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her stand.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina, es una persona de 32 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo las cuales son sus hijas; la actividad económica principal de la clienta es la producción agrícola, produce papa, haba y arveja las cuales siembran en sus propias parcelas, las mismas que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de T'oqo Rancho del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Por su parte el esposo de la clienta es empleado en una empresa constructora, presta el servicio de operador de maquinaria pesada por el cual tiene una remuneración salarial mensual. Finalmente la clienta y su esposo manifiestan tener ganas de poder superarse y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de un lote en la ciudad de Santa Cruz y de tal forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rufina is 32 years old and married. She went as far as primary school. She lives in her own house and has three financial dependents; her daughters who are in her care. 

The client's principal livelihood is farming. She grows potatoes, lima beans and peas, that she plants on her own parcels of land. These are located in the community of T'oqo Rancho in Tíraque municipality, approximately 70 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

For his part, the client's husband is employed by a construction company. He works as a heavy equipment operator, and receives a monthly salary. 

Finally, the client and her husband say they are eager to improve themselves, and for this they see the need to apply for investment capital, in order to purchase a lot in the city of Santa Cruz, and that way improve their family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a friendly middle-aged woman. She is 50 years old. She got married many years ago and has four working siblings. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to be able to offer them a respectable life. 

Since their marriage, May’s husband has managed the family expenses and still does. And since May noticed that their income did not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop with the small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of women's clothes and lingerie from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. 

To better develop her work, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts, lingerie and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts, lingerie and many other items.

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi is 26 years old and single. To earn a living, he runs a barber shop, where he has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been trained in good customer care. This has made him attract more customers.

He hopes to expand the business and employ more people in the future. He needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 51-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. One is working and three others are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. 

He has owned a café since 2005, where he serves hubble-bubble, a Lebanese traditional tobacco. People visit him from all over the neighboring villages to enjoy their time with friends. 

Today, he is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase tobacco in addition to hubble-bubble equipment, not to forget the charcoal and all related products. In the future, he plans to borrow another Kiva loan so he can build a snack area beside his shop, where he can start receiving customers who would like to eat a small meal before taking a hubble-bubble.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco in addition to hubble-bubble equipment, the charcoal and all related products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, es una persona de 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia y cuenta con 5 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica principal de la clienta es la producción agrícola y los productos que cultiva son la papa, haba, arveja y cebada en sus propios terrenos que son según manifiesta producto de herencia por parte de sus padres, los mismos que se hallan situadas en la comunidad Huaylla Pujru del municipio de Tíraque distante desde la ciudad de Cochabamba a 73 Km sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz. La señora Victoria manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse y seguir ampliando su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permitirá obtener a partir de su producción  mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old. She is single, but in a common-law relationship. She went as far as primary school. She lives in her own house and has five dependents; her children who are in her care. 

The client's principal livelihood is farming, and the crops she grows are potatoes, lima beans, peas and barley. She farms her own parcels of land, which according to what she says, are an inheritance from her parents. These are located in the community of Huaylla Pujru in Tíraque municipality, 73 km from the city of Cochabamba, on the old highway to Santa Cruz.  

Victoria shows herself to be a hard-working and responsible person who wants to improve herself, and continue expanding her crop production. To that end, she sees the need to apply for working capital to buy agricultural supplies. This will allow her to obtain greater income from her production, and this is going to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Ms. Farhat is 35 years old. She is married and has six children. Five children are studying in different classes. One child is under age. She is working hard to improve the living standard of her family.

She has been running an academy for the last four years with her husband. Her motive is to provide quality education to her students at an affordable fee.  Currently, she wants to purchase furniture for a new classroom. For this purpose, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000. 

Farhat is very keen to expand her business and provide quality education to her students.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her classroom.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is an active member of Kiva partner PMPC.  She is 51 years of age and married with five children.  Three of them are adults and the other two are minors.  She has raised pigs for  the last two years and has a monthly income of Php 4,000.  She took another loan from PMPC in order to purchase feed and piglets to raise.  She hopes to support the education of their children and improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 35 years-old and married.  To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.  He also dreams of employing more people in his business.

Eliud needs a loan of 40, 000 KES in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Bomoko 1 Group

texts.en:
Edmond, aged 30, is single and has three young children; they are aged between two and five years old. He is representing the Bomoko 1 group. Edmond sells smoked fish at a stand in the market. He has been selling fish for eight years. He will use the loan to buy more fish to sell at his stand. 
Edmond has received four previous loans from Kiva’s Partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. He hopes to one day own a large fish depot in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 37-year old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1999. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages; he also makes private transportation upon client’s requests. His business returns are very important as he represents the only income source for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to perform the needed maintenance on his car paying its mechanic fee, painting the body, and repairing some small damages.  He states that these repairs will make his transportation safer and will help him attract more customers. This is his third Kiva loan and he hopes he will benefit from it to be able to improve his business as well as the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car paying its mechanic fee, painting the body, and repairing some small damages.

loans.name: Abiud

texts.en:
Abiud is 25 years-old and unmarried. He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has improved his business since he joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  His desire is to expand his business and employ many people. 

He needs a loan of 40, 000 KES in order to expand his business premises.

loans.use: to expand the business premises.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en: Bebelyn is an active micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is 40 years old, and married with five children. Her livelihood project is raising pigs; she has managed it for five years. She took a loan in PMPC to have enough money to purchase feed and medicines. She plans to use the income to feed the family and expand her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 49 years old, and a widow who lives with her five children in the south of Kenya. For some time now, Agnes has been running a business selling cereals both from home and at the market. She needs this loan to buy beans, peas, and maize. With the support of this loan, she plans to stock her business and use the profits she makes to increase her business. Her dream is to grow her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, and maize.

loans.name: Nikoll

texts.en:
Nikoll is forty-nine years old and married. He has three children ranging in age from eleven to seventeen-years old and all their family lives in the northeast part of the country. Nikoll has been in the soldering iron trade for the past ten years with the profit being good and him being happy, thus far. “The beginning was very difficult,” Nikoll explains, “yet, this was long ago” he continues saying with a smile. He has been able to build a steady and good size clientele throughout the years thanks to the high demand for his services in the region, and also the good services he has been offering since the beginning.

Nikoll is requesting a loan now, and he is aware that this is a special one because it is a Kiva loan. The previous one from the VFA institution has been paid off on time. He wants to purchase soldering iron equipment now, which will be of assistance to him as he will be able to serve  more clients, thus increasing the profit. 

His promise to all the lenders is that he will pay this loan as well on time without delay.

loans.use: To purchase soldering iron equipment.

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 1 Group

texts.en:
Solange, age 42, is single with a 24 year-old son. She also takes care of her mother. She is representing the Jehovah Jireh 1 group. Solange sells clothes and sandals in a local market. She has had this business for six years. She will use the loan in order to buy more clothing and sandals to sell. Her business strategy is to sell clothing on credit to certain customers who have earned her trust.  

Solange has received four previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She would like to open a large clothing boutique one day. She hopes to be able to help her son study abroad and travel.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Mchombo

texts.en:
Mchombo continues to operate his motorcycle transport. It has been a profitable business which has enabled him to save the profits. He is now requesting another loan of Ksh 50,000 in order to purchase another motorcycle.

His wife is also an entrepreneur who supports the family. The anticipated profits will be used to invest in his retail shop.

This is his third loan from Yehu, and he is almost through repaying his previous loan. His hopes and dream are to buy more motorbikes.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo, 32 years-old, makes a living selling consumer products such as sodas, juices, flour, snacks. etc in a kiosk. She came up with this business idea on her own because in her neighborhood there are few kiosks and they are scattered. She began this business two years ago and it's going very well since there is much activity especially during the weekends. 

Kadzo is a mother of three children all of whom live with her. The requested loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, cooking fat, etc. Her dream is to continue on the right path with the business and little by little to begin to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki lives in the Samburu area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married with two children who are 14 and 11 years-old. She owns a food stall which she has been operating for the last two years.

Riziki learned about Kiva partner Yehu through a friend and joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations, inflation and that some customers are not paying in time.

Riziki is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase ingredients such as wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings in order to expand her business. Her plans for the future are to own a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is 50-years old, and a trader who sells different kinds of goods in her shop. She has 20 years of experience in this field. She is a widow and is raising two children alone. Tahmina had a very hard life and her beloved children bring her joy and happiness.
 
Owing to her business, she is able to raise the children and bring them necessary things. Her son helps her to sell food products such as candies, soaps, detergents, cookies, macaroni, and butter. Her monthly income is 300 AZN, but this is not enough for her family.

To improve her financial situation, Tahmina decided to increase the range of merchandise in her shop. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. This will be her second loan; she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi lives in a home with her husband and her three children. She runs a food stall which she began two years ago. She started it with the support of her husband to receive earnings while staying at home. She starts her activities early in the morning and works up to late in the evening.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients with the intention of expanding the business and providing her customers with those dishes that are most necessary. She plans to purchase rice, sugar, flour, meat, and firewood. This investment will improve the stall's inventory levels.

Her objective is to be sufficiently profitable and provide a variety of foods to provide her customers with their preferences. This will help her to improve the support she gives her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, meat, and firewood.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is an artisan who works under the artistic name of J. Blas and specializes in iron wall sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of iron sheets, as well as different fixtures and enamels in order to increase production.

Ismael has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have always loved handicrafts. When I was 17, I started my own ceramic workshop, but I changed direction and began to work in wrought iron and blown glass. I experimented with sheets of iron to give my works more movement. We cut the metal sheets, hammer them into shape and weld them before treating to retard rust. Every piece created at my workshop goes hand in hand with originality, design and quality. We are always developing new designs and products."

"I thank you you for your interest in assisting us artisans, for our only desire is to work and provide for our families in a dignified manner. This interest-free microcredit means I can continue to develop those skills I inherited from my parents and grandparents, and use them in an art form that contributes to the embellishment of this wonderful world."

Use the link below to view Ismael's iron sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3675

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of iron sheets, as well as different fixtures and enamels to increase production.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has a grocery store she started five years ago that is located at a strategic point in the market. Thanks to her hard work, she’s managed to improve the business. Chari tells us that she started with very few items in her stall, but she has now increased her inventory.  She’s also invested in farming to supply groceries to her store. This reduces the cost of buying items.

She will use the loan to buy more groceries such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and mangoes, etc. She has five children to take care of since she is a widow. Her goal is to educate her children and open a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 31-year old man; he is married with two children. He is a market vendor and has seven years of experience in this field. Rovshan sells different kinds of goods such as food, detergents, office supplies, and others.
 
He usually buys some portion of his merchandise from the neighboring city and the other portion from service companies, which bring goods right to his shop. His monthly income is 300 AZN. Now, he has applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more stuff and diversify the products he sells. This will be his second loan, and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more products and diversify his inventory.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is a 48-year old woman, and is married with two children. She sells different kinds of office supplies in her shop and has been doing this for almost 10 years. Solmaz raises two children alone, because her husband passed away many years ago. She has hard times, but now, owing to her business her financial situation is stable. 

Her business brings her 100 AZN income; however, it is still hard to cover the family needs with such a low profit. Hence, she decided to improve her financial situation and business overall. For this purpose, she applied for 1500 AZN to purchase more merchandise and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and expand her business.

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en:
Fariz is 56-years old and on a pension. He is married and has four children! He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods like food, detergents, and office supplies. He says that food products as well as washing powder and soap are the most popular products in his shop. His son helps him to purchase new goods and bring them to the shop. 

His monthly income is 150 AZN, and he is would like to increase it in the next several months by purchasing more goods for his shop. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is married man with six children living in Hoima, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years now. He faces challenges of seasonal weather variations and price fluctuations. His family goal is to educate his children and business goal is to expand to new markets. Leonard intends to use the loan to pay for labor and buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en: Patrice is a first-time borrower with the institution. He applied for a loan of 1,000,000 shillings, which was granted over a period of 10 months. The purpose of the loan is to buy more coffee and increase his sales. Patrice has been in this business for the last four years and does so alongside other businesses like the sale of bananas and other agricultural products like maize, beans and millet, depending on the season and prices offered on the market. He is a married man with a permanent home, wife and children who help him in running the business. Patrice's problems include poor and unreliable weather, poor means of transport, price fluctuations and limited capital. Patrice hopes that in five years time he will be in a position to buy a bigger piece of land where he will grow more coffee for commercial  purposes. Patrice describes himself as an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman who lives in the small village of Kwale District in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is busy with trading. She purchases new clothing in Mombasa city, Kenya, and then sells them at the market. The clothes are of good quality, and they have no problems with selling. 

Zainab requested credit for purchasing bundles of clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of clothes to the customers. This will increase her sales and consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
This is Paz. She previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy scrap materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Paz hopes her business will grow further in the coming years.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members both to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials to sell in her junk shop.

loans.name: Aiden

texts.en:
This is Aiden. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Aiden hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: MASSAVO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de René. Le couple a trois enfants dont aucun scolarisé et à leur charge. Antoinette vit seule. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Antoinette vend de la bouillie (faite à base des céréales) à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Massavo is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same neighbourhood. Antoinette, the group's representative whose hand is raised in the picture, is 48 years old and married to a builder called René. The couple have 3 independent children who do not go to school. Antoinette lives alone. She did not go to school. She and her husband both take care of the various household responsibilities.

Antoinette has been selling gruel (made from cereals) from her home for nearly 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the 3rd time that Antoinette and the other members of the Massavo group request the financial support of ALIDé, with a view to strengthening their working capital and their businesses, and better responding to the demands of their clientèle. The loans previously received have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, sorghum and sugar.

loans.name: La Cle De David Group

texts.fr: «LA CLE DE DAVID» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Sophie Akouavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Sophie Akouavi est mariée à un certain Michel. Le couple a deux enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sophie Akouavi vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Sophie Akouavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sophie Akouavi mène comme activité la vente des fruits dans un marché du Bénin. Sophie Akouavi exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Sophie Akouavi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe «LA CLE DE DAVID» un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
La Clé De David Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Spohie Akouavi, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 34 years old, and married to one Michel. The couple has two children, all in their care. Some attend school. The couple ensures together that the various household expenses get covered.

Sophie Akouavi lives with her children. She never attended school. In order to provide for herself, she sells fruits in one of Benin's markets. She's been running this business for fifteen years, and gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to better meet the expectations of her ever-increasing clientele and increase her profits, Sophie Akouavi is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, together with the other members of her group. The first loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Senami Pélagie Aminath

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Senami Pélagie est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des chaussures et des boissons conditionnées en plastique à son domicile depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des habitants du quartier. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Senami Pélagie envisage améliorer le régime alimentaire de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Senami Pélagie is 32 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, who both attend school. The eldest child is 8 years old and the youngest is 4. She has been selling fabrics, shoes and drinks packaged in plastic from her home for several years. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin and her customer base is mostly made up of local residents.

Senami Pélagie has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev so that she can increase her capital and meet the needs of her customers, in order to increase her profits and be able to contribute to the educational expenses of her children. Senami Pélagie plans to improve her children's diet and be self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of fabric, 6 palettes of drinks and 10 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de pagnes, Rafatou est mariée à un menuisier aluminium. Ils ont un enfant de 02ans en charge. Elle-même est âgée de 25ans. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2011 et a des clients de parts et d’autres de la ville de LOME. Elle souhaiterait avoir une boutique pour éviter de se promener et contribuer aux besoins du foyer. Elle est à son premier crédit dans notre institution.
texts.en:
A street seller of pagnes (colourful and decorative West African material), Rafatou is married to an aluminium joiner. The couple are raising a 2-year-old.

Rafatou is 25 years old. She has been in her line of work since 2011 and has customers from all over the town of Lomé. She would like to have a shop so that she could avoid all the walking and be able to contribute to the household needs. This is her first loan from our institution.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Hodalo est âgée de 32ans et mariée à un caissier. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale et des articles scolaires et exerce cette activité à domicile. Elle vend des produits de premières nécessités depuis 2007. Pour pallier au problème de concurrence sur le marché, garder ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième prêt afin de s’approvisionner en marchandises (riz, huile végétale, sucre, tomate….). Madame Hodalo veut intervenir dans l’éducation des ses enfants, agrandir son activité.
texts.en: The mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, Hodalo is 32 years old and married to a cashier. She is a retailer of grocery products and school supplies and operates her business from her home. She has been selling basic supplies since 2007. In order to address the problem of competition in the market and keep her customers, she has requested a 4th loan from WAGES so that she can restock on merchandise (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, tomatoes, etc.). Hodalo would like to participate in her children's education and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une dame âgée de 44 ans, divorcée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 18 et 22 ans et tous inscrits dans des centres de formation professionnelle. elle a comme activité un restaurant situé dans un quartier de la ville depuis deux ans aujourd'hui, restaurant dans lequel elle vend en plus de la nourriture des boissons hygiéniques et alcoolisées. elle vit et nourrit ses enfants depuis sa séparation avec son époux des revenus que lui génère cette petite activité. Elle bénéficie néanmoins d'une clientèle considérable et elle voudrait avec ce crédit des produits alimentaires (plantains, viande, poulets, café, lait, sucre...)et 10 casiers de boissons dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle. elle a pour ambition à court terme d'agrandir son activité et à long d'ouvrir un autre restaurant ou à défaut s'orienter vers la vente des liqueurs car la restauration l'oblige à se réveiller tôt (à 04 heures du matin) tous les jours étant donné son âge quelque peu avancé.
texts.en:
Marie is 44 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children aged between 18 and 22, all of whom are registered with vocational training centres. Marie has been running a restaurant located in a district of town for 2 years exactly. She sells soft and alcoholic drinks, as well as food, in her restaurant. Since her separation from her husband, she lives on the revenue generated by this business and it enables her to feed her children.

Marie has a significant client base and would like to use this loan to buy food products (plantains, meat, chicken, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.) and 10 cases of drinks in order to be able to satisfy her clientèle. Her short-term aim is to grow her business and, eventually, she would either like to open another restaurant or focus on selling alcohol, as running a restaurant means that she is forced to get up at 4 o'clock in the morning every day, which is early for someone of advancing age.

loans.use: to buy food products and drinks.

loans.name: Némè

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession et cela depuis 2005, Némé est mariée à un militaire. Ils ont en charge 03 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Ils sont âgés de 20, 17 et 14ans. Elle est reconnue dans son quartier par son talent. son activité se fait à domicile. En plus de la coiffure, elle vend des mèches, des produits de beauté et pagnes à ses clients. C’est pour s’approvisionner en marchandises, qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt. Elle veut épargner les profits, élargir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Némé has been a trained hairdresser since 2005. She is married to a serviceman, and they have three school-attending children in their care. They are 20, 17 and 14 years old.

Némé is well known in her neighborhood due to her talent. She's a home hairdresser. In addition to hairdressing, she also sells hair extensions, cosmetics, and pagnes (colorful African cloth) to her customers.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to get supplies. She wants to put away her profits, expand her business, and ensure her family's vital needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix est un homme âgé de 44 ans, marié et père de 04 enfants qui vont tous à l'école. il a depuis 20 ans aujourd'hui comme activité un petit garage dans lequel il répare des motos. très souvent il achète des pièces de rechange de ses clients ailleurs lorsque lors d'une réparation il constate qu'il y a une pièce défectueuse; ce qui constitue pour lui un manque à gagner énorme. Alors il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des pièces détachées pour pouvoir les revendre à ses clients en cas de besoin et ainsi accroître ses bénéfices. ces revenus lui permettront de mieux assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Félix is 44 years old, married and the father of 4 children who all go to school. He has run a garage where he repairs motorbikes for 20 years. He very often has to buy spare parts for his customers from other places, when he notices a malfunctioning part while he is making repairs; this often constitutes a large loss of earnings for him. He would therefore like to use this loan to buy spare parts so that he can resell them to his customers when they need them, and increase his profits in that way. This income will put him in a better position to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale as well as help Annet to generate greater profits and buy exercise books for her children and also add the profits into the business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jauahara

texts.en:
Jauahara is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Jauahara has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities like dry beans, sugar, and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Jauahara has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, and sugar for resale, and will help Jauahara to generate greater profits and save her profits and add some to the business capital. Jauahara hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Jauahara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Gorret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fresh food like "matooke" (green bananas). 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for resale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for resale

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en:
Hajarah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Hajarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Hajarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale, and will help Hajarah to generate greater profits and pay for the rent where she has the business. Hajarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a clothing business. 

Hajarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hajarah's future prospects by helping her own a big retail shop in town.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past one year, Esther has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair extensions for the salon, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees and rent for the business. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions for the salon

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells honey from bees. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more honey for resale, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more honey for resale.

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
Cissy's group is composed of two hard-working women. Cissy is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food, charcoal, and tomatoes. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh foods and tomatoes for resale and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and pay rent for the business. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh foods and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities like dry beans, sugar, and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans and sugar for resale. This will help Justine to generate greater profits and pay rent were she has the business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to start a chicken business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en:
Hasifa's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Hasifa is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past year, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed and more chicken birds for resale. It will also help Hasifa to generate greater profits and save her money so as to buy domestic animals in the future for resale. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and more chicken birds for resale.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 45 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells flour, sodas, beans, and bread, etc. 

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock like beans and rice to sell, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another shop. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more stock like beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Umara Tubit

texts.en:
Umara is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 6. Both of them go to school.

Umara runs a beauty salon and has been in this business for 3 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase weaves, lotions,  and other supplies.  Besides this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Umara would like to expand her business and open other branches. Her major challenge is the high prices in the market.
Umara says that she is happy about the loans given to her by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy items like hair lotions and weaves

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 33 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children,  2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer and other beverages. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer to sell, and will help Betty to generate greater profits. It will allow her to put effort into her work and then be able to pay for her children's school fees. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to move her bar to be along the highway and to also buy a plane for her self. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell at her bar.

loans.name: Ibraham

texts.es:
El señor Ibraham de 43 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos  y vive en su propia casa  de habitación junto a su esposa y algunos de sus hijos  en el  en una aldea del departamento de Choluteca, Honduras. Ibraham se dedica desde hace más de 7 años al negocio que es la venta de hamacas de todo tipo y lazos. Sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo en su negocio, sus clientes son las personas que viajan hacia la capital de Honduras ya que su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la orilla de la carretera  de su pueblo como también así vecinos, amigos, familiares, entre otros ya que también vende a domicilio.
Don Ibraham solicita su préstamo para la compra de Hamacas y lazos, para surtir más su negocio. Con el apoyo del préstamo Don Ibraham  lograra surtir un poco su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos.
El deseo de Don Ibraham es seguir trabajando con PRISMA. Su sueño es realizar mejoras a su vivienda y a su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Julio 2012
texts.en:
Ibraham is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He lives inhis own home with his wife and some of his children in a town in the department of Choluteca, Honduras. For more than 7 years, Ibraham has worked in a business selling all types of hammocks and ties. He sells every day from Monday through Sunday in his business. His customers are people who are travelling toward the capital of Honduras, since his business is located on the side of the road by his town. He also sells to neighbors, friends and family, since he also sells door to door.

Don Ibraham is asking for his loan to buy hammocks and ties to stock his business. With the support of the loan, Ibraham  will be able to stock his business a little and therefore improve his income. 

Ibraham's wish is to continue working with PRISMA. His dream is to do some improvements on his home and on his business.

San Lorenzo, Valle – Julio 2012

loans.use: to buy hammocks and ties for his business.

loans.name: Margret Jolo

texts.en:
Jolo is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 14. All of them go to school.

Jolo runs a timber-selling business and has been in business for 10 years. He has two employees.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase timbers and many other supplies. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Jolo would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs and poor roads. Jolo says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials like timbers.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer activa en el comercio, comenzo con pocos productos, hoy en día, tiene variedad en ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y pulpería, su esposo es radiotécnico,  una hija de 15 años habita con ella quien estudia la secundaria, y ayuda en la venta, el otro hijo está casado.
Este crecimiento es parte de los financiamientos que ah obtenido en catorce ciclos consecutivos, casi todos para la inversión del negocio, sastifecha ya que cuenta con sus ganancias fija, pudiendo cubrir los gastos y sus medicinas.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: dos docenas de pantalón de varón y mujer, camisas, camisetas, ropa para niños, toallas de baño. Perfume, pañales, chaqueta azulona, aumentado su ventas y con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman who is active in business. She started by selling a few products. Now she sells a variety of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and grocery items.  Her husband is a radio technician. A 15 year old daughter lives with them and goes to high school. She helps with the sales. They have a son who is married. 

This growth is part of the financing that she has obtained during fourteen consecutive cycles. Almost all of them have been to invest in her business. She is satisfied, since she has her regular income and is able to cover the expenses and her medicines.  

With this new loan she will buy: two dozen pants for men and women, shirts, children's clothes, bath towels, perfume, diapers, and jackets. This will increase her sales with her customers' demands.

loans.use: to invest in varied clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ninoska Yamaly

texts.es:
La joven Ninoska  de 25 años de edad, esta soltera  y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre y hermanas en  el departamento de Valle al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace más de 3 años al negocio que es la venta de abarrotería, refrescos, agua, jugos, granos Básicos, pan, entre otros. Sus ventas son diarias en su negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación en uno de los barrios  de su Pueblo al sur de Honduras.
Ninoska Solicita su préstamo para la compra de mercadería como Agua, Jugos, Refrescos, maíz, azúcar, manteca, arroz, aceite, pan, embutidos, carnes, pollo y condimentos para surtir más su negocio. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella lograra surtir un poco su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos, su deseo es seguir trabajando con la institución.
Ninoska su sueño es realizar mejoras a su casa y surtir más su negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su estatus de vida económico.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Julio 2012
texts.en:
Ninoska is a 25 year old young woman. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and sisters in the department of El Valle in southern Honduras. She has worked for more than 3 years in the grocery business, selling soft drinks, water, juice, basic grians, bread and more. She sells every day at her business that is located in her house in one of the neighborhoods of her town in southern Honduras.

Ninoska is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as water, juice, soft drinks, corn, sugar, lard, rice, oil, bread, deli meats, meats, chicken and condiments to stock her business. With the support of her loan she will be able to stock her business and therefore improve her income. Her wish is to keep working with the institution. 

Ninoska's dream is to do some home improvements and stock her business more to be able to improve her income and her financial quality of life.  

San Lorenzo, Valle – Julio 2012

loans.use: to buy water, juice, soft drinks, corn, sugar, lard, rice, oil, bread, deli meats, chicken and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a 41-year-old man married with 8 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been dealing in spare parts for a period of 11 years. He earned the capital to start his repair business by working as a motorcycle cyclist. Inadequate capital is the factor most affecting the business. He would like to build a permanent home and hire employees to help expand his business. Aziz wants a loan to buy spare parts for sell.

loans.use: to buy  motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine needs another loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell. She is progressing despite the hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and diversifying her business to include shoe sales. Christine's personal dream is to support her children's education and to save for her wedding since she has only been married customarily.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is aged 49 and married with four children and has been in farming for twelve years in her local hometown in Nkubu, CentralKenya. She runs her farm with the help of two farmhands and sells her produce of potatoes, tea,milk and vegetables to the local market.

Sara has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation equipment in order to start banana farming. She says this will ensure water supply  more specifically for her banana and dairy farming and earn better income to meet her family basic needs especially education of her last two children.

She mentions high cost of farm inputs as her major challenge.

loans.use: To buy irrigation equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 34 years old and married to Charles, who is a businessman and contributes to the family income. She has been running her tailoring business for a period of about nine years with an income of approximately 15,000 Kenyan shillings per month. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use this loan to buy more fabric materials and hopes to give her children quality education and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is thirty-eight years old, married, and blessed with three children. He has been a horticulture farmer for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,750.


He has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs, e.g. fertilizers and pesticides and pay for labor. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to purchase more acres of land for farming. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Domingo would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, which he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Domingo hopes to make his store a grocery store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other inventory for the store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in paying for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Mary Ann would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan so she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater earnings. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Ann hopes that her business will grow in the coming years, and she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her grocery store business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto. He previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan. He used the money to add to his savings and buy three additional computer monitors. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in paying for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Alberto would like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy more computer units. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Alberto dreams of expanding his store and sending all his children to school through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy computer monitors.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy paint and other raw materials so she can repair her fishing boat.

NWTF is relisting Conchita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy paint and other raw materials so she can repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Oyunbaatar

texts.en:
Oyunbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He is a guard at a local company and is very ambitious and hardworking. 

The family previously lived in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, but nowadays it's very hard to live in a ger because in recent years it's gotten colder every winter. In winter it is so cold that it makes it really difficult because a ger loses heat very quickly. Thus Oyunbaatar recently moved into a small house, but it isn’t completely built yet. This loan will be used to purchase necessary materials to finish the house.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials to finish building his small house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. More items will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness. 

Rita hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams that, through all her hard work, she will be able to give her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly, where she can share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem is 49 years old, married with six children and lives in the Ang Snoul district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Being a responsible father, Koem works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school. Koem works as a mobile construction worker and travels around the country with his team, providing this service. Also, in the rainy season he is dedicated to his farming business, growing rice on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, some of Koem’s older children have left school and started working in a garment factory so they can share their income and help support their younger brothers and sisters to pursue higher education in the future.

Koem would like to help his employed children with their transportation needs, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle so that his children can commute to their workplaces. This will help reduce some of their transportation expenses and increase their savings for the future of the family. This is Koem's first loan through Hattha Kaksekar Limited. He hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his children so that they can commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 44 years old and his wife, Chanthy, is 49 years old (pictured together). They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons; two are construction workers and the other attends school. 

Chantha is a fisherman, while his wife sells fish that her husband catches. 

Chantha requests his first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,000. He will use money from the loan to purchase a motorbike for his sons to drive to work and also to buy new fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en:
Maradi, age 26, has been married since 2010. His wife, Vandara, age 30, is pregnant. 

Maradi also has his sister and mother living with him. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Maradi is a driver, while his wife is a garment worker. He drives for a company from Monday to mid-Saturday. He wants to start a new business of driving a tuk tuk (a three-wheeled auto rickshaw) when he is free. 

Hence, Maradi is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk. This will help him earn extra income to better support his family.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk (a three-wheeled auto rickshaw) for his new business.

loans.name: Magsar

texts.en:
Magsar is a 40-year-old carpenter who lives with his family in the outer ger district, without the basic infrastructure of Ulaabaatar City, Mongolia. His spouse is a doctor for a local kindergarten, and their son and daughter both attend secondary school. 

Previously, his family was living in a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Now they live in a new small house, which they built using funding from Kiva. His previous two loans were for setting up a heating system and purchasing blocks. Now Magsar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to furnish a bathroom and to provide other necessary materials. 

Magsar is a very trusted repeat Kiva client. He really appreciates the funding from Kiva, and he is very thankful to all the kind Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to have his own property and to live there with his family happily, comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to furnish a bathroom and to provide other housing materials

loans.name: Sokveasna

texts.en:
Sokveasna, age 21, is single. He lives with his widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His mother is a rice farmer.  

Sokveasna is a primary school teacher. He is applying for his first Kiva loan to purchase a motorbike to drive to his job.  

Sokveasna is also a second year student in his English university. He attends weekends on Saturday and Sunday.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a weaver, while her husband, Vuthy, is a security guard. They have been married since 2000 and have two daughters. One attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sreyneang is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her husband because the old one breaks down. She will also use a part of the loan to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband and to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Phum (pictured with her loom), age 42, is a weaver. Her husband, Ry, age 51, raises cows at home. In addition the couple also grows rice when rice farming season comes. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, and they have six children: three sons and three daughters. One has full-time employment, another one is a construction worker, three attend school and the other one is still young. 

Phum is a asking for a loan of $1,500 in order to assist in her rice farming by a buying motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller to assist in her rice farming.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nelly works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Nelly is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha (pictured above) is 49 years old and her husband, Thoem, is 52 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have daughter who is married.
  
Chantha sells typical Khmer desserts, and her husband is a soldier. 

She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.name: Sophath

texts.en:
Sophath and her husband, Noeurn, have been farming for 10 years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. The couple lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. One is married, two are garment workers and the other one attends school.   

Sophath asks for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 28-year-old widow who operates a clothing stall at a local indoor market. She has rented a small stall and sells women's clothes and trousers.  She imports her products from Ereen, a border city between China and Mongolia. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase a variety of clothes for the upcoming season. August is a high shopping month in Mongolia, so she wants to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a variety clothes to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, she also sells cakes in her village, and her husband is a fisherman. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home; one is a chef for a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the other one is in school.

Touch had asked for a Kiva loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She is now applying for another loan in the amount of $200 to help her married daughter to purchase rice for sale.

loans.use: To help her daughter to purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Rudiah

texts.en:
Rudiah is 44 and has 20 years in mixed farming in her rural home in Nyamira. She runs her farm with one farmhand. She produces sorghum, maize, sweet potatoes, beans and milk. She also runs a second-hand clothes business besides farming. She is married with four children. the youngest is the only one still schooling.

Rudiah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy six dairy goats. She says raising dairy goats is the new idea, meant to counter the challenge of the high cost of animal feeds, especially for dairy cows. She hopes to earn enough income to educate her last born child.

She says the main challenge is lack of a ready market locally and the high cost of feeds, yet she has very limited land to grow her own napier grass, which is used as fodder.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
La señora María de 43 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos y vive en su propia casa  de habitación en un Barrio de Choluteca, tiene un hijo  que depende de ella económicamente, se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años al negocio que es la venta de Ropa nueva, zapatos, variedades, cosméticos, sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo en su negocio, sus clientes son las personas que frecuentan el mercado municipal de su pueblo.
