Her two daughters go to secondary school and her 5-year-old daughter and 2-year-old son stay at home. Her husband is a seasonal machinist in Bulgan Meej LLC. She started her organic dairy production business in 2007 and sells organic milk and yogurt to local residents. She used to sell organic horse milk in the summer. She is a hardworking woman who says, "I would work more confidently for my children's future if I could purchase the needed equipment to expand my business".  She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and machinery. With the equipment, she wants to produce organic curds and organic dried milk products as well as butter cream thereby increasing her household income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machinery to produce organic curds and dried milk products as well as butter cream.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina de 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos aun que solo 3 dependen de ella económicamente. Ella trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad además es dueña de un vehículo el cual utiliza como taxi el cual es su fuente de ingresos y lo maneja su esposo. En esta ocasión Carolina pide de nuestra ayuda para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo. Agradecerá la ayuda que se brinde.
texts.en:
Carolina, 43, is married and has four children, although only three of them are financially dependent on her.  She works in a "maquiladora" [foreign-owned factory] in the town.  She's also the owner of a vehicle that she uses as a taxi.  It's her source of income and her husband drives it.

Carolina is requesting our help to provide maintenance on her car.  She will be grateful for the help that is offered.

loans.use: to maintain her taxi

loans.name: Emiliana Hortencia

texts.es: Emiliana vive en la Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano el cual está en constante regeneración. Es en este sector donde tiene un bazar y ventas de confetis en su domicilio, inicio su negocio ya que en su sector no había por lo que vio la oportunidad de que su negocio respondiera. El trabajo lo maneja sola todos los días la mayor parte del tiempo ya que no necesita cerrar. En su bazar la época estudiantil es en la que más vende ya que sus productos son cuadernos, cartulinas, plumas, gelatinas, colas etc. todos sus productos le dejan un margen de utilidad del 20%. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones son las enfermedades ya que al ser soltera e independiente no habría quien le ayude con la atención. Espera conseguir el crédito ya que con el aumentaría las mercaderías que tiene para aumentar su venta, su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande para poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Emiliana lives in Isla Trinitaria, an urban sector that’s under constant renewal.  In this sector she has a general store and also sells snacks at home.  She started the business because there wasn’t any in her sector and she saw the opportunity for her business to succeed.  She runs the business by herself every day most of the time since she doesn’t need to close.  During the school year what she sells the most is notebooks, construction paper, pens, gelatin treats, soft-drinks, etc.  Her products produce a profit margin of 20%.  One of her greatest concern is illness because being single and independent she has no one to help her tend to the store.  She hopes to get the loan in order to increase the merchandise she has for sale.  Her dream is to have a larger business in order to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, construction paper, pens, gelatin and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro and his family lives at Nabbotuan. He has five children but they live separately from them. To generate an income, he has managed a farming business for almost 20 years. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He also hires laborers who helped him do farming activities. 

Casimiro has decided to avail a loan in order to improve his crop production. He is borrowing PHP25,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He will also pay for labor costs.

Casimiro aspires for a productive harvest and to gain more profits from the business. Additional revenue will be saved for the nfamily's future expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost, buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is 37 years old, and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime partner is a master of building houses, and they have 4 children. They live in the house her husband has succeeded in building thanks to his great dedication.

She is one of the successful business women of her town. For more than 12 years she has been busy selling toys in the local market. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experience and skill help her to develop her business and thus improve her living conditions. Nobody helps her with her business. She wants to develop the business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This loan will help her to buy goods for the new season and have more success in the business. She will be happy if you help her with money. She is also grateful for the support she received from the members of Imon International, as she trusts them and feels at ease with them. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of toys for the new season

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help towards the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Mariam dreams to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.en:
Qurbon is 49 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Their ages are between 3 and 16 years old. Qurbon is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Qurbon has been busy with farming for 27 years. He grows different kind of crops. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city. His elder son and daughter help him with the business.

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Qurbon is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 1600 USD so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices being commanded on an international level so that he can maintain a better standard of living and help his children continue their education.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Marie Odette

texts.en:
Marie Odette is married and has four children, aged between 10 and 22 years. She has been rice a farmer for 34 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use in seedling beds and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use in bed seedling and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old, from Nakuru, and has a child who is three years old and in school.

Julius has a quarrying business that he has been doing for the past eight years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy building materials for rental houses.

He hopes to own a quarry for stone extraction and to build more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy building materials for rental houses.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is married and has 2 children. They all still young. She has been a rice farmer for 15 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use in seedling beds and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use in bed seedlings and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Одил умный и целеустремленный человек. У него большое хозяйство, несколько десятки голов коров. Также имеет  большой участок земли, где выращивает рис, лук и кукурузу.  Он имеет большой стаж в откорме скота и в выращивание сельскохозяйственных культур. В этом большом хозяйстве помогают сыновья и жена.Также ночью он работает охранником в одном учреждении. Одил получил свой первый кредит в 2001 году для увеличения поголовья скота.На полученный кредит он хочет закупить несколько мешков корма для скота.Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Odil is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He has a large farm, consisting of several tens of cattle.  He also has a large plot of land, where he grows rice, onions and corn.  Odil has a lot of experience in fattening up livestock and growing agricultural crops.  His sons and wife help him with this large farm.  Also, he works nights as a security guard at one company.  Odil obtained his first loan in 2001 to increase livestock headcount.  He wants to use this loan to purchase several bags of livestock feed.  He is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно  живет со своими родителями.Она не замужем но она не считает себя одинокой, ее окружают ее любимая семья мать с братом.Она долгое время работает в доме для престарелых людей.  Барно умная и добрая женщина и очень любит свою работу. Но заработная плата которую она получает не хватает что бы улучшить условия проживания.Все деньги уходят только на семейные нужды. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2010 года, за этот период она купила швейную машинку,отремонтировала свой дом.На полученный кредит хочет купить пылесос о котором так долго мечтала.Она благодарна организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Barno lives with her parents.  She is not married, but does not consider herself lonely as she is surrounded by her beloved family - mother and brother.  She has been working at a retirement home for a long time.  Barno is a smart and kind woman and loves her work very much.  Unfortunately, the salary that she receives is not enough to improve her living conditions.  All of the money go toward family needs.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2010 and purchased a sewing machine and repaired her home since then.  Barno wants to use this loan to purchase a vacuum cleaner that she has been long dreaming of.  She is grateful to the organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Nebert

texts.en: Nebert is a thirty-six-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. He has been in the brick-making business for the last six years, and his main hardships are seasonal weather and high transportation costs. He has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Nebert needs a loan to buy firewood to make more bricks.

loans.use: to buy firewood to make more bricks

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 36 year old, married policeman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has four children. After realizing that his meager salary could not help him provide for his family, he bought a milling machine so as to increase his income sources.

The main hardship this client is facing is inadequate capital to purchase the cereals and delayed payment by his customers. His personal goal is to build a residential house for his family and to diversify his business to include farming. Godfrey needs the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 32 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 2 children. 

Rey has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP5,900.00 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to be used in purchasing feeds for his hog fattening business. 

Rey has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Rey hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has 4 children, aged between 6 and 18 years. She has been a rice farmer for 24 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use in seedling beds and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To use in bed seedlings and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Gs Mi Buen Jesus Group

texts.es:
La señora Benita de 53 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación dependen de ella una hija que adopto, Ella radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, y se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de pulpería en donde vende frescos, lácteos, jugos, granos básicos, verduras, tarjetas y mas.
Doña Benita esta solicitando 17,000.00 para compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, detergentes, huevos, embutidos, lácteos  y refrescos, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio también crecerá.
Doña Benita es la líder del grupo solidario, sus compañeras la señora Lidia quien se dedica a vender comida y golosinas al igual que Doña Santos quien vende ropa usada en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, han tomado a bien en nombrar a doña Benita como la líder porque ella es quien esta pendiente de sus pagos.
El deseo de doña Benita es tener un mejor negocio y que su familia este bien de salud ya que después de la muerte de su padre y su hijo hospitalizado por más de 5 meses ha quedado un poco mal y desestabilizada, su sueño es mejorar al igual que sus compañeras.
San Lorenzo, honduras – Julio 2012
texts.en:
Benita, 53, is married and lives with her husband in their home in the community of San Lorenzo.  An adopted daughter is dependent on her.  For two years she has had a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, dairy products, juices, staples, vegetables, cards, and other things.

Benita is requesting 17,000.00 [HNL] to buy corn, beans, rice, lard, detergent, eggs, sausage, dairy products, and soft drinks.  With the support of this loan she plans to improve her income, and her business will grow as well.

Benita is the leader of the solidarity group.  Her colleagues (Lidia, who sells food and candy, and Santos, who sells used clothing in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo) have done well in naming Benita the leader because she is the one who takes care of their payments.

Benita's desire is to improve her business and for her family to be well, because after the death of her father and the hospitalization of her son for more than five months she has been in a bad way and off her stride.  Her dream is to improve and for her colleagues to improve.

San Lorenzo, Honduras–July 2012

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, el socio es guia de turismo de profesion ,actualmente el trabaja en una empresa estatal hace pocos meses atras,el socio por el momento dejo de guiar pero no descarta la posibilidad mas adelante de retomar su vocacion,el socio trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia,el socio es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,el socio desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta manera poder apoyar economicamente a su familia.


El socio solicita el credito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar y algunos productos para su uso personal.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
A member of the “Amauta” communal bank, he’s a tourism guide by profession.  He’s been working for a state firm for the last few months.  For the moment, he’s left guiding aside but does not discard the possibility of restarting his vocation in the future.  He works Monday through Friday during the day.  He’s a responsible person who very much wants to continue working for his family.  He wants to continue working in order to support his family economically.

He’s requesting the loan to buy basic staple items like rice, sugar and some personal use items.  He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Era, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio y es dueña de una textilera donde fabrica y vende ponchos, mantas, carteras, sandalias, entre otros. En este tiempo como socio de FINCA Perú logró mejorar su negocio así como aumentar su mercadería, también aprendió a ahorrar y administrar de manera adecuada su negocio y su dinero, también dice que en las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal aprende a educar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus productos como hilos, lana, telas, etc.
texts.en: María’s a member of the “Nueva Era” (New Era) communal bank.  She’s 39-years-old and mother of three children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half and she owns a textile factory where she manufactures and sells ponchos, blankets, purses and sandals, among others.  In this time as a member of FINCA Perú, she succeeded in improving her business as well as in increasing her merchandise.  She also learned how to save and to manage her business and her money adequately.  She also says that the training she gets in her communal bank she learns how to educate her children.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy materials like thread, wool, fabric, etc. to make her products.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
This is Georges, a 40 year-old Lebanese unmarried man. He lives with his parents and four siblings. He had fifteen years of experiences as a barber until he decided to open his own shop in the year 2000. He opened the shop in his town as he knows all the people and because most of them are really close to him. Georges always seeks to please his clients and respond to their needs whatever they are. In parallel, he has a second job which he thinks is going to help him bring added income for his family.

Georges is asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l in order to buy new barbering supplies for his shop and some related products such as gel, shampoo, etc.  He notes that this Kiva loan will better improve his work, therefore allowing him to attract added customers and increase his revenues by 20%.  Georges is not ready to take a new step in his life until he’s financially satisfied and this is why he’s trying his best to develop his work and enlarge his business sooner.

loans.use: to buy new barbering supplies for his shop in addition to some related products such as gel, shampoo, etc...

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has seven children between the ages of four and eighteen. She has been a rice farmer for four years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use for a seedling bed and for labor costs. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to set up a seedling bed and cover labor costs

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter contributes a little to the household income, and her husband passed away. She started a recycled material trade business in 1998. Today, Battulga is very experienced with the recycled materials trade business, and her customers appreciate her as a diligent woman. She wants to expand her business, so she needs 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a hybrid car to carry recycled materials to the trade center. Battulga would like to expand her business. She expects a major improvement in her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase a hybrid car to carry secondary raw materials to the trade center

loans.name: Otgontogtoh

texts.en:
Otgontogtoh, a 47-year-old widow, lives with her daughter in a ger in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter is pregnant and on her maternity leave, while her son-in-law is working in Korea.

Otgontogtoh, who has been selling clothes with her friends at the Narantuul market since 2005, is now planing to retail clothes by herself at a rental counter in a market. Hard-working and quiet-natured, she requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy inventory for her new business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her new business.

loans.name: Zulita

texts.es:
Zulita tiene 39 años, es una mujer emprendedora y amante del trabajo. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 18 y 15 años y el último de 2 meses. Viven en la casa que construyeron como resultado de años de trabajo, esfuerzo y ahorro.

Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle, no solo por ese motivo, sino también por la calidad de las marcas de los artículos que ofrece, además de eso el trato tan cordial y la amabilidad. Recuerda que cuando se inició en este negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda, ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas. Lleva en este negocio 2 años y siempre recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega y complementarlo con la crianza de su pequeño bebé, aún cuando se siente cansada sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, pues espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy agradecida al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000), comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, verduras, frutas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Zulita is 39 years old and is an enterprising woman who loves to work. Together with her partner she has three children ages 18, 15, and the last is two months old. They live together in the home they built through years of hard work, effort, and savings.

She works selling groceries and basic necessities. Every day, starting very early, she opens the doors of her store to attend to her customers who come all the way to her store with the confidence that there they will find what they need. Her shop is the most well stocked in her neighborhood, and her clients never hesitate to buy from her, not only for that reason but also because of the quality of the brands that she offers and her cordial and friendly service. She remembers that when she started out in this business she did not have a lot of products to offer and so could not make good sales during the day; however, she sought a solution, saved up a little capital, and gradually was able to put together her small store. Now sales are going very well for her. She has been in this business for two years and always has the help of her spouse. What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her customers and watching them start the day with a smile. The most difficult thing about her work is getting up early to open the shop and balancing this with the care of her young baby, though when she feels tired she knows that this is her work and that it has to get done. For this reason she hopes her business will grow and provide her better income.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very grateful knowing that she has financial assistance and can thus feel more confident moving forward with her business. She also pledges to make punctual payments of her dues. She is happy to belong to her community bank, as all of its members are very responsible and caring. With the money requested (S/. 1000), she will buy additional products with which to stock her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.use: to buy additional products with which to stock her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Agua Marina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA MARINA” iniciará el ciclo decimo primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, venta de espejos, costura de busos, venta de galletas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es una integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su comadre quien es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de galletas por mayor desde hace varios años, siendo este una iniciativa propia de mejoramiento.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de galletas) que comprará de la fábrica distribuidora y posteriormente lo comercializará en la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Agua Marina" will start its eleventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of six members and is led by a board of directors where Ms. Maxima is the president. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied: braided blankets, selling mirrors, sewing of sportswear, and selling of cookies.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen, of which Ms. Maxima is a member. She says it has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling cookies wholesale, which she has had for several years, being that it's her own initiative for improvement. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital to buy cookies that she will buy from the distributing factory and later sell in the city of Cochabamba. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María empezó su negocio de comidas desde muy joven cuando se separo de su esposo, trabajo para poder mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, ahora son mayores de edad y le ayudan en los dos negocios que tiene. La atención la realiza desde muy temprano con la ayuda de sus hijos, su horario empieza desde las 06:00 de la mañana hasta las 21:00 de la noche ya que al salir de sus trabajos tiene más clientes. Gracias a su sazón tiene muchos clientes, también los precios influyen en las ventas por ejemplo los almuerzos los vente a un costo de $2.25, los platos a la carta $ 4.00 y el pollo asado $ 12.00, el pollo por la general lo vende más en las tardes. Con el préstamo que está solicitando va a comprar implementos para su restaurant como sillas, mesas, platos y también productos para la preparación de la comida. Como es separa y le ayudan sus hijos le gustaría a futuro poder abrir otro local para ayudarle a sus hijos y así puedan mantener a su familia.
texts.en: María started her food business when still very young when she separated from her husband.  She worked in order to support her children and move them forward.  Now, they are all adults and they help her in the two businesses she has.  She starts tending to customers very early with help from her children. Her schedule starts at 6am and goes until 9pm because when people get off work she gets more customers.  Thanks to her tasty preparation she has many customers; her prices also influence sales.  For example, she sells lunch for $2.25, a la carte dishes are $4.00 and roasted chicken is $12.00; she sells the chicken generally in the evening.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy implements for her restaurant like tables, chairs, dishes and also ingredients to prepare the meals.  Since she’s separated, her children help her and she’d like in future to be able to buy another locale to help her children so that they can support their families.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, dishes and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Armando Matias

texts.es: El cliente el señor Armando es un hombre humilde que apenas termino la secundaria gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, trabaja desde sus 17 años de ayudante en una fábrica pero no recibía los beneficios sociales que le correspondían, a los 2 años de trabajar le promovieron para el puesto de empleado de planta como operador adquiriendo todos los beneficios sociales que le corresponden, pero su buena suerte no duro mucho ya que sus padres murieron en un accidente de tránsito a los días  que ya trabajaba como operador de planta, le dejaron a él y a sus 9 hermanos como herencia su casa, se repartieron entre todos los hermanos pero él no cuenta con dinero suficiente para poder construir un cuarto para que pueda vivir ahí, motivo por el cual es el presente crédito, con el dinero que le financiaremos el comprara los materiales de construcción y el construirá ya él tiene experiencia de trabajar como albañil.
texts.en:
The client, Armando, is a modest man who just finished high school thanks to his effort and dedication. Since he was 17, he has worked as a helper in a factory, but wasn't receiving his rightful social benefits. After two years of working there, they promoted him to the position of plant operator, and he aquired all his rightful social benefits. 

But his good fortune did not last long, as his parents died in a traffic accident at the time he was already working as a plant operator. They left their house to him and his nine siblings as an inheritance. They shared it out among all the siblings, but he does not have enough money to be able to build a room so that he can live there. This is the reason for the present loan. 

With the money from the loan, he will buy the construction materials and do the building, as he has experience as a bricklayer.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гульнар 48 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей.  Гульнар в качестве источника дохода для семьи занимается полеводством и садоводством.  Начатое в 1996 году со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство с 2,5 га земли с картофелем приносит  прибыль около 2 ,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян. Доходы Гульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства за счет приобретения скота.
texts.en: Gulnar is 48 years old, a widow and has four children.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in farming and gardening.  The business, started in 1996 with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS) and 2.5 hectares of land, yields a profit of about 2,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Gulnar requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by buying livestock.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rosa Amelia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Amelia lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa de 42 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio de cerdo, comida y nacatamales (plato típico a base de maíz y cerdo). Este negocio lo inicio hace 4 años a ver que en su barrio nadie destazaba cerdo y decidió intentar a ver cómo le iba. 
Las otras integrantes son Mariela quien vende ropa desde hace 3 años y María Esperanza quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 5 años.
texts.en: The “Rosa Amelia” group has three hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Rosa, 42, who sells pork, food and nacatamales (traditional dish made from corn and pork).  She started the business four years ago when she noticed that no one in her neighborhood was butchering pigs and she decided to see how she’d do.  The other group members are Mariela who has sold clothes for three years and María Esperanza who has had a grocery store for five years.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Romers

texts.es: Romers pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Era, tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero. Es socio de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio, es dueño de un negocio de fabricación de muebles. Él dice que como socio de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar ya que antes no lo hacía, también aprendió la puntualidad, gracias a ello pudo mejorar su negocio. Está agradecido con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrecen y también por las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal donde le enseñan como administrar su negocio. Su sueño es formar una empresa grande y que sea reconocida a nivel nacional y más. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina que se llama ruteadora y que sirve para dar forma a la melanina que es unos de los materiales que emplea para elaborar muebles.
texts.en: Romers belongs to the “Nueva Era” (New Era) communal bank.  He’s 22-years-old and single.  He’s been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half.  He owns a furniture making business.  He says that as a member of FINCA Perú he’s learned how to save, something he didn’t used to do.  He also learned punctuality and thanks to it his business has improved.  He’s grateful to the institution for the easy loan terms they offer and also for the training he gets in his communal bank where they teach him how to manage his business.  His dream is to form a large firm that will be known at the national level and beyond.  The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy a machine called a router that’s used to shape pressed wood which is one of the materials used in furniture making.

loans.use: to buy a router.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 33 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей 9 и 11 лет.  Рыскул работает библиотекарем с школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 1998 году со стартовой суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство на сегодня насчитывает 10 голов овец, 1 дойную корову с приплодом и приносит  прибыль около 10 ,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков на откорм. Доходы Рыскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства за счет приобретения скота.
texts.en: Ryskul is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are nine and eleven years old.  She works as a librarian at a school and, to provide an additional source of income for the family, is involved in animal husbandry.  The business, started in 1998 with an initial sum of 8,000 som (KGS), today contains ten sheep and one dairy cow with offspring, and yields a profit of about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Ryskul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by buying livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 22 years old, married and has one child. She has a sari-sari (food and variety shop) where she sells snacks, noodles, bread, drinks like colas, fruit juices, coffee and milk, personal care products like soap, shampoo and lotion, and more.

Lorena has been with HSPFI since 2012. Since she needs to earn more to support her family, she is applying for a 5000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her shop.

Lorena is looking forward to growing her business so she can improve her family’s standard of living and provide food and education for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Laurel Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Laurel lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras, la coordinadora es Mayra Ofelia de 52 años. Ella tiene un cafetín en un colegio el cual inicio vendiendo gaseosa, refrescos, chiverías…etc. además comercializa ropa y calzado. Con el crédito anterior logro cumplir con los pedidos solicitados y aumentar el cafetín.
Este préstamo lo invertirá en mercadería en ropa y calzado.
Las otras integrantes son Margarita de 27 años quien es comerciante de ropa y zapatos, y Ana quien vende helados, sopa, ropa y calzado.
texts.en: The “Laurel” group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  The coordinator is Mayra Ofelia, 52.  She has a snack bar at a school that she started by selling soft-drinks, refreshments, snacks, etc.  She also sells clothes and footwear.  She used the previous loan to fill pending orders and enlarge the snack bar.  This loan will be used to buy clothes and footwear.  The other group members are Margarita, 27, who sells clothes and shoes and Ana who sells ice-cream, soup, clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Ana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es Arquitecta de profesión y tiene un estudio de arquitectura donde realiza trabajos de proyectos de construcción y consultoría para sus diferentes clientes. Ana quiere implementar su estudio de arquitectura y para ello invertirá su préstamo, y comprará algunos muebles de oficina y material de trabajo actualizado como papel y escuadras nuevas. La socia quiere realizar cambios en su oficina, porque esto representa mejorar su imagen profesional y genera confianza para sus clientes.
Ana está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana belongs to the “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi” (Children of Qolquewasi) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She’s an architect by profession and has an architect’s studio where she does construction projects and provides consulting services to various clients.  Ana wants to equip her office and will invest in a loan to do so.  She will buy some office furniture and up-to-date supplies like paper and new T-square rulers.  She wants to make some changes to her office in order to present a more professional image thus generating trust in her clients.  Ana is very happy and grateful to KIVA for giving her an opportunity to improve her family’s quality of life and helping her to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy office ffurniture, and work tools like paper and t-square rulers.

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tayson lo conforman tres mujeres  trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Cecilia quien tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio con chiverías actualmente gracias a los créditos la ha ido surtiendo con mayor variedad de productos y su meta es tener una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel quien vende verduras desde hace 30 años y Juana quien es costurera actividad de inicio a la edad de 13 años y el cual puso su taller a los 30 años.
texts.en:
The Tayson group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. One of these women is Cecilia who runs a small business which she started with the income she earned from doing odd jobs. Currently, due to the loans she has received, she has increased her range of stock and her aim is to set up a small grocery store.
The other group members are Maribel, who has been selling vegetables for the last 30 years, and Juana has been a seamstress since the age of 13 and set up her own workshop when she was 30 years old.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has one child aged seven. He has been a rice farmer for 25 years.

Emmanuel is applying for a 624,400 RWF loan from UOB to use to buy and plant seedlings and pay for labor on his farm. He plans to use the profits to pay for medical insurance and school fees for his child. He also wants to lay some away in savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy and plant seedlings and pay for labor on his farm.

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Basikungoma est leader du groupe d’affaire Umoja Kibaba. Elle est entrepreneur, âgé de 44 ans et mère de 12 enfants  dont 5 étudient et les autres n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers. Son mari est un mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de Fanta. Elle expose ses produits dans un petit kiosque. Elle commença cette micro entreprise depuis sa jeunesse. Plus tard, elle accéda aux crédits de Hekima. Actuellement, elle vient de réaliser 11 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettre d’acheter 15 casiers de Fanta. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et y construire confortablement. Le grand défi de son activité est qu’elle paye trop de taxes de l’administration publique. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The borrower Basikungoma is the leader of the business group Umoja Kibaba.  She is a business woman, 44 years old, and the mother of 12 children.   Only five of them attend school because there is not enough money to send them all.  Her husband is a mechanic.  The borrower sells Fanta.  She displays her products in a small kiosk.  She started this micro-business when she was young.  Later, she received loans through Hekima.   Now, she has been through 11 loan cycles through the micro-loan program with Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to buy 15 cases of Fanta.  She hopes to buy a parcel of land and build a comfortable house.  The main challenge faced by her business is that she pays too much in taxes to the public administration.  Therefore, she is grateful to Hekima for its support of small business owners.

loans.use: to buy 15 cases of Fanta.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Actualmente está separada del padre de sus hijos, pero esto no la ha desanimado, vive en su casa propia, la que construyó como resultado de su trabajo tras muchos años de ahorro, en compañía de sus 4 hijos, su nuera y su nieto, a los que quiere mucho. 

Su actividad es la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de palma aceitera, pues lo ha visto como un negocio sumamente rentable. Para eso cuenta con un terreno de 20 hectáreas, de las cuales seis se encuentran en constante producción. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, gracias al incentivo del gobierno regional de su ciudad que le proporcionaron las semillas seleccionadas bajo un proyecto de extensión agrícola del cual forma parte. Trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes le brindan su ayuda en todas las labores agrícolas. Le gusta esta actividad porque ha visto que le resulta bastante rentable, pues el producto que vende tiene un buen precio en el mercado. Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta el momento está planeando complementar su negocio con la construcción de un piscigranja (criadero de peces) o un criadero de cerdos y de esta forma continuar generando más ingresos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito y le brindan el apoyo necesario que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, asegura que se siente cómoda trabajando con su banco comunal, pues ha visto que son personas solidarias y colaboradoras.
Con el monto solicitado, de 600 nuevos soles, invertirá en el pago del personal para el proceso de cosecha de sus parcelas de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Justina is 34 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a lot of desire to progress and get ahead. Currently, she is separated from the father of her children, but this has not discouraged her. She lives in her own house, that which she constructed as a result of her hard work after many years of saving, in the company of her four children, her daughter-in-law and her grandson, all of whom she loves very much.
Her business is agriculture, specifically growing oil palms, since she saw it as a very profitable business. For this she has twenty hectares of land, of which six are always in production. She was been doing this for four years, thanks to the incentives from the regional government in her city that provides her with the seeds selected under an agricultural extension project of which she forms a part. She works with the support of her children, who help her in all of the agricultural activities. She likes this business, because she has seen that it is quite profitable, since the product she sells has a good price on the market. Seeing the good results that she has now, she is planning to supplement her business by constructing a fish farm (to raise fish) or a pig farm and in this way continue to generate more income. 
This is her second loan with MFP, therefore she is grateful to those that make this loan possible and provide the necessary support that can make her plans come true. She also assures us that she feels comfortable working with her communal bank, since she has seen that they are supportive and collaborative people.
With the requested amount of 600 new Peruvian soles, she will invest in paying labour to process the harvest from her plots of oil palm.

loans.use: to hire labour to process the harvest from her plots of oil palm.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.es: Ethel pertenece al Banco Comunal Pureza, tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos (1 varón y una mujer). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y es dueña de un negocio donde vende y repara motos. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido la importancia de los ahorros y de la puntualidad. Su sueño para el futuro es abrir otro local de venta de motos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de llantas de motos para vender en su negocio.
texts.en: Ethel belongs to the Pureza Communal Bank. She is 23 years old, she lives with her partner and is a mother to two children (1 boy and 1 girl). She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the last three years and she owns a business where she sells and repairs motorcycles.During her time as a FINCA Perú member she has learned the importance of saving money and punctuality. Her dream for the future is to open another motorcycle shop. The loan that she is currently applying for will be invested in buying motorcycle tires to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle tires to sell in her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother of six children. She manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Remedios runs a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Remedios earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Remedios is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Remedios hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Sonrisa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sonrisa lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana Patricia quien vende ropa, Auralila quien comercializa ropa y cosméticos  y Sandra quien vende piñatas y bolsos.
Ana Patricia de 39 años de edad inicio su negocio con la comercialización de productos AVON  luego poco a poco con las ganancias fue invirtiendo en ropa, perfumes…etc. El crédito lo invertirá en el negocio.
texts.en:
The Sonrisa Group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women: Ana Patrica who sells clothing, Auralila who sells clothing and cosmetics and Sandra who sells piñatas and bags.
Ana Patricia is 39 years old and she started her business by selling AVON products; later, with the earnings she had received, she invested in clothing, perfumes... etc. This loan will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Ana Marcelina

texts.es: Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lealtad, tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos varones. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y se dedica a la venta de carne. En este tiempo que viene trabajando con FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido la importancia de los ahorros y de la responsabilidad. Su sueño para el futuro es arreglar su casa para que sea más cómoda para ella y para su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, para la compra de carne para vender.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the communal bank 'Lealtad.'  She is 45 years old and has two sons with her common-law husband.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 5 years.  She has a business selling meat.  During her time with FINCA Perú, she has learned the importance of savings and being responsible.  Her dream for the future is to be able to make improvements to her home so that it will be more comfortable for her family.  

She will use the loan funds to purchase meat for resale.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 64 years old, married and has two children. For the past year she has run a shop where she sells groceries and other consumable products.

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for a year. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her store. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old. She is married to Stephen. Together they have two children. She sells cereals and has been in this business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by some of their credit officers. She will use the loan to purchase more cereals to sell.

She hopes to start selling her cereals in wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with three children. She is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.       
Mary Ann is a farmer and grows palay crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs.                                                  
Mary Ann has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Reymond

texts.en:
Reymond is 26 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.
 
Reymond provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for his motorcycle's gasoline.

Reymond has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Reymond hopes to improve his services so he can afford his studies.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for his motorcycle's gasoline

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is single. He has been a rice grower for 12 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to use for seedling beds and labor costs. He plans to use the profits for savings and to pay for medical insurance.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37 per cent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 per cent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 per cent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use for seedling beds and labor costs.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos.  Se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, papa y verduras que lleva a la selva a vender. Gracias a la institución aprendió a ahorrar y le enseñaron a practicar lo valores, con sus ahorros y las ganancias de su negocio está educando a sus hijos, las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal también le enseñan a educar en su hogar a sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia donde pueda vivir con sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como papa, verduras y frutas.
texts.en: Constantina belongs to the Anabella Communal Bank.  She is 44 years old, and single mother of three children. Her business is buying and selling fruit, potatoes and vegetables that she takes to the jungle to sell. Thanks to the institution, she learned to save, and they taught her to put her values into practice. With her savings and the profits from her business, she is educating her children. The trainings that she receives from the Communal Bank also teach them to educate their children at home. Her biggest dream is to have her own home where she can live with her children. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of merchandise such as potatoes, vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as potatoes, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis pertenece al Banco Comunal Lealtad, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo varón. Es socio de FINCA Perú hace 1 años y medio y se dedica a la venta de carne. En este tiempo que tiene trabajando con FINCA Perú, él ha aprendido la importancia de ahorrar y ser responsable. Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa propia donde pueda vivir con su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá la compra de carne.
texts.en:
Luis belongs to the communal bank 'Lealtad.'  He is 32 years old and has a son with his common-law wife.

He has been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half, and he has a business selling meat.  During his time with FINCA Perú, he has learned the importance of savings and being responsible.  His dream for the future is to build his own home where he can live with his family.

He will use the loan funds to purchase meat for resale.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Marili Lourdes

texts.es: Marili pertenece al Banco Comunal Maria de los Ángeles, tiene 50 años de edad, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio. Ella se dedica a la venta de vinos y bebidas. Ella dice que FINCA Perú ha sido un gran apoyo para ella y su familia. Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse un carro que le permita movilizar la mercadería. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, para la compra de vinos, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos.
texts.en: Marili belongs to the communal bank Maria de los Ángeles.  She is a divorced mother of three adult children (two women and a man).  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half.  She has a business selling wine and other drinks.  She says that FINCA Perú has been of great help to her and her family.  Her dream for the future is to buy a car, which will allow her to take her merchandise wherever she needs to.  She will invest the loan  funds in her business, purchasing wine, juice and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy wine, juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Hasan  jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Hasan uje 11 let rabotayet voditelem on vodit mikroavtobus. Hasan trudolubiviy chelovek on mnogo rabotayet chtobi obespechit svoyu semyu. Hasan ochen nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya togo chto bi pochinit svoy mikroavtobus dlya udobstva i konforta passajirov. Hasan etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata.
texts.en:
Hasan is married and has three children. He lives in the Baku region together with his family. 

Hasan has been working as a driver for 11 years. He drives a microbus. Hasan is a hard-working person. He works a lot in order to provide for his family. 

Hasan is very much in need of 1,000 AZN in order to buy parts to fix his microbus for the convenience and comfort of his passengers. Hasan started this business with his older brother.

loans.use: to buy parts

loans.name: Ever

texts.en:
Ever is 32 years old, married and has two children. For the past six years Ever has run a sari-sari (a food and retail shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks, home and personal care products, beverages, etc.

Ever became a member of HSPFI this year. She is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her sari-sari. Ever hopes to improve her business so she can finance her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is single with no children. Julia is 62 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Julia sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 40 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional fish to sell.

Julia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Julia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es: Donatilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 13 años, y es dueña de un restaurante. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella logró  que su restaurante crezca, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, a administrar su negocio, a educar a sus hijos y en lo personal también le ayudo a mejorar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes e ingredientes para la preparación de la comida que ofrece en su restaurante.
texts.en: Donatilda belongs to the Anabella Communal Bank. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 13 years and owns a restaurant. During the time that she has been a member of FINCA Perú, she has achieved the growth of her restaurant. Thanks to the trainings that she receives from the Communal Bank, she learned to save, administer her business, and educate her children. It also helped her improve personally. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of groceries and ingredients for the preparation of the food that she offers in her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: Katia pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de pescado en otra cuidad. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella logró ahorrar y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, también aprendió la puntualidad y responsabilidad; ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal son muy buenas porque le enseñan a educar a sus hijos y a administrar de manera adecuada su dinero. Su sueño es construir su casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pescados y mariscos.
texts.en: Katia belongs to the Anabella Communal Bank. She is 54 years old and the single mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years. She sells fish in another city. In her time as a member of FINCA Perú, she managed to save and provide her children with a good education. She also learned punctuality and responsibility. She says that the trainings she receives in the Communal Bank are very good, because they teach her to educate her children and to administer her money well. Her dream is to construct her own home. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of fish and seafood.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: Busharipa

texts.ru: Бушарипе 49 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  Бушарипа работает в преподавателем в школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи занимается садоводством, в частности выращиванием малины.  Начатое в 2002 году хозяйство с малиновым садом приносит  прибыль около 10 ,000 сом (KGS) в сезонные месяцы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буширпа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений. Доходы Бушарипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства за счет увеличения кустов малины и других ягод.
texts.en: Busharipa is 49 years old, married and has four children.  She works as a school teacher and, to provide an additional source of income for the family, is involved in gardening, specifically in growing raspberries.  The business, started in 2002 with a raspberry garden yields a profit of about 10,000 som (KGS) during the seasonal months.  In order to further develop her business, Busharipa requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business by increasing the number of raspberry bushes and other berries.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fatma

texts.ru: Fatma jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi detmi. Ona imeyet 2 detey sina i dochku. Fatma razvelas so svoim mujem i teper soderjit svoix detey odna. Ona uje 4 qoda kak imeyet etot magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Fatma nujdayetsya v 1700 AZN chtobi kupit produti dlya prodaji v magazine i razvitiya svoyego biznessa, dlya uvelicheniya mesachnix doxodov ,chtobi ona mogla obespechit svoyu semyu. Yeyo sin pomogayet Fatme po yeyo rabote.
texts.en:
Fatma lives with her children in the Baku region. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Fatma divorced her husband and now is raising their children alone. She has had a store for four years to sell food products. 

Fatma needs 1,700 AZN to buy products for sale in her store and to develop her business. With the increase in her monthly income, she will be able to provide for her family. Her son helps Fatma in her work.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 51 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has been earning a living from buying and selling second-hand furniture. He earns a monthly income of KES 90,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use for purchasing more tables and seats. 

He plans on using the anticipated profit to open another branch. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more tables, chairs, and stools

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталье 55 лет, одна воспитала 2 детей.  Наталья в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается разведением домашней живности. Начатое в 2007 году с покупки 2 свиней хозяйство приносит  прибыль около 6 ,000 сом (KGS) в месяц и насчитывает на сегодня 2 коровы, 4 свиней, 70 гусей. Также, Наталья подрабатывает, оказывая услуги местному населению в виде прополки земли и др. мелких работ по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 свиней и 1 нетели. Доходы Наталья планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Natalya is 55 years old and raising two children on her own. As the main source of income for her household, Natalya has been breeding animals. Begun in 2007 with the purchase of two pigs, she now makes a profit of around 6,000 som (KGS) a month and today has two cows, four pigs, and 70 geese. Natalya also earns money by providing services to the local population by weeding the earth and other small jobs around the farm. 

In order to further develop her business, Natalya contacted Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of four pigs and one heifer. Natalya plans to invest revenues to further expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher, a 37-year-old married father of a 16-year-old in school, has been an economist for three years, a satisfying career but one that brings in little income. It does not allow Alisher to provide for the needs of his family and build the big house his family needs. He wants to construct one that has two bedrooms, a large living-room, a verandah and a kitchen.

This loan will help Alisher buy building materials to build the house. In this way he will provide high-quality living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and wood for building a new house.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old, married and has two children. For the past five years Marites has been making and selling snacks such as rice cakes, hot cakes and rice candy.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. She is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan from HOFOKAM to buy ingredients such as sugar, butter, flour and rice to produce her snacks. Her ambition is to grow her snack business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Gulmairam

texts.ru: Гульмайрам 40 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В 2002 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гульмайрам начала бизнес в животноводстве со сбережений в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 дойные коровы,  7 овец, 4 нетели, 13 коз, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Гульмайрам обрабатывает 8 соток поливной земли и 16 соток богарной с клевером и пшеницей.  Для обработки зерновых, муж Гульмайрам соорудил маленькую мельницу, которая приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в сезонные месяцы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 102,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота - молодняка. В будущем, Гульмайрам хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulmairam is 40 years old, married, and has three children. 

Searching for a source of income for her family, Gulmairam started a business in 2002 raising animals with savings amounting to 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tenacity and perseverance, today her farm consists of two dairy cows, seven sheep, four heifers, and 13 goats. Her monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS) from the sale of dairy and milk products. Gulmairam also works eight acres of irrigated land and 16 acres of non-irrigated clover and wheat. For the processing of grain, her husband built a small mill that brings in about 7,000 som (KGS) in the seasonal months. 

In order to further develop her business, Gulmairam approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 102,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of cattle -- calves. In the future, Gulmairam wants to increase her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу 60 лет, вдова, имеет 6 детей. С 2010 года Жумабубу  занимается бизнесом в животноводстве, начав его со сбережений в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 дойные коровы,  5 овец, 5 коз, 1 рабочая лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота - молодняка. В будущем, Жумабубу хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес за счет постройки сарая.
texts.en:
Jumabubu is 60 years old, a widow, and has six children. 

Since 2010, Jumabubu has been engaged in the business of raising animals, beginning with her savings of 80,000 som (KGS). Thanks to tenacity and perseverance, her household today has two dairy cows, five sheep, five goats, and a workhorse. Her monthly income is around 4,000 som (KGS) from the sale of dairy and meat products. 

In order to further develop her business, Jumabubu approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of cattle -- calves. In the future, Jumabubu wants to increase her farm and expand her business by building a shed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 58 years old, married to Benson and has five children ranging in age between seven and twenty years. She has run a grocery business for nine years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is Beatrice’s second loan application with KADET LTD; she successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to buy fruits such as oranges, mangoes and vegetables to resell. She plans to plow the anticipated profits back into her business and pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice plans to continue managing her business well and providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy fruit to resell.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 28 years old and from Gaza. He is married and lives with his wife.

He owns a barbershop and has been working in it for 10 years. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a chair and some equipment for the barbershop. He hopes that the number of customers will increase and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a chair and some equipment for the barbershop.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат женщина в возрасте 38 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Опыт в этой сфере деятельности  более 3 лет. Она является порядочной, добросовестной, пунктуальной и постоянной клиенткой нашей организации с 2009 года. Этот кредит Малохат – 7 по счету. На полученный кредит хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, закупить сезонную школьную одежду. Она хочет заработать побольше денег чтобы её муж не уезжал в РФ на заработки и был рядом с детьми и помогал ей их растить. Малохат выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Malohat is 38-year-old woman, is married and has three children. She sells children's clothing and shoes. She has more than three years experience in this area. 

She is decent, honest, punctual, and a regular customer of our organization since 2009. This loan is Malohat's seventh consecutive loan. 

With the loan received, she wants to increase her turnover and to purchase seasonal school uniforms. She wants to earn more money so that her husband didn't have to go to Russia and could be close to the children and could help them grow. 

Malohat expresses her gratitude to our organization for financial support.

loans.use: to buy a seasonal assortment of school clothes

loans.name: Dogodogo Group

texts.fr:
Kezie fait partie du groupe Dogodogo  et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 50 ans et est mariée à Phines, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de  9 à 30 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de la pâte froide  depuis 13 ans. Cette pâte est préparée à partir du manioc cuit.

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de manioc pour la préparation d’une grande quantité de pâte froide à revendre, pour gagner plus.   

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Kezie is part of the group Dogodogo and lives in Cibitoke. She is 50 years old and married to Phines, a farmer. Together they have six children, from 8 to 30 years old.

She has been doing commerce in 'pâte froide' for thirteen years. This is made from cooked cassava. 

She is on her tenth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of cassava to make a large amount of 'pâte froide' to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, she would like to see her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of cassava for making 'pâte froide'.

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Naciones Unidas lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellos son Geyssel quien vende ropa, Maritza quien tiene una comideria, Enma Rosa comerciante de ropa  y Julio comerciante de ropa.
Geyssel de 23 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 4 años aproximadamente negocio que inicio con la liquidación de su esposo. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería y su meta es tener un local propio.
texts.en: The United Nations group is made up of four hard-working and entrepreunerial people, who are: Geyssel who sells clothes, Maritza who sells food, Enma Rosa who sells clothes, and finally Julio who also sells clothes.  Geyssel is 23 years old and has been selling clothes for approximately 4 years when she started the business with her husband's settlement.  She will invest the loan towards merchandise and her goal is to one day have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Sodbayar

texts.en:
Sodbayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife, Myagmarsuren, and daughter in his own little house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His daughter is newly born. He has been running an organic milk trading business since childhood and he also started an agriculture business in 2000. 

Currently he grows oats in a 20 hectare field. Now his organic dairy farm has a 17 cows, 5 oxen and 3 calfs. His wife helps with his business. His business is sustainable because he has gained many regular customers. He is a clever and humble man who said, ''When I get a loan, I want to buy six more milk cows to increase the production volume and sales."  He is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to buy a good breed of cows/calves.

loans.use: to buy a good breed of cows/calves.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia. She previously took out a 20,000 PHP loan from CCT that she used to buy a variety of grocery items and products needed to stock her shop. Her profits were a big help in paying for her child’s school fees and personal, household and business expenses.

Olivia would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. Her philosophy: the more items displayed in the store, the better, which leads to better profits. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for her child’s school fees. She looks forward to this increase in income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

All CCT community clients, of which Olivia is one, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is fifty years old and is married with two children aged fifteen and twenty years. For the past twelve years she has earned a living by selling plastic bottles.

Jane has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more plastic bottles to add to her stock. Her ambition is to open a waste recycling business.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bottles.
